name: Huge 10b/10b lodge near New River Gorge sleeps 32
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located 10 miles to the New River Gorge NP and less than 5 to Babcock SP, The Ponderosa Lodge and Farm is situated on 16 very private acres.  This unique 10,000 square foot lodge has 10 guest bedrooms, each with their own private bath and comfortably sleeps 32.  The New River Gorge area is known for its world class whitewater, rock climbing, hiking, biking, fishing, and more.  Hosts live onsite in a separate apartment, assisting guests with anything they may need and providing farm tours.

We are usually present in an on-site private residence.  However, we very occasionally have military duty when we can’t be present.

The Ponderosa Lodge and Farm is situated on 16 very private, rural, mountainous acres approximately  5 miles to Babcock State Park and 10 miles to The New River Gorge National Park and Preserve.

There is plenty of parking.

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion - A Historic Mountain Home
photos/15/caption: Main staircase
photos/16/caption: Back entrance and staircase
photos/23/caption: Room #3 - The Major Cecil Room (Downstairs)
photos/29/caption: Bathroom (Room #6)
photos/31/caption: Room #8 - The Colonel May Room (Upstairs)
photos/33/caption: Room #10 - The Nicketti Johnston Room (Upstairs)

photos/37/caption: Upstairs hall
sectionedDescription/description:
John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia senator and judge of Tazewell County, built this lovely historic home in 1859. The residence is conveniently positioned within a short stroll from Tazewell Main Street on a 3.16-acre lot. The Johnston family erected the house to showcase their accomplishments because they were highly renowned in thier native Virginia. The owners of this lovely property for the longest period of time were A.Z. Litz and his wife Etta V. Stauber. Experience history!

The interior of the home is focused on a large central hallway that serves as the main avenue of traffic and the entrance area to the adjacent rooms. Three of the bedrooms are situated on the ground floor, including the The Litz Suite, The Etta V. Room and The Jack May Room. Also, on the ground floor you will find the kitchen, dining room, living room and game room. 

The central hallway flows into a large, wide staircase that provides access to the second floor. On the second floor, lower landing you will find a cozy sitting area and access to three more of the bedrooms: The Mary May Room, The Hopkins Room and The Doctor Johnston Suite. On the second floor, upper landing you will find the remaining four bedrooms:  The Nelle May Room, The Colonel May Room, The John Johnston Room and the Nicketti Johnston Room. The second floor also leads to a spacious upper-level balcony that overlooks the vast front lawn. 

Just outside the front door, you will find the large front porch with rocking chairs perfect for soaking up the outdoors. And to the side there is a rustic fire pit and sitting area so you can catch up with your friends and family….in all, this home is a perfect place to rest, relax and enjoy the mountains of Appalachia.

Rooms:

1) The Litz Suite: The Litz Suite pays homage to A.Z. Litz, in which the mansion as we know it today is named. The cozy bedroom features a queen-sized bed, fireplace, and most importantly a private on suite. The on suite is the main attraction here. Newly renovated with beautiful white tile, large glass shower, sunflower shower head and travertine corner seat, make this room a guest favorite. Located downstairs with easy access to the kitchen, dining room, living room and game room. Perfect for couples or guests that enjoy a little more privacy.

2) The Etta V. Room: Named after A.Z. Litz’s wife, Etta Viola Stauber, the Etta V. Room is positioned downstairs at the front of the house with views of the yard. This bedroom includes a king-sized bed and fireplace. And the front porch, a guest favorite, is just a few steps away. Grab a rocking chair and your favorite drink and enjoy the sounds of nature. Also, being downstairs, you have easy access to the living room, game room, dining room and kitchen.

3) The Jack May Room:  Named after the most prominent owner of the Litz Mansion, Andrew Jackson (“Jack”) May. This room is located downstairs and across the hall from The Etta V. Room. The bedroom includes a king-sized bed and fireplace. Just outside the room door is everyone’s favorite, the front porch. Grab a rocking chair and your favorite drink and enjoy the sounds of nature. Also, being downstairs, you have easy access to the living room, game room, dining room and kitchen.

4) The Hopkins Room: Named after John C. Hopkins who was the second owner of the home during the Civil War. This room is located upstairs in the rear of the mansion, has two sets of bunkbeds and is a perfect retreat for young and old. With three glass walls facing east, the sun fills this room in the morning. Designed to complement the cheerful sun, the white bunkbeds, beautiful white shutters and bright paint remind guests there is so much to look forward to outside.

5) The Mary May Room: A room dedicated to Andrew Jackson (“Jack") May’s first wife Mary Matilda, is located upstairs, on the lower landing and adjacent to The Hopkins Room. This large space features 2 double beds and 2 comfortable sitting areas and even 2 closets. An excellent value for folks travelling together. Beautifully done, spacious and comfortable. Also, easy access to the rear staircase leading to the kitchen and most importantly the coffee maker.

6) The Doctor Johnston Suite: Dr. George Ben Johnston was the son of the original owner and builder of the home, John Johnston. Dr. Johnston was highly respected in the medical community for his surgical expertise and this room is named in his honor. The tucked away upstairs bedroom features two double beds and a private bathroom. Located across the hall from The Mary May Room, this suite is ideal for multiple guests. Full of light, bright and cheery, this room gives guests a pop of color with vintage red bed frames and a soft aqua rug. Also, the room has easy access to the rear staircase leading to the kitchen and most importantly the coffee maker.

7) The Nelle May Room: A room just as stunning as Andrew Jackson May’s second wife (who was 51 years his junior), the Nelle May room is a picturesque part of the mansion and is quickly becoming a guest favorite for it’s good vibes, early morning sunshine, happy wall coloring and vintage white painted bed. This expansive, bright, and cheerful bedroom features a queen-sized bed, fireplace and also has a cozy sitting area. It is a perfect room for folks looking for a recharging environment.

8) The Colonel May Room: The Colonel May room is dedicated to the youngest son of Andrew Jackson and Nelle May. Andrew named his son “Colonel” in hopes to pass along some of the luster and reputation of his own name. This room is fit for a Colonel and styled for one too. With all the furnishings being dark, rich mahogany, and walnut. A favorite talking piece of this room is the beautiful stone capped foot boards. And of course, the guests who stay in this room are in love with the upper porch located just a few steps outside the room door, perfect for enjoying and relaxing.

9) The John Johnston Room: Named for the man that envisioned and constructed the stunning mansion, the John Johnston room is a symbol of elegance and sophistication. Located upstairs at the front of the mansion this bedroom features a king bed and fireplace. It being one of the biggest, most spacious rooms in the house, it has plenty of room for guests. Not just for sleeping, with two oversized chairs and a desk this room is great for longer stays. And of course, the guests who stay in this room are in love with the upper porch located just a few steps outside the room door, perfect for enjoying and relaxing. 

10) The Nicketti Johnston Room: Dedicated to the wife of John Warfield Johnston, the Nicketti Johnston room makes you feel like you are part of history. Located just off the upper landing this expansive bedroom features a king bed and fireplace. The room is one of the biggest in the house; decorated in grand style with dark wood tones and elegant bedding. The large cedar closet and 2 full armchairs give guests who prefer longer stays, the space to lounge and live comfortably.

name: Winterplace Condo! Ski In Ski Out First Floor E101
primaryHost/about: Professional who loves to travel!
sectionedDescription/description:
Winterplace fully furnished condo! Ski in Ski out. First Floor!  - Ashwood Rentals

Newly renovated for the 2023-2024 ski season!!!

New granite countertops!  New custom cabinets!  New floors!  New beds!  Washer/dryer in the condo!  High speed wifi!

No stairs to climb after a long day! No carrying luggage or skis upstairs!

All linens provided

First floor condo with 2 bedrooms and a bunk room.  2 full baths that have just been renovated.  Wood burning fireplace.  Fully furnished with great views of Winterplace!

Ski in ski out!

We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to various insurance sites for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsureMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.


VACATION RENTAL AGREEMENT
This Vacation Rental Agreement (the Agreement) is made by and between  ASHWOOD RENTALS..(HOMEOWNER) and ............................................................. (Guest) as of the date last set forth on the signature page of this Agreement. 
-
For good and valuable consideration, the sufficiency of which is acknowledged, the
parties hereby agree as follows:
1. Property: The vacation rental property is located at:  601 Winterplace Dr.  Unit D104  Ghent, WV 25843
The property is fully furnished and includes:  fully furnished kitchen and linens for beds.  TOWELS ARE NOT PROVIDED
-
2. Maximum Occupancy: The maximum number of guests is limited to 10 persons (including children). 
-
3.Term of the rental: The vacation rental begins at 5:00 p.m. on (“Check-in Date”)
and ends at 11:00 a.m. on (the “Check-out Date”).  Early check ins may be available.  Contact owner if needed.  Failure to adhere to the check-out time may result in an additional late fee set at $50/hour unless discussed in advance of the stay.
-
4. Minimum Stay: This property requires a 2 night minimum stay. Holiday weekends require a 3 night minimum stay.  Longer minimum stays may be required during other periods.
-
5. Rental Rules: Guest agrees to abide by the Rental Rules at all times while at the
property, and shall cause all members of the rental party and anyone else Guest permits on the property to abide by the following rules at all times while residing at the property.  Be respectful of the property and of neighboring guests.   Repeated and/or severe complaints from neighboring guests may result in removal from property without refund.
-
6. Access: Guest shall allow Homeowner access to the property for purposes of repair, inspection or emergency. Homeowner shall exercise this right of access in a reasonable manner by giving at least 2 hours notice (unless in case of emergency).
-
7. Responsible Party: The person reserving and paying for the condo will be the responsible party and must be 25 years of age or older.
-
8. Housekeeping: Your paid reservation includes a charge for cleaning the condo. If, due to unforeseen circumstances (for example, severe weather, housekeeping shortage, etc.), we are unable to clean your condo prior to your stay, you will be refunded the cleaning fee. No other refunds will be given. Before checking-out, please bag and dispose of all trash in the dumpsters located outside, wash and put away the pots and pans, and start the dishwasher. We do not provide daily housekeeping service.
-
9.Pets: Please contact owner about any possible pets for approval. Pet deposit required.
-
10.Smoking: No smoking is permitted inside the dwelling. Failure to abide by this regulation will result in an automatic forfeiture of damage deposit.  Smoking is only allowed in parking lots and dispose of smoking materials properly.
-
11. Property Missing/Damage: Please report any broken, damaged, missing or inoperable items as soon as you notice it. Even if the issue does not affect your stay, we appreciate you letting us know before you check-out so that we can make arrangements to resolve the issue prior to the next guest arrival. Please do not bring cookware or other items from one condo to another. If you have a larger group and book multiple condos, we suggest that you bring paper plates/cups to avoid moving dishes from one condo to another.  Any property in the rental that is removed/broken/abused may be deducted from the security deposit
-
12. Water Leaks: If you encounter a major water leak, please shut-off the main water supply (found in the hall closet above the hot water heater) and call immediately. For small drips, please place a towel or bowl under the drip and notify us during normal hours. Please make sure you notify us if you suspect a leak (wet carpet, water under sink, etc) so that we can take care of it right away and minimize any damage to our condo or to a neighbor’s condo.
-
13. Your Belongings: Please gather all personal belongings before checking out. If we find you have left valuable items behind, we will contact you and arrange to return the items. The minimum charge to return forgotten items is $20.00 plus shipping fees.
-
14. Cancellation: If you cancel your reservation at least 60 days prior to your scheduled arrival date, you will receive a full refund except for a $100.00 cancellation fee (per condo) and any paid credit card fees. If you cancel your reservation less than 60 days from your arrival date, then no refunds or credit toward a different stay will be issued (except for cleaning fee, which will be refunded).
-
15. Refunds: There are no refunds (or credit toward a different stay) for Winterplace closures, poor snow conditions, severe weather, late arrivals, early departures, travel conditions, road closures, allergies, health or medical issues, utility or water outages, mandatory evacuation, construction at neighboring properties, war, terrorism or acts of God. We will make every
reasonable effort to ensure that the appliances, fireplaces, and like amenities are and remain in good working order.  However, there is no refund if these are inoperable.
-
15. Trip Insurance: We understand that circumstances may arise that affect your reservation. We recommend that you purchase Trip Insurance. We do not offer trip insurance, but there are many options available if you search the internet.  You should consider Cancel for Any Reason (CFAR) coverage since a typical policy without that extra coverage will not cover you in the event you want to cancel to due lack of snow, poor conditions, etc.
-
16. Cancellation by Owner: In the event the particular condo you have reserved is not available due to unforeseen circumstances, we will make every effort to relocate you into another one of our condos but assume no further liability. If there are no other condos available, then a complete refund will be given and we assume no further liability.
-
17. Condo Changes: The Owner reserves the right to change your reservation to another same-floor condo at the Owner’s discretion. Although rare, the Owner may need to assign you a different same-floor condo than the one you originally reserved due to scheduling constraints.
-
18.  Falsified Reservations: Any reservation made under false pretenses will be subject to forfeiture of booking deposit and rental payments, and check-in will not be allowed.
-
19. Binding Agreement, Agency, Warrants and Venue: Your rental agreement is a binding contract between you and the property Owner. The rental contract shall be interpreted and governed by West Virginia law. Any legal action pertaining to your rental must be brought exclusively in the appropriate court within Raleigh County, State of West Virginia.
-
20. Defend, Indemnify and Hold Harmless: As a condition of this rental agreement, to the fullest extent permitted by law, you as Guest, on behalf of yourself, members of your party and all their successors, assigns and heirs, agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless the Owner and any of their employees, or representatives thereof, of and from any and all costs, suits, liabilities, damages and/or claims for damages arising from the acts or omissions of any person or which is in any other manner whatsoever related to the rental property and the related property, including but not limited to those arising from any kind of injury to or the death of any person or persons in, on or about the rental property and related property, or from any loss of or damage to the rental property or the personal property of any person or persons in, on or
about the rental property and related property, except that this indemnification does not extend to claims for personal injury actually caused solely by the grossly negligent acts or willful misconduct of the Owner or its employees.

In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to various insurance sites for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsureMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.


VACATION RENTAL AGREEMENT
This Vacation Rental Agreement (the Agreement) is made by and between  ASHWOOD RENTALS..(HOMEOWNER) and ............................................................. (Guest) as of the date last set forth on the signature page of this Agreement. 
-
For good and valuable consideration, the sufficiency of which is acknowledged, the
parties hereby agree as follows:
1. Property: The vacation rental property is located at:  601 Winterplace Dr.  Unit D104  Ghent, WV 25843
The property is fully furnished and includes:  fully furnished kitchen and linens for beds.  TOWELS ARE NOT PROVIDED
-
2. Maximum Occupancy: The maximum number of guests is limited to 10 persons (including children). 
-
3.Term of the rental: The vacation rental begins at 5:00 p.m. on (“Check-in Date”)
and ends at 11:00 a.m. on (the “Check-out Date”).  Early check ins may be available.  Contact owner if needed.  Failure to adhere to the check-out time may result in an additional late fee set at $50/hour unless discussed in advance of the stay.
-
4. Minimum Stay: This property requires a 2 night minimum stay. Holiday weekends require a 3 night minimum stay.  Longer minimum stays may be required during other periods.
-
5. Rental Rules: Guest agrees to abide by the Rental Rules at all times while at the
property, and shall cause all members of the rental party and anyone else Guest permits on the property to abide by the following rules at all times while residing at the property.  Be respectful of the property and of neighboring guests.   Repeated and/or severe complaints from neighboring guests may result in removal from property without refund.
-
6. Access: Guest shall allow Homeowner access to the property for purposes of repair, inspection or emergency. Homeowner shall exercise this right of access in a reasonable manner by giving at least 2 hours notice (unless in case of emergency).
-
7. Responsible Party: The person reserving and paying for the condo will be the responsible party and must be 25 years of age or older.
-
8. Housekeeping: Your paid reservation includes a charge for cleaning the condo. If, due to unforeseen circumstances (for example, severe weather, housekeeping shortage, etc.), we are unable to clean your condo prior to your stay, you will be refunded the cleaning fee. No other refunds will be given. Before checking-out, please bag and dispose of all trash in the dumpsters located outside, wash and put away the pots and pans, and start the dishwasher. We do not provide daily housekeeping service.
-
9.Pets: Please contact owner about any possible pets for approval. Pet deposit required.
-
10.Smoking: No smoking is permitted inside the dwelling. Failure to abide by this regulation will result in an automatic forfeiture of damage deposit.  Smoking is only allowed in parking lots and dispose of smoking materials properly.
-
11. Property Missing/Damage: Please report any broken, damaged, missing or inoperable items as soon as you notice it. Even if the issue does not affect your stay, we appreciate you letting us know before you check-out so that we can make arrangements to resolve the issue prior to the next guest arrival. Please do not bring cookware or other items from one condo to another. If you have a larger group and book multiple condos, we suggest that you bring paper plates/cups to avoid moving dishes from one condo to another.  Any property in the rental that is removed/broken/abused may be deducted from the security deposit
-
12. Water Leaks: If you encounter a major water leak, please shut-off the main water supply (found in the hall closet above the hot water heater) and call immediately. For small drips, please place a towel or bowl under the drip and notify us during normal hours. Please make sure you notify us if you suspect a leak (wet carpet, water under sink, etc) so that we can take care of it right away and minimize any damage to our condo or to a neighbor’s condo.
-
13. Your Belongings: Please gather all personal belongings before checking out. If we find you have left valuable items behind, we will contact you and arrange to return the items. The minimum charge to return forgotten items is $20.00 plus shipping fees.
-
14. Cancellation: If you cancel your reservation at least 60 days prior to your scheduled arrival date, you will receive a full refund except for a $100.00 cancellation fee (per condo) and any paid credit card fees. If you cancel your reservation less than 60 days from your arrival date, then no refunds or credit toward a different stay will be issued (except for cleaning fee, which will be refunded).
-
15. Refunds: There are no refunds (or credit toward a different stay) for Winterplace closures, poor snow conditions, severe weather, late arrivals, early departures, travel conditions, road closures, allergies, health or medical issues, utility or water outages, mandatory evacuation, construction at neighboring properties, war, terrorism or acts of God. We will make every
reasonable effort to ensure that the appliances, fireplaces, and like amenities are and remain in good working order.  However, there is no refund if these are inoperable.
-
15. Trip Insurance: We understand that circumstances may arise that affect your reservation. We recommend that you purchase Trip Insurance. We do not offer trip insurance, but there are many options available if you search the internet.  You should consider Cancel for Any Reason (CFAR) coverage since a typical policy without that extra coverage will not cover you in the event you want to cancel to due lack of snow, poor conditions, etc.
-
16. Cancellation by Owner: In the event the particular condo you have reserved is not available due to unforeseen circumstances, we will make every effort to relocate you into another one of our condos but assume no further liability. If there are no other condos available, then a complete refund will be given and we assume no further liability.
-
17. Condo Changes: The Owner reserves the right to change your reservation to another same-floor condo at the Owner’s discretion. Although rare, the Owner may need to assign you a different same-floor condo than the one you originally reserved due to scheduling constraints.
-
18.  Falsified Reservations: Any reservation made under false pretenses will be subject to forfeiture of booking deposit and rental payments, and check-in will not be allowed.
-
19. Binding Agreement, Agency, Warrants and Venue: Your rental agreement is a binding contract between you and the property Owner. The rental contract shall be interpreted and governed by West Virginia law. Any legal action pertaining to your rental must be brought exclusively in the appropriate court within Raleigh County, State of West Virginia.
-
20. Defend, Indemnify and Hold Harmless: As a condition of this rental agreement, to the fullest extent permitted by law, you as Guest, on behalf of yourself, members of your party and all their successors, assigns and heirs, agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless the Owner and any of their employees, or representatives thereof, of and from any and all costs, suits, liabilities, damages and/or claims for damages arising from the acts or omissions of any person or which is in any other manner whatsoever related to the rental property and the related property, including but not limited to those arising from any kind of injury to or the death of any person or persons in, on or about the rental property and related property, or from any loss of or damage to the rental property or the personal property of any person or persons in, on or
about the rental property and related property, except that this indemnification does not extend to claims for personal injury actually caused solely by the grossly negligent acts or willful misconduct of the Owner or its employees.

primaryHost/about: I have been in the vacation rental business for over 25 years! I love rescuing old wood, restoring antiques, collecting vintage clothing, and am always on the hunt for unusual finds. Decorating is a passion as well. I seem to find a place for everything! Beyond that, I love meeting and welcoming people from all over the world. I would love to add you to my list!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: During the day, guests may enjoy a walk to the barn in the lower pastures (following the designated path only). There you can access the river and fish (bring your own fishing pole and/or kayak) or have fun just splashing around! This area is restricted to day use only and no ATVs or dirt bikes are allowed on the property. No sport shooting on property.
sectionedDescription/description:
This historic cabin and farm has been featured in numerous print articles and 'Traveling West Virginia' TV segments.  Filled with glimpses of the past, guests enjoy charming antique-filled rooms, Wi-Fi, kitchen, new bath, queen bed, fireplace.  Near the New River Gorge National Park, Pipestem zipline, ATV trails, hiking, kayaking, caves/caverns & more. Watch deer graze in the pastures as you sit back and enjoy peace in the valley. Located just off I-77, exit 14. A step back in time ...

Guests will enjoy the whole house. Historic home is smoke free, pet free, and vape free. Each room is appointed with beautiful antique quilts, old trunks, and pieces of furniture used on the farm. It is like a museum! Of course, there has been added the modern recliner for sitting and sipping coffee while watching the deer eat apples from the old tree!

The main floor has a sunporch with a spectacular view of the valley. Guests can enjoy views of sunrise and sunset in both rain and shine! The main floor also has a kitchen, dining area, living room with fireplace, and sitting room. Beautiful tiled bathroom with shower is on main floor.  Choose to sleep on main floor or in loft. The loft has a queen size bed, sitting area, and closet. All rooms have antiques and beautiful furnishings.

If you are looking for pampered, modern conveniences this is not your place. If you want peace, quiet, tranquility amid old relics, antiques, and farm pastures you will enjoy this property. The homestead is much like it was during the time it was built (early 1900s). It is intended to give visitors and guests an idea of how living on the farm in the early years might have been. Not for the allergy sensitive as it is a farm with hayfields, etc.

Please note: This is an old cabin on a septic system in the countryside.  For safety reasons, we strictly enforce the use of it to 2 people ONLY. We do not share/offer property as a meeting or gathering place.

During the day, guests may enjoy a walk to the barn in the lower pastures (following the designated path only). There you can access the river and fish (bring your own fishing pole and/or kayak) or have fun just splashing around! This area is restricted to day use only and no ATVs or dirt bikes are allowed on the property. No sport shooting on property.

You may text me with questions at any time.

This property is located in the countryside surrounded by mountains and valleys. There are 2 churches (Methodist and Baptist), a post office, a school (K-5), and a small convenience store w gas/groceries is 3 miles away. This property is near Camp Creek State Forest, Pipestem, Bluestone State Parks, Pinnacle Rock State Park, outdoor rafting, ATV riding on the Hatfields and McCoys Trail, America's newest National park: The New River Gorge National Park, and much more! It takes approximately 5 minutes to reach Interstate 77 from the cabin, exit 14.

You will need transportation to get to everything to see and do. There is no public transit system in the countryside. :)

Diesel the farm dog may be around each day for his dog biscuit.
We love sharing our family's old log cabin with others. We strictly enforce the use of the cabin to no more than 2 adults, no pets.

primaryHost/about: Hi! I own 2 Airbnb loft apartments in downtown Tazewell, VA. It brings me great joy to host visitors here in beautiful T-Town. I work with coal impacted communities in Southwest VA on Economic Development projects. I can be your personal tourism assistant while you’re visiting Tazewell, just ask!

sectionedDescription/access: Full access to entire apartment and balcony.
sectionedDescription/description:
Conveniently located on Main Street Tazewell, you’re within walking distance to 3 full service downtown restaurants, a coffee shop, brewery, boutiques, an art gallery and more! Spacious apartment, featuring a king suite and a second bedroom with a full sized bed. Pull out the futon for additional sleepers, and there’s a full sized couch as well. Kitchen features new appliances and everything you need to enjoy home cooked meals during your stay. Laundry room with washer and dryer for your use.

Built in 1878, this building was the original home to Clinch Valley News. This second story apartment is overflowing with charm & character. Guests have access to a full living room, featuring a sofa, chair and smart TV. An 8 person dining table, full kitchen, bathroom, king suite with a futon and a smart TV, and a full size bed in the second bedroom with a walk in closet.

Full access to entire apartment and balcony.

I am a phone call or text away!

Main Street Tazewell is home to a variety of restaurants and retail shops and is the gateway to the scenic Back of the Dragon. Parking is located in the back of the building, we share a parking lot with the Sheriff’s Department and the Library. There is plenty of safe and private parking.

Parking and entrance to the apartment is located in the back of the building. Turn onto Marion Ave from Main Street and take the left hand turn into the parking lot. The entrance is the white door. You will be given an access code to unlock the door.

WiFi, off street parking, trash pick up, washer and dryer inside apartment.

primaryHost/about:
I am from Lexington, NC. I have 2 boys and a beautiful wife. I have a vacuum business that allows me to travel all over the United States. We love riding as a family. It is great family time. This is what we want to provide a great relaxing trip for friends and family to enjoy. 
Don't put off what you can do today because tomorrow is never promised!

sectionedDescription/description:
We are located in Northfork WV at the Hatfield and McCoy trail systems, we are directly on the Outlaw trails .  We offer a fully furnished home to rent in the area. Jake's Grocery is located at the end of the road on the corner. We are around a mile away from Ashland Resort, so there is access to gas while you ride. We offer access to tours of the area and trail systems, we also have connections for you to rent ATVs and UTVs if needed. Easy access to the house from Highway 52.

This is a HOUSE with all the house comforts. Way more room than you would believe by looking from the outside.

Our location boasts access to all the local fun & attractions including Riders Inn (Local Bar & Grill), The Creek trails, Rebel Ridge, The View, The Goldfish Pond, and the Wagon Wheel.

Text or call 336-240-6445 or 704-308-8610

Quite and laid back. No drama! Swing on the porch and enjoy the WV mountains!

primaryHost/about: I am a pharmacist from rural Appalachian Virginia. Married with 2 adult children with whom I enjoy traveling the world whenever possible.
sectionedDescription/access: The entire upstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.
sectionedDescription/description:
2 Bedroom apartment in Cedar Bluff Virginia town limits. Sleeps 4-5. Friendly community. Tranquil setting in a rural town with a creek flowing nearby. 5 min to Richlands. 10 min from the local hospital, Clinch Valley Medical Center. 20 min to Tazewell. 15 min to the Dragon's Back. 75 min to Bristol Motor Speedway. Multiple 4-wheeler trails nearby. Local trout streams 30 minutes in any direction. Washer/Dryer access. Free coffee, and WiFi. Private 2nd-floor entrance via outdoor stairs.

Grocery stores and pharmacies are conveniently located only 6 minutes away. Only 1 mile from the Blue Tornadoes Football field. If you happen to be a football fan you can find the whole town at Richlands High School on Friday nights during the fall.

The entire upstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.

Available by phone. We live locally so are available in the event of an emergency.

Enjoy gorgeous foliage and a breathtaking view at Cedar Bluff Overlook. It is about a 30-minute hike on a marked trail. Enjoy scenic drives through the Clinch Mountains, East River Mountains, and the Appalachian Mountains all around the area.
The Cedar Bluff Heritage Festival occurs annually on the third Saturday of September. You will find antique dealers and food vendors among many other activities. The festival attracts thousands of visitors and hundreds of vendors each year.  OKTOBREWFEST is a festival that is held on beautiful historic Main St. Tazewell, VA the first Saturday of October and was created to promote the craft beer industry in southwest VA and the surrounding area. It is the Premier Craft Beer Festival of the Heart of Appalachia.  There are several local restaurants of note, Cuz’s restaurant has been named the best in off-the-beaten-track restaurant categories. Bearded Moose is a frequented local barbecue restaurant loved by locals, and you can enjoy a sweet treat at Sugarfoot Bakery only 6 minutes away. Painted Peak Brewing Company is approximately 25 minutes away from the apartment where you can sample local brews. Multiple hiking trails and 4 wheeler trails are options for your entertainment. Kayaking and canoeing are available at local lakes and rivers. Enjoy Crab Orchard Museum located about 15 minutes away to learn more about the history in our area.
The apartment is located approximately 30 min from the Appalachian College of Pharmacy and approximately 13 minutes from Southwest Community College. Raven Theater is a historic site located about 10 minutes away. Limited show-times and hours, but when they are open it is a special stop for soda fountain ice cream.  Broadway Cinemas is the local contemporary theater located about 6 minutes away.

The town of Cedar Bluff has sidewalks with lights and you can enjoy a leisurely afternoon stroll. 4 County Transit offers public transportation. Town route fare is 25¢ per boarding.
Work express fare is 50¢ per boarding.
College routes are public routes and open to anyone who wants to ride. Fare for public riders is $1.00 per boarding.
College route fare is FREE for college students and staff/faculty who present college ID, seniors at least 60 years old, and children 5 or younger who are accompanied by an adult.
At your request, the bus can stop at other locations that are along its route. This is a route deviation service. 
Please call at least 48 hours in advance with your requests. 
Check out their website for additional information.

additionalHouseRules:
- No hunting on property.
- Garbage must be collected and put out in trash can.
- Please leave house in order found it and clean up any major messes.  Clean all dishes, etc. used.  
- Use coasters on all wood surfaces under drink cups.
- Turn off all interior lights when you leave but leave exterior lights on.
- You may adjust the two thermostats for your comfort.
- You may not capture, kill or take off the premise any animals including but not limited to birds, turtles, lizards, frogs, snakes, deer, rabbits, etc. You may not disturb birds nesting .
- There is photo album with pictures showing the cabin refurbishment and a write up.  You may not remove or touch any of the items in the photo album.  You may not copy or take pictures of the photo album. Please wash your hands before you view the photo album.

primaryHost/about: Love animals, dogs specifically, the outdoors, hiking, gardening, kayaking, golfing and spending time with my husband, children and friends.  I am a Forensic and Tax Accountant.
sectionedDescription/access: All parts of the house are accessible.
sectionedDescription/description:
Beautifully restored 1830's log home with great room addition and all modern amenities with country charm.  Close to hiking and golfing at the Greenbrier Resort and Pipestem State Park, Bluestone Lake, white water rafting down the New River, antiquing, skiing at Winter Place, and the quaint railroad town of Hinton.  Close to America's favorite small town of Lewisburg where shopping and dining choices are abundant.

The log home is a great launching point to visit the Greenbrier Resort, Pipestem State Park, Blue Stone Lake, The New River Gorge, Winter Place, Lewisburg and Beckley. We are about 20 miles from Winterplace; it's an easy drive.

All parts of the house are accessible.

My manager Susie is available throughout your stay to assist with any needs.  Her cell phone will be provided upon booking.

The log home is a great launching point to visit the Greenbrier Resort, Pipestem State Park, Blue Stone Lake, The New River Gorge, Lewisburg, and Beckley.  Hinton is 3 miles from the log home and has a grocery store,  a pharmacy, and several places to eat. We like the Market.

Amtrak comes to the Greenbrier.

The cabin is located near a sulfur spring so sometimes the water can have that strong sulfur smell.  Bring bottled water for drinking.

accessibilityModule/amenities/0/descript: There's a private parking spot at least 11 feet (3.35 meters) wide. Or, there is public parking spot designated for a person with disabilities that has clear signage or markings.
accessibilityModule/amenities/1/descript: The sidewalk or path that leads to the guest entrance is well lit at night.
accessibilityModule/amenities/1/name: Lit path to the guest entrance
accessibilityModule/amenities/2/descript: The exterior and interior pathways to the guest entrance—like sidewalks, hallways, or elevators—have no steps, stairs, or curbs.
accessibilityModule/amenities/2/name: Step-free path to the guest entrance
accessibilityModule/amenities/3/descript:
The guest entrance is free of steps and barriers, and the door threshold is less than 2 inches (5 centimeters) high. 

In a hotel or apartment building, the guest entrance is where the guests enter their room. For all other listing types, the guest entrance is the entrance to the property.
accessibilityModule/amenities/4/descript: The guest entryway is at least 32 inches (81 centimeters) wide.
accessibilityModule/amenities/5/descript: The room is on the ground floor or accessible by a lift or ramp, and there are no stairs, steps, or thresholds higher than 2 inches (5 centimeters) between the guest entrance and the room.
accessibilityModule/amenities/6/descript: The entrance or doorway to the room is at least 32 inches wide.
accessibilityModule/amenities/7/descript: There are no steps or obstacles to enter the shower. Thresholds or water guards are less than 1 inch (2.54 centimeters) high.
accessibilityModule/amenities/8/descript: The shower or bath has a chair or bench seat in it that's specifically designed for guests with limited mobility. The seat is either fixed to a wall or freestanding.
accessibilityModule/rootHighlights/1: Lit path to the guest entrance
accessibilityModule/rootHighlights/2: Step-free path to the guest entrance
accessibilityModule/seeAllSections/2/pho: This photo shows the teak bench that is normally in the shower.  However I ordered one 2 days ago and it will be here anytime.
accessibilityModule/seeAllSummary: This host has reviewed their place for accessibility features. Wide entrances are at least 32" (81cm).
additionalHouseRules:
No unregistered guests

No shoes on the bed or the furniture, if at all possible try to leave your shoes at the door

No rearranging of the furniture unless for setting up of the Inflatable mattress

Guest agrees to pay any and all damages incurred by their stay

Please respect our towels, sheets, comforters

Use the black make-up towels in the bathroom for makeup removal

Do not cut anything on the countertops, there is a cutting board in the sink for that 

Please no eating in the bed

Please don't leave ink pens on the bed or especially the loveseat or recliner. 

While cooking, please use hot pads that are provided, do not sit hot pans on countertop

Books are property of the flat, kindly don't take them home , and please respect the vintage ones. They were acquired for your enjoyment. 

Do not let robes fall into your luggage and later when questioned about it say, "it must have fallen into my luggage". They are there for your enjoyment. If you are interested in purchasing, message me.

photos/10/caption: Designed in a monochromatic color Scheme. The dark exterior of this building with the natural cedar accents is quite dramatic and exhibits personality. This  look combines strength in color and elements of nature which are comforting and interesting
photos/11/caption: Custom made Cor-ten steel planters. That i have been working on accelerating the patina process. Then you clear coat them.  There will always be and abundance of healthy plants at the flat. Guaranteed.
photos/12/caption: Door to area with extra luggage storage, and washer and dryer. available for your use at anytime by code. As with everything on this building, address plaque custom made with western red cedar. and stainless steel.

photos/14/caption: Thoughtfully designed in an urban industrial style, with a full wall mural that is very though provoking. Solid wood blinds. A metal pipe clothes hanging system on the wall. Mid century modern chandaliers.
photos/15/caption: Kraus "workstation" sink with built in cutting board and draining station, fruit and veggie washer. Teal subway tile. Damascus steel knife set , mounted by rare earth magnet, fractal burned and epoxied knife holder. French steak knives. Ninja IQ Blen
photos/16/caption: Coffee and tea station
photos/17/caption: Nespresso coffee maker, which makes PHENOMENAL Coffee!!! Has many options from nespresso, starbucks, and illy. 9 different options for simple syrups. Double walled cappuccin and espresso cups hanging. To go cups beside machine. Video tutorial on Echo
photos/18/caption: Japanese Tetsubin Teapot with Stainless Steel Infuser.  Made of cast iron and black porcelain enameled interior. Named after Rikyu (Rentarô Mikuni),a Buddhist priest who believes in the spiritual healing inherent in traditional Japanese tea ceremony
photos/19/caption: Essentia is supercharged ionized alkaline water. PH' d  to 9.5. Best rated water I could find. Individually wrapped teas from Harney and Sons of London, Twinning's, Taylors of Harrogate, and various others. Teas are stored in a Fractal burned chest.
photos/20/caption: Krups noiselss grinder, Bodum Classic French Press, Bodum pour over contraption, Fellow Stagg EKG Digital hot water kettle. Rated #1 by Baristas all over the world. Japanese tea set( see other pic). Additional teas.
photos/21/caption: Custom built butcher block dining table, then epoxied. Built on an air frame, that silently will raise all the way up to 48 inches tall, and drop all the way down to 25.
photos/22/caption: Barcalounger swinger recliner, Modern Queen size bed, urban industrial. Beautifully blown lamps atop acacia wood night stands. 15 inch hybrid cooling memory foam bed. Ugg comforter, stupid high thread count ,Turkish cotton  sheets and pillowcases.
photos/23/caption: Damascus steel knife set, mounted on fractal  burned and epoxied mounted on rare earth magnets.
photos/24/caption: Frigidaire Gallery above range microwave. Ninja IQ blender, Adjustable salt and pepper shakers, Frigidaire Gallery 30", Front control, Air fryer range that is ADA compliant.
photos/25/caption: Antique Chinese Tea Box dated to around 1870
photos/26/caption: Klipsh. The Three 11 model. Absolutely phenomenal sound.  I never owned one until now, probably wont own anything else. Bose and Sonos, eat your heart out!!!
photos/27/caption: Cant help myself, the contrast of the western red cedar, Carbonized grey brick, and foliage are worth one last pic.
photos/28/caption: Haden, one of the best designed toasters I could find. 50 item spice rack and beside that, Immersion blender
photos/29/caption: Custom Live edge floating vanity. Old style, new design french tempered glass shower doors, teak floor , teak stool. Turkish cotton bath rug. Unorthodox toilet. Have you ever used a square toilet.?
photos/31/caption: Fully automatic record player with a selection of music from every genre. It is connected by cable to the speaker so that connecting to blue tooth on your phone will be much easier.
photos/32/caption: Luxury Edition Monopoly with 2 tone wood and real wood houses, leather deed book.
photos/33/caption: No, not a cappuccino, the froth you see is the crema,  Yea this machine and this coffee is that good... You may leave a coffee nerd.
photos/34/caption: Coral from Thailand, and drift wood from Georgia.
photos/35/caption: Top grain leather power loveseat, which fully reclines. Also has extendable footrest, and adjustable headrest so that you can watch the 75 inch tv at ease. Lumbar adjustable. Also has usb plug, wireless phone chargers , and tons of storage in armrest
photos/36/caption: Custom live edge, floating vanity, with Italian Designed sink and faucet.Mirror is a led vanity mirror with defogging, so that it doesn't get steamed up. Storage underneath in the drawers, FHI hairdryer. wireless Clothes Iron. antacid tabs, cough med
photos/37/caption: Extremely comfy Throw pillows and throw blankets by   Ugg.
photos/38/caption: Globe made from different stones and crystals on top , various modern day reading, orange press, Bordeaux glasses, automatic wine corker, Amazon echo show 8, The photographic work of Mark Seliger( amazing), an antique Asian box (see other pic).
photos/39/caption: Top grain leather power loveseat, which fully reclines. Also has extendable footrest, and adjustable headrest so that you can watch the 75 inch tv at ease. Lumbar adjustable. Also has usb plug, wireless phone chargers , and tons of storage in armrest
photos/40/caption: Metal pipe clothes hanger,  all floating shelves, West Virginia book showcased, Bookcase edition scrabble, vintage antique books dating all the way back to 1852. Stone globe sitting atop an 1892 Justice of the Peace.

photos/53/caption: Brand new Frigidaire stacked washer and dryer, and plenty more room for luggage storage.
photos/54/caption: Another contrast of color photos. Very eye catching.
photos/55/caption: BEAUTIFUL!! Teak, Turquoise, and Grey stack stone.
photos/56/caption: This is the second cup ive had of this while uploading and captioning these photos for you. I really feeling like running or jumping up and down right now.
photos/57/caption: These are my enforcers. They make sure robes don't "accidentally" end up in luggage. Yes they are cute, they dress themselves, have British accents, and swing like a champ.
photos/58/caption: Hermes Eau d' orange verte. Toiletries for staying 5 nights or more.
photos/59/caption: The two spots circled are reserved for you. The door that is circled is the entrance to the airbnb.

photos/61/caption: L' Occitane Mer & Mistral Toiletries. These are for our 2 night or more guests.
sectionedDescription/access: Outside of the flat there are 2 parking spaces solely dedicated  for your use. You then have the sidewalk that winds all the way through the University. It is maintained by the University. For Security, there is the WVU Tech Campus Police and the Beckley Police Department. I have worked closely with both, not only offering to provide a live link to my camera systems, but also taking several other measures to ensure the safety and security of the students, community members, and you!
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located flat, in the WVU Tech University District. Designed for couples,This historic filling station was acquired,gutted and purposely rebuilt for you,the discerning traveler,the parents of the students, or the traveling Doctor or Nurse. Designed in an urban industrial style, he unit is completely smart enabled,handicap accessible and overflowing with amenities that you would only expect from the most well known 5 star resorts. 15% Military Discount.

Welcome to the Carbon Flat. This is a multi-faceted passion project that not only offers housing for the parents of the University students, but is also in an effort to invest in the local community  and help grow much needed infrastructure.  This building was acquired, redesigned, gutted, stripped, and purposely rebuilt FOR you. I applied myself, thoroughly researched the concept of airbnb, developed a plan, and am now implementing that plan for "TOP OF THE LINE EXPERIENCE AND SERVICE",  In which I have provided for more than a decade.  I built and operated an Ultra exclusive boutique beach resort In Southeast Asia. As well as a beach lounge and restaurant that was considered "the living room" of Khao-Lak Beach, Thailand. I have lived and traveled abroad extensively, which I do believe lends to One's ability to recognize, appreciate,  and implement, this level of service. 

From the exterior. I chose to design the building in a very trendy "urban industrial" monochromatic color scheme which uses a lot of one color in different hues. For this project I chose, carbonized grey. Hence the name, The Carbon Flat. I accentuated this dark and sort of  'blah' color with western red cedar, that I stained Mahogany Flame. It is quite dramatic, yet calming. I highlighted certain areas in stone, and others with foliage from local plants.  We installed a wheelchair accessible, concrete ramp, at a 3 degree gradient, to not only allow for a wheelchair, but also make it easier for luggage and minimize someone tripping. 

 On to the inside....

Posh, yet practical. Again, I put thought into every decision, researching what had the best reviews for comfort and functionality, while also balancing  function with form and design. I wanted to bring a little of the out side in, so I used a much more subtle grey, almost blue Pallet. I Then painted the  oak cabinets with the carbonized grey from outside. Additionally I used  western red cedar with the same  Is mahogany flame stain for crown molding. For a focal point, I had a custom mural done on the largest  wall. Its very thought provoking and perfect for the space which by the numbers seems small but with 12 foot high ceilings, makes it feel so much bigger.  I built and installed custom Acacia wood butcher block counter tops, with a Kraus workstation sink That I believe was intended to give a  farmhouse look, but it only lends to this funky design. It has a  built in chopping block and dish drainer. 

The kitchen was stocked with everything that a chef would appreciate. From  beautiful Damascus steel knives, to an Air fryer range that's front controlled and ADA compliant. Coffee and tea lovers? There is a Nespresso Machine that makes the absolute best coffee, stocked with Nespresso's best  coffee offerings as well as from Starbucks and other favorites. . There is a French Press, Bodum Pour over, Krups Noiseless grinder, and several different options for coffee in  fresh bean form in case you wanted to make your travelling companion their first pour over. Double walled glass  cappuccino and espresso mugs, and milk frother.  Individually wrapped tea bags from Twinning's, Taylors of Harrogate, Harford and Sons, and individually wrapped loose leaf tea from all over the world. There is an authentic cast iron Tetsubin  Japanese Tea set that, by the artist, was named after Rikyu (Rentarô Mikuni), a Buddhist priest who believes in the spiritual healing inherent in the traditional Japanese tea ceremony. There’s a Fellow Stagg EKG Digital kettle that’s ranked #1 by baristas and has a beautiful design. The best pour, for your pour-over. And only the best for you. 

Appreciate nice bath towels, or quality sleep? I chose to use  UGG Pacha line Turkish Cotton (and oversized) for all of the bath towels, hand towels, and wash cloths. I  Used UGG for most of the comforters and throws, and there will be several options for the guests when it comes to pillows and sheets, in case you don’t like the crazy high thread count Egyptian cotton ones that will be on the 14 inch hybrid, and fully adjustable bed. Makes it nice if you want to set the head up so you can watch the 75  inch tv,  with amazon prime, local cable, and top it off , a service that gives you every single cable channel from around the world, in different languages, including every single  pay per view event. It also has every single movie that comes out in theaters sometimes while they are still in the theaters. This is a legal service so there are no movies recorded with cellphones. I enjoy high quality Audio but had never bought anything from Klipsch. I wont ever buy anything else again.  You have a Klipsch Three 11 in the flat.   Bose, Sonos, eat your heart out. To sweeten the audio experience, is a fully automatic Audio Technica record player and a nice selection of records from every genre. Just let me know what tickles your fancy and it will be playing for you when you walk through the door. For you business travelers, there is  a wireless printer for your use. 

The lounging furniture are top grain leather , fully reclinable, with adjustable head and footrest, and lumbar also  with built in wireless charging for your phones. I have provided a few reading options including newer books, and a few dating all the way back to the 1850’s. Its really neat to look through them and compare societal differences of then and now and the amazing art done on old school press plates. There are few tastefully chosen board games. A bookcase edition scrabble, and a Luxury Edition Monopoly.  I built  a little area with accompaniments for adult beverages, and a nice Westin orange  juicer, which will always be accompanied by  fresh fruit, in case you would like to get up in the morning and juice some oranges for your “better half”. 

For you adult beverage drinkers there is a nice selection of glass ware. Vintage Paulaner Hefeweizen Glasses, which there are several already in the freezer for you. Huge Bordeaux glasses, glasses for white, lowballs, highballs and if you do partake please let me know in comments when you book that you are "RED" or "WHITE" and there will be such a thing in the gift basket for you.  

Custom built dining table made from Baltic Beechwood and then a triple coat of epoxy. I built this on an electric, noiseless air frame. You can raise and lower this table from 25 inches all the way up to 48 inches . Feel like standing,  great, sitting, even better. Disabled, I built this for you.  I think I blew ADA Compliant Standards out of the water on This  one. 

Last, but not least. The Bathroom. Continuing the décor, I installed  beautiful stone tile flooring, did the walls in a mute industrial concrete waterproof wallpaper. There is a really cool internally lit vanity mirror with a defogger that does not allow it to  get steamed up. My vision to work with local artists and craftsmen to showcase their work was fulfilled in the floating vanity and sink.  99timbers custom designed and built a live edge undermount and backsplash. It matches the beautiful foil-work sink . This sink is wheelchair accessible. There is a walk-in (or roll-in) modern steam shower. I chose grey stack stone and stunning turquoise subway tile, accentuated again by (a water suitable) choice of wood. Teak Floors and Teak Bench. This shower is 60 inches wide and 36 inches deep. It is wheelchair accessible. There is a 10 inch Kohler rain deluge, 8 body jets and an hand wand. Pressure? got pressure for days!!  Hot water you ask, well , I'm sure someone is going to test out that auto defog mirror. Its definitely a steam shower.  There are Turkish Cotton robes behind the bathroom door in multiple sizes for men and women. There is 3 different levels of toiletries based on the length of your stay. Our standard is  L'occitane Mer & Mistral,  If you're staying 3 nights or more you will receive Aprey Purple Water  (Exclusively used by the Ritz Carlton) if you choose to stay 5 nights or more you will receive  Hermès  eau d' orange vert.  Regardless of which level, you will receive shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, and body lotion.  There will also be an individually wrapped bar soap from Marseilles.

The unit is completly "smart" enabled. You can control everything with your voice. Lights, thermostat, doorlock, T.V.,  Alarm System, Vacuum cleanet. You can ask to see the doorbell camera and your vehicle on the 8 in screen in the Kitchen.  There is also another 5 inch screen. Both of these have manual camera shutters, and by protocol are never opened by me. If you choose to use them for video calling, you are doing so on your own accord. The only thing in the flat that is not smart controlled are the 2 chandeliers. There is too much wattage going through them. There is Also a hidden safe for your valuables. 

I hope you are ok with smart technology. There  is a virtual concierge that will greet you by name as you come in the front door and ask if you are formally checking in.  You will be given a menu of options, or you can ask exactly what you want. I have spent a great deal of time, programming information Such as info about the property , info on anything inside the flat and how to use it, restaurants, things to do, places to see, family friendly activities, hiking, shopping, etc...I have worked with many local restaurants and stores securing exclusive discount coupons for you, but you have to use the virtual concierge.  I have attached many pictures and videos,  of things in the flat that explain things better. So if you don't know how to make a pour over, it will teach you. 

I'm not going to list every little detail. I can only GUARANTEE you will not find anything like it locally, or for this price.  IF you do ill honor my guarantee and give you a weekend for free.

 I am also trying to set the bar for a different kind of service and go above and beyond. If you choose to book and will be staying at the flat long enough to need groceries, You can place a click list order and I will happily pick them up and have them stocked at the flat for you.  Local grocery store options are Kroger, Walmart, and Food Lion.

My father, myself, and generations in my family served in The United States Military. I am proud, and grateful  in offering a 15% military discount for Active Duty or former service members.  Please let me know before booking so that I can send you  the special offer. I would also ask that you provide some sort of verification.,  ie,  base card, VA ID, or DD214. You would want to think that no one would lie about serving in the military for a discount, but we all know better. This is actually a Federal crime punishable under The Stolen Valor Act of 2013 (revised from 2005).

Outside of the flat there are 2 parking spaces solely dedicated  for your use. You then have the sidewalk that winds all the way through the University. It is maintained by the University. For Security, there is the WVU Tech Campus Police and the Beckley Police Department. I have worked closely with both, not only offering to provide a live link to my camera systems, but also taking several other measures to ensure the safety and security of the students, community members, and you!

I will be available at a whim, if anything were needed, for any reason.

Located within the WVU Tech University District, You can walk to any area of the University within 5 minutes.  WVU Tech has also allocated and broken ground on a new dormitory literally across the road from the flat . In literally 10 seconds from the front door you can walk to Jimmy's Place, a local bar, that had been open since the 1960's, but shut down because of Covid 19. Fortunately, a local business owner has opened it back up and is serving food.  The carbon flat is located in the University district but the property behind the flat Is completely wooded..an urban landscape. There are two windows with views of this.

IF you are driving by car , there are two parking spaces in front of the airbnb dedicated solely for your use. Other than that the usual options are available, taxi, uber, public transportation. If you are in need of any information, please let me know and iIwill provide you everything.

#The Carbon Flat goes above and beyond some standards that even 5 star resorts don't implement. 
Firstly we care very much about the air that you breath. We implement a system that you can access, by Bluetooth, our air filtration system, and view the statistics and real time data such as when the filter was changed, and the air quality you are breathing. 

#We also take cleaning extremely serious, and have written protocols (S.O.P's) as to using a ozone generator each time a guest departs. We do this  before we even go in to clean. This prevents us from coming into contact with anything while changing the bed, vacuuming, etc. The ozone machine completely, (even cracks and crevices) kills all bacteria, viruses, mold, and any un thinkables. 

#IF you are handicapped and travelling alone, or travelling with someone but still have some restrictions,  I offer my services to help if I am able, in any way, as I had said before, my father was Quadriplegic for 33 years. I helped with EVERYTHING.  I am cpr certified, and combat medical trained from my time in the military. I offer this at no charge. You can contact me personally, if you would like to inquire about this.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
No unregistered guests

No shoes on the bed or the furniture, if at all possible try to leave your shoes at the door

No rearranging of the furniture unless for setting up of the Inflatable mattress

Guest agrees to pay any and all damages incurred by their stay

Please respect our towels, sheets, comforters

Use the black make-up towels in the bathroom for makeup removal

Do not cut anything on the countertops, there is a cutting board in the sink for that 

Please no eating in the bed

Please don't leave ink pens on the bed or especially the loveseat or recliner. 

While cooking, please use hot pads that are provided, do not sit hot pans on countertop

Books are property of the flat, kindly don't take them home , and please respect the vintage ones. They were acquired for your enjoyment. 

Do not let robes fall into your luggage and later when questioned about it say, "it must have fallen into my luggage". They are there for your enjoyment. If you are interested in purchasing, message me.
sectionedDescription/interaction: I will be available at a whim, if anything were needed, for any reason.
sectionedDescription/name: The Carbon Flat, Beckley's Premium Choice!

In literally 10 seconds from the front door you can walk to Jimmy's Place, a local bar, that had been open since the 1960's, but shut down because of Covid 19. I have spent a great deal of time, programming information Such as info about the property , info on anything inside the flat and how to use it, restaurants, things to do, places to see, family friendly activities, hiking, shopping, etc...I have worked with many local restaurants and stores securing exclusive discount coupons for you, but you have to use the virtual concierge.  I have attached many pictures and videos,  of things in the flat that explain things better. So if you don't know how to make a pour over, it will teach you. 

I'm not going to list every little detail. I can only GUARANTEE you will not find anything like it locally, or for this price.  IF you do ill honor my guarantee and give you a weekend for free.

 I am also trying to set the bar for a different kind of service and go above and beyond. If you choose to book and will be staying at the flat long enough to need groceries, You can place a click list order and I will happily pick them up and have them stocked at the flat for you.  Local grocery store options are Kroger, Walmart, and Food Lion.

My father, myself, and generations in my family served in The United States Military. I am proud, and grateful  in offering a 15% military discount for Active Duty or former service members.  Please let me know before booking so that I can send you  the special offer. I would also ask that you provide some sort of verification.,  ie,  base card, VA ID, or DD214. You would want to think that no one would lie about serving in the military for a discount, but we all know better. This is actually a Federal crime punishable under The Stolen Valor Act of 2013 (revised from 2005).
sectionedDescription/summary: Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located flat, in the WVU Tech University District. Designed for couples,This historic filling station was acquired,gutted and purposely rebuilt for you,the discerning traveler,the parents of the students, or the traveling Doctor or Nurse. Designed in an urban industrial style, he unit is completely smart enabled,handicap accessible and overflowing with amenities that you would only expect from the most well known 5 star resorts. 15% Military Discount.
sectionedDescription/transit: IF you are driving by car , there are two parking spaces in front of the airbnb dedicated solely for your use. Other than that the usual options are available, taxi, uber, public transportation. If you are in need of any information, please let me know and iIwill provide you everything.

sectionedDescription/description:
Are you looking for the perfect SXS, ATV, dirt bike, or hunting getaway?  The outlaw lodge is a high occupancy lodge that seeks to bring  large groups and families together while exploring the beautiful state of West Virginia.  With outlaw and Hatfield McCoy trails close by its the perfect getaway for any group or family to go have fun.  Wilmore dam is a 10 min ride.  Food, grocery, gas, all within a 5 min drive.  We also have AT&T cell phone service.  McCoy Entrance top floor

primaryHost/about: My husband and I grew up here in WV and love the area.  There is so much to do outdoors, and the scenery is wonderful. Our family loves spending time by the water (lakes and rivers) in the summer and playing in the snow in the winter.

sectionedDescription/access: Everything, except one closet we keep locked with extra items.
sectionedDescription/description:
Slow down and enjoy mountain views and breezes from your private deck. Try this condo in our off season (spring - fall) and enjoy a quiet place when your not out exploring WV. In winter, ski in and  out from this condo onto the slopes of Winterplace Ski Resort. This condo is located on the third floor and the deck overlooks the 'Last Chance' and 'Last Run' trails. It is also close to Beckley and Princeton, Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve and southern WV whitewater country. During the ski season, we offer discounted equipment rentals from Ski Celebrations for all of our guests and for groups of 15 or more discounted lift tickets as well. 
The condo sleeps up to 10, great for a large family or a couple of small families with separate bathrooms or for those that just want some space and privacy that you can't get in a hotel. Extra-large deck to enjoy the views from. 
~ Details ~
~ Sleeps: up to 10  (for stays under 10 days)  
~ Master Bedroom: 1 Queen Size Bed with attached bath
~ Bedroom 2: 1 Queen Size Bed & 1 Twin Size Bed
~ Bunkroom: 2 Twin Size Beds (Bunk bed) 
~ Living Room: 2 Double Size Futons 
~ Cable TV in Living Room, Bedroom 1 and Bedroom 2 
~ Fully Equipped Kitchen 
~ Ski Rack 
~ Pets welcome with paid pet fee  (for stays under 10 days)  Contact us for more details. 
~ Views of Winterplace Ski Resort
The kitchen is totally equipped with all the essentials, including crock pot, coffee maker, pots and pans, a built-in microwave, dishwasher and everything that you need for your vacation. 
The living room consists of an electric fireplace and a view out the sliding glass doors onto the slopes. The master bedroom has a queen bed with a bath and views onto the mountains. 
Everything you need to create great family memories! 
The condo has electric baseboard heaters in each room, so you can adjust the heat to the temperature that you prefer when it's cold outside. When it's hot, there is an AC unit installed in the living room above the couch. This is for AC only. We are not allowed to do duct work in the 2nd or 3rd floor condos, so this is the only practical way to get AC in the unit, leaving room doors open as often as possible helps to keep the whole condo cool.
Please be aware there will be a $200 security deposit that will be pre-authorized on your credit card the day before you arrive and is released 7 days after you depart unless there is damage. This is a standard practice for vacation home rentals as there is no staff at the facility and this allows you to check in with an electronic door code and check out by just texting us and leaving the morning of your last day.
Also, the road to the condos is a gravel, hilly, road that Winterplace Ski Resort is paid to take care of it. Sometimes through the year, we will have heavy rains that create ruts in the road and Winterplace Ski Resort, being closed, is slow in making the repairs. Low clearance vehicles will need to be very careful coming up the hill from Winterplace Ski Resort's main parking area. In the winter, they grade the road and keep it plowed and put cinders on the road but please be prepared and understand you may need a four wheel drive, all wheel drive or chains to help get up the hill.
We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to www.InsureMyTrip.com for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsuraneMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.
~Long Term Stays ~
For those looking to stay for more than a week, the following changes apply:
- We only allow 3 people to stay per condo
- No pets allowed
- We do not provide daily maid service but will provide clean linens weekly. 
Please contact us for further information.
WINTERPLACE SKI-IN SKI-OUT CONDOS Enjoy skiing or snowboarding right outside your door while staying on the slopes at Winterplace Resort. Easy access to all the runs. Our condos are located on the top (3rd) floor with great views. Winterplace also offers snow-tubing runs and a snowboard terrain park. Winterplace Resort is conveniently located only 5 minutes from I-77 at the Ghent exit. 
NEAR BECKLEY AND WHITEWATER COUNTRY During the spring, summer and fall don’t think there is nothing to do. We are close to all the fun that southern West Virginia has to offer. Whitewater rafting, kayaking, river tubing, rock climbing, hiking, horseback riding etc. All different kinds of outdoor fun are waiting for you to take advantage of. There are several state and national parks close by, like Little Beaver State Parkand Grandview National ParkWe are also near Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve. The temperature in the mountains of West Virginia remains cooler than a lot of the surrounding states, so this is great place to come cool off. Enjoy something different from the beach, take your family out into nature. And for anytime of the year fun, Beckley has something for everyone. Of course, there are all your favorite fast food and sit down restaurants, as well as some home-grown restaurants that might become your new favorites. There is a wide variety of different shops. The Tamarackhas everything you might want to see from our unique West Virginia craftsman. There are a lot of different antique shops and Crossroads Mall for those that might want something a little familiar. There is the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, where you can tour an actual coal mine and let the kids explore the coal mining town and the Youth Museum. During good weather, there are also trails, playground, basketball and tennis courts and a pool with a waterslide. There is also, Mountain State Miniature Golfwhich doesn’t have just mini-golf but offers a small coffee shop and an indoor climbing wall. Beckley is a great place to spend a few days exploring all it has to offer and it’s only a quick drive up Interstate 77.

The condo sleeps up to 11, great for a large family or a couple of small families with separate bathrooms or for those that just want some space and privacy that you can't get in a hotel. Extra-large deck to enjoy the views from.

The kitchen is totally equipped with all the essentials, including crock pot, coffee maker, pots and pans, a built-in microwave, dishwasher and everything that you need for your vacation. 

The living room consists of an electric fireplace and a view out the sliding glass doors onto the slopes. The master bedroom has a queen bed with a bath and views onto the mountains.

Everything you need to create great family memories!

Details:
Sleeps: up to 11
Bedroom 1: 1 Twin Size Bed & 1 Queen Size Bed
Bedroom 2: (Master) 1 Queen Size Bed
Bunkroom: 2 Twin Size Beds (Bunk bed)
Living Room: 2 Double Size Futons
Cable TV in Living Room, Bedroom 1 and Bedroom 2
Fully Equipped Kitchen
Ski Rack
Great views of Winterplace Ski Resort

Everything, except one closet we keep locked with extra items.

We do not live very close but can be reached in an emergency. Also, the door has an electronic lock that we will send the code for the day before you arrive, so no need to worry about getting a key.

Car is required, there is no mass transit available in the area.

There is complimentary wi-fi available in the building, provided by the condo association. Here is the wi-fi network names that available: Engenius1, Engenius2, Engenius3, Engenius4, Engenius5, AP6

A washer and dryer is located in the building, on the 2nd floor toward the far end of the building. You will need to bring quarters and laundry detergent, etc.
