sectionedDescription/access:
As a guest, you will have access to the entire house, with the exception of the main bedroom.  We believe in providing our guests with privacy and comfort, and the main bedroom is designated as private for the homeowner and tour guide.  Rest assured, you will still have access to all the other rooms and amenities available in the house.  You can relax in the living room, cook delicious meals in the kitchen, enjoy meals in the dining area.  We want to ensure that your stay is both enjoyable and respectful of everyone's privacy.  If you have any specific needs or requests, please let us know, and we will do our best to accommodate them.  

Thank you for choosing Dirtman's Digs," we hope you have a fantastic experience with us!
sectionedDescription/description:
Explore with an "On Site" Expert Tour Guide, the Hatfield McCoy Trails, in the Serene Appalachian Mountains!  Ample Parking, Delightful breakfast, Reliable Cell Service, High-Speed Internet, Spacious Group Accommodations, Cozy Living Room.  Enjoy the Advantages of a Prime Location near Town w Restaurants, Access to ATV Wash & Gas Stations.  An ultimate package of Perks! Ideal for Couples, Group of Buddies, Families with ATV Enthusiastic Kids.  Bring your own ATV or Inquire about Rental Options.

Welcome To "Dirtman's Digs" - A  Guided Hatfield McCoy Tour w Lodging and Breakfast!  (Ask your tour guide, Brent, how he got the nickname)

Looking for an exhilarating ATV Adventure with your buddies, family, or significant other?  Look no further!  Our accommodation is perfect for groups of friends looking to conquer the ATV trails and have a memorable stay! 

Your "On Site" Tour Guide will ensure that you have an unforgettable experience exploring the Hatfield McCoy Trails.  

Our fully furnished home provides ample space for your group, ensuring a comfortable and enjoyable stay after a day of riding.  You have the option to bring your own ATV or rent a Can Am X3 (2 or 4 seats) to ride directly from the property to the trails.  

To start your mornings off right,  we offer a light breakfast to fuel your adventure.  You can count on reliable cell service and high-speed internet to stay connected and share your epic experience with the world.  

After a thrilling day on the trails,  kick back in our cozy living room, after taking hot showers, and relive the adrenaline-pumping moments.  We offer plenty of parking for your vehicles and trailers, making it convenient for you to load and unload your ATVs.  

If you've worked up and appetite, there are restaurants and bars nearby where you can refuel with delicious meals.  Buffalo Trail Restaurant & Bar, is 1 mile away, with a toasty firepit and outdoor patio.  Amenities like TVs in the living room, back porch grills, a spacious kitchen, with a large seating area, all provides a central gathering space for guests to share meals,  play games, engage in conversations, and keep your entertainment going.  Offering TVs in the bedrooms, provides guests with the option of enjoying some private entertainment and relaxation in the comfort of their own rooms.  We prioritize your comfort with new beds and fresh clean linens. Your host is also on site if you need recommendations or Comic Relief, He loves to Entertain! 

Our location offers easy access to the Hatfield McCoy trails, allowing you to ride right from our doorstep.  Enjoy the convenience of riding your ATV directly from our property,  without the need to move your truck.

Overall, having a tour guide to help navigate the Hatfield McCoy trails, can make the experience more enjoyable, and hassle free for our guests.   Allowing you to focus on experiencing the journey, without worrying about getting lost or getting stuck.  Having winches available and a well prepared plan, can provide a sense of security for guests, and address any potential predicaments that may arise during the tour.  Our guided tour package, allows you to leave the map reading to us, and enjoy a stress-free adventure that won't break your budget, in the comfort of our home away from home!

So, gather your buddies and get ready for an unforgettable  ATV adventure.

As a guest, you will have access to the entire house, with the exception of the main bedroom.  We believe in providing our guests with privacy and comfort, and the main bedroom is designated as private for the homeowner and tour guide.  Rest assured, you will still have access to all the other rooms and amenities available in the house.  You can relax in the living room, cook delicious meals in the kitchen, enjoy meals in the dining area.  We want to ensure that your stay is both enjoyable and respectful of everyone's privacy.  If you have any specific needs or requests, please let us know, and we will do our best to accommodate them.  

Thank you for choosing Dirtman's Digs," we hope you have a fantastic experience with us!

By staying on-site and cooking breakfast, you'll have the utmost flexibility and convenience, allowing you to start the day exactly as you wish, before embarking on an unforgettable trail riding adventure.  Please let us know if you prefer minimal interaction after the tour, or if you enjoy getting to know your host, who is happy to answer questions and get to know you.

The Airbnb house being located in town with all essential amenities nearby (such as Dollar Store, grocery store, tire store, ATV repair store, restaurants, gas, about everything you’ll need) can save time and effort during your stay.  Another perk is reduced wear and tear on your truck and trailers.  Avoiding the cost of towing them up the mountain long distances, adds to the ease and enjoyment of your stay.

Please specify how many trucks and trailers you will be bringing, so that I can provide appropriate parking spaces to accommodate you.  
When you arrive: Park on the gravel in front of the house, there is additional parking in the rear of the house, unload, you're welcome to enter the house, and drive your side by side or ATV anywhere you want to go in WV.

Your trail riding experience is customizable, and there is no strict time frame to follow.  As your guide, my goal is to create a personalized adventure that aligns with your riding preferences and showcases the places you'd like to see.  

Please let me know what kind of trail riding you enjoy, whether its scenic trails, challenging terrains, or a mix of both.  Additionally, if there are specific landmarks, viewpoints, or trails you'd like to visit during your rides, please share them with me.

*Our Nightly Rate is for up to 10 Guests, $100 Fee for each additional Guest*
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Please Take Off Shoes Before Entering the House!  We acquire a lot of mud on the trails!
Since we are gone all day riding, we don't allow pets, as there is no one to let them out.  Please ask if you need accommodations for pet boarding in town.

name: Winterplace Condo E302
primaryHost/about: My husband and I grew up here in WV and love the area.  There is so much to do outdoors, and the scenery is wonderful. Our family loves spending time by the water (lakes and rivers) in the summer and playing in the snow in the winter.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Slow down and enjoy mountain views and breezes from your private deck. Try this condo in our off season (spring - fall) and enjoy a quiet place when your not out exploring WV. In winter, ski in and out from this condo onto the slopes of Winterplace Ski Resort. This condo is located on the third floor and the deck overlooks the 'Last Chance' and 'Last Run' trails. It is also close to Beckley and Princeton, Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve and southern WV whitewater country. During the ski season, we offer discounted equipment rentals from Ski Celebrations for all of our guests.
The condo sleeps up to 10, great for a large family or a couple of small families with separate bathrooms or for those that just want some space and privacy that you can't get in a hotel. Private deck to enjoy the views from.
~ DETAILS ~
~ Sleeps: up to 10  (for stays under 10 days) 
~ Master Bedroom: 1 Queen Size Bed with attached bath 
~ Bedroom 2: 1 Queen Size Bed
~ Bunkroom: 2 Twin Size Beds (Bunk)
~ Living Room: 1 Double Size Futon and L Shaped Sofa
~ Cable TV in Living Room and all three bed rooms
~ Fully Equipped Kitchen
~ Ski Rack
~ Small Dryer in the condo
~ Pets welcome with paid pet fee  (for stays under 10 days)  Contact us for more details. 
~ Views of Winterplace Ski Resort
The kitchen is totally equipped with all the essentials, including crock pot, coffee maker, pots and pans, a built-in microwave, dishwasher and everything that you need for your vacation.
The living room consist of an electric fireplace and a view out the sliding glass doors onto the slopes. The master bedroom has a queen bed with a bath and views onto the mountains.
Everything you need to create great family memories!
The condo has electric baseboard heaters in each room, so you can adjust the heat to the temperature that you prefer when it's cold outside. When it's hot, there is an AC unit installed in the living room above the sliding glass door. This is for AC only. We are not allowed to do duct work in the 2nd or 3rd floor condos, so this is the only practical way to get AC in the unit, leaving room doors open as often as possible helps to keep the whole condo cool.
Please be aware there will be a $200 security deposit that will be pre-authorized on your credit card the day before you arrive and is released 7 days after you depart unless there is damage. This is a standard practice for vacation home rentals as there is no staff at the facility and this allows you to check in with an electronic door code and check out by just texting us and leaving the morning of your last day.
Also, the road to the condos is a gravel, hilly, road that Winterplace Ski Resort is paid to take care of it. Sometimes through the year, we will have heavy rains that create ruts in the road and Winterplace Ski Resort, being closed, is slow in making the repairs. Low clearance vehicles will need to be very careful coming up the hill from Winterplace Ski Resort's main parking area. In the winter, they grade the road and keep it plowed and put cinders on the road but please be prepared and understand you may need a four wheel drive, all wheel drive or chains to help get up the hill.
We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to www.InsureMyTrip.com for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsuraneMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.
~Long Term Stays ~
For those looking to stay for more than a week, the following changes apply:
- We only allow 3 people to stay per condo
- No pets allowed
- We do not provide daily maid service but will provide clean linens weekly. 
Please contact us for further information.
WINTERPLACE SKI-IN SKI-OUT CONDOS
Enjoy skiing or snowboarding right outside your door while staying on the slopes at Winterplace Resort. Easy access to all the runs. Our condos are located on the top (3rd) floor with great views. Winterplace also offers snow-tubing runs and a snowboard terrain park. Winterplace Resort is conveniently located only 5 minutes from I-77 at the Ghent exit.
NEAR BECKLEY AND WHITEWATER COUNTRY
During the spring, summer and fall don’t think there is nothing to do. We are close to all the fun that southern West Virginia has to offer. Whitewater rafting, kayaking, river tubing, rock climbing, hiking, horseback riding etc. All different kinds of outdoor fun are waiting for you to take advantage of.There are several state and national parks near by, like Little Beaver State Parkand Grandview National Park. We are also near Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve. The temperature in the mountains of West Virginia remains cooler than a lot of the surrounding states, so this is great place to come cool off. Enjoy something different from the beach, take your family out into nature.
And for anytime of the year fun, Beckley has something for everyone. Of course, there are all your favorite fast food and sit down restaurants, as well as some home-grown restaurants that might become your new favorites. There is a wide variety of different shops. The Tamarackhas everything you might want to see from our unique West Virginia craftsman. There are a lot of different antique shops and Crossroads Mall for those that might want something a little familiar. There is the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, where you can tour an actual coal mine and let the kids explore the coal mining town and the Youth Museum. During good weather, there are also trails, playground, basketball and tennis courts and a pool with a waterslide. There is also, Mountain State Miniature Golfwhich doesn’t have just mini-golf but offers a small coffee shop and an indoor climbing wall. Beckley is a great place to spend a few days exploring all it has to offer and it’s only a quick drive up Interstate 77.

additionalHouseRules:
1. No parties or events may be held at the Loft or on the property. 
2. No overnight guests other than those registered and approved when making the reservation online. If you are expecting visitors for a short period of time during your stay, please let your hosts know.
3. No pets are permitted without prior permission and with an additional pet charge of $25 per pet (maximum one large dog or two small dogs). Sorry, no cats are permitted ever. We have four (friendly) dogs so we will need to coordinate yard usage to avoid any possible problems. Please clean up after your pet! Pets may not be left unattended for more than 2 hours and must be in a kennel/travel carrier. If you need assistance finding a dog-sitter please contact your hosts ahead of time.
4. Trash cans and bags are provided in the Loft (under the sink in the kitchen and bathroom). If the cans get full during your stay, please take the trash out and put in one of the trash cans in, or by, the driveway. No need to take out the trash at the end of your stay.
5. No hair dying or coloring is permitted in the Loft.
6. We do not have child safety features; children are welcome if you accept liability and are comfortable knowing we have no child proofing along with many stairs.
7. Minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied, in person AT ALL TIMES, by an adult over 21. You must be 21 to book a reservation at the Loft.
8. The antler hooks by the door will not hold heavy loads. Please only hang light jackets and clothing on them.
9. Please clean your boots/shoes as well as you can before entering the building and use the boot tray upstairs by the door for your boots and shoes.
10. Please do not block neighbor’s driveways, including the apartment’s next door. We will do what we can to help you with parking (including our driveway and street parking in front of our house). Please let us know if you’re traveling with a trailer so we can help you plan for parking.
11. If you would like to sit outside, you are welcome to use the camp chairs at the bottom of the stairs. If it is raining or too sunny, feel free to sit under the carport by the house. If we are parked there, just send us a message during daytime hours (9 a.m. to 9 p.m.) and we’ll move our car: we want you to enjoy your stay! You can also sit in the backyard but be aware that our dogs will occasionally need to be let out. If you are using the yard and/or grill, we will check with you before letting out the dogs. When sitting outside after 9 p.m. please try to keep the noise down so as not to disturb the residents and neighbors.
12. Do not go out on the roof. While it looks like a great place to hang out, it’s not safe for people and walking on the shingles are likely to cause damage.
13. Without exception, no smoking, vaping or marijuana usage inside the Loft. Please don’t think it can be covered up, it cannot. We have to extensively clean to remove the contaminant before other guests can arrive. Neutralizing this contaminant inside requires a $100 minimum service fee. Feel free to step outside in the back yard and quietly enjoy a tobacco smoke or vape; you'll just need to police your butts.
14. Before you leave, please wash any dishes that you used. Clean dishes can be left in the drainer to dry and we’ll put them away.
15. No need to strip the bed or pile up used towels and washcloths upon departure but during your stay, please hang wet towels and washcloths on the towel racks, shower curtain rod or side of the bathtub.
16. Please lock the door at the bottom of the steps whenever you leave the premises, including your departure.

name: Foggy Mountain Loft near Hatfield & McCoy Trails
photos/0/caption: Newly remodeled space is comfortable and welcoming.
photos/1/caption: Foggy Mountain Loft is an "L" shaped studio apartment, newly remodeled with added features to make your stay comfortable.
photos/2/caption: A small refrigerator/freezer (with bottled water waiting for you). The couch folds down to a small bed, if you're traveling with a third person.
photos/3/caption: If you forget your teddy, you can use ours; he's waiting in the room for you!
photos/4/caption: A comfortable full-size bed awaits you!
photos/5/caption: There's a Roku TV for you to log in to your favorite app to enjoy your down time. It will rotate so you can watch from bed or the couch.
photos/6/caption: A comfortable place for two to eat, and the table expands to add a folding chair if you have a third.
photos/7/caption: A microwave, coffee maker, water heater and toaster are available for your use.
photos/8/caption: A few snacks will be available to hold you over until meal time!
photos/9/caption: A full-size tub/shower is part of the full bathroom.
photos/10/caption: We'll have a few essentials available if you forget anything.
photos/11/caption: You'll find a place to hang your jacket and park your boots in the corner as you enter. There is central heating and a window air conditioner to keep you comfortable.

primaryHost/about: I'm a retired Army chaplain who likes to travel and is now offering our guest house behind our retirement home for you to enjoy.
sectionedDescription/access: Foggy Mountain Loft is on a residential street near town with free on-street parking. If you're towing a trailer, we'll try to save the spaces in front of the house for you with prior arrangement or you can use our driveway. You'll have a private entrance to the Loft at the end of the driveway with access through a digital keypad deadbolt lock.
sectionedDescription/description:
Great place near Hatfield & McCoy trailheads! The Foggy Mountain Loft has the feel of a mountain hideaway but in town, close to where you want to play & eat. There's a private entrance to this simple guest loft above the garage behind our home. You'll find a basic kitchenette, full bathroom, Roku TV and WiFi. At over 50 years old, the Loft shows its age with multiple layers of paint and years of cosmetic repairs, but it has been recently renovated to create a safe, clean & comfortable space.

The Foggy Mountain Loft is a single L-shaped room which has a double bed, futon couch, and a full bathroom with bathtub and shower. You can use our Adirondack chairs to spend time outside or stay in and watch your streaming apps on the Roku TV. There isn't a stove or oven in the Loft but there is a microwave, coffee maker, hot water kettle, toaster, air fryer and electric skillet for simple food preparation, and a grill in the garage you can use upon request.  There are also many great restaurants in Logan just a few minutes away.

Foggy Mountain Loft is on a residential street near town with free on-street parking. If you're towing a trailer, we'll try to save the spaces in front of the house for you with prior arrangement or you can use our driveway. You'll have a private entrance to the Loft at the end of the driveway with access through a digital keypad deadbolt lock.

We're available during your stay for assistance or to answer questions but you'll have as much privacy as you're looking for.

There are many places to eat in Logan and a lot of things to do:

Chief Logan State Park: 5.6 miles
Chief Logan Recreation Center: 8.2 miles
Dunks Body Shop (Gym): 12.5 miles
H & M Bearwallow Trail connector: 1 mile
H & M Bearwallow Trailhead: 4.1 miles
H & M Rockhouse Trailhead: 13.8 miles
H & M Buffalo Mountain Trailhead: 28 miles
H & M Devil Anse Trailhead: 34.6 miles

Gas station (which usually has the cheapest gas in Logan) is just about a mile away (just past the coffee house and bakery...)!

On street parking is easy to find near Foggy Mountain Loft. If you're raveling with a trailer you'll be able to find a spot within a couple blocks of the Loft. With prior arrangement, guests traveling with a trailer can have the parking spaces in front of  our house saved by us until their arrival or can park in the driveway (pulling truck into carport, there's room for a trailer with one ATV).

This is a 2nd floor loft with a narrow staircase, so you'll need to keep an eye on small children and keep in mind your own ability to climb stairs.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
1. No parties or events may be held at the Loft or on the property. 
2. No overnight guests other than those registered and approved when making the reservation online. If you are expecting visitors for a short period of time during your stay, please let your hosts know.
3. No pets are permitted without prior permission and with an additional pet charge of $25 per pet (maximum one large dog or two small dogs). Sorry, no cats are permitted ever. We have four (friendly) dogs so we will need to coordinate yard usage to avoid any possible problems. Please clean up after your pet! Pets may not be left unattended for more than 2 hours and must be in a kennel/travel carrier. If you need assistance finding a dog-sitter please contact your hosts ahead of time.
4. Trash cans and bags are provided in the Loft (under the sink in the kitchen and bathroom). If the cans get full during your stay, please take the trash out and put in one of the trash cans in, or by, the driveway. No need to take out the trash at the end of your stay.
5. No hair dying or coloring is permitted in the Loft.
6. We do not have child safety features; children are welcome if you accept liability and are comfortable knowing we have no child proofing along with many stairs.
7. Minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied, in person AT ALL TIMES, by an adult over 21. You must be 21 to book a reservation at the Loft.
8. The antler hooks by the door will not hold heavy loads. Please only hang light jackets and clothing on them.
9. Please clean your boots/shoes as well as you can before entering the building and use the boot tray upstairs by the door for your boots and shoes.
10. Please do not block neighbor’s driveways, including the apartment’s next door. We will do what we can to help you with parking (including our driveway and street parking in front of our house). Please let us know if you’re traveling with a trailer so we can help you plan for parking.
11. If you would like to sit outside, you are welcome to use the camp chairs at the bottom of the stairs. If it is raining or too sunny, feel free to sit under the carport by the house. If we are parked there, just send us a message during daytime hours (9 a.m. to 9 p.m.) and we’ll move our car: we want you to enjoy your stay! You can also sit in the backyard but be aware that our dogs will occasionally need to be let out. If you are using the yard and/or grill, we will check with you before letting out the dogs. When sitting outside after 9 p.m. please try to keep the noise down so as not to disturb the residents and neighbors.
12. Do not go out on the roof. While it looks like a great place to hang out, it’s not safe for people and walking on the shingles are likely to cause damage.
13. Without exception, no smoking, vaping or marijuana usage inside the Loft. Please don’t think it can be covered up, it cannot. We have to extensively clean to remove the contaminant before other guests can arrive. Neutralizing this contaminant inside requires a $100 minimum service fee. Feel free to step outside in the back yard and quietly enjoy a tobacco smoke or vape; you'll just need to police your butts.
14. Before you leave, please wash any dishes that you used. Clean dishes can be left in the drainer to dry and we’ll put them away.
15. No need to strip the bed or pile up used towels and washcloths upon departure but during your stay, please hang wet towels and washcloths on the towel racks, shower curtain rod or side of the bathtub.
16. Please lock the door at the bottom of the steps whenever you leave the premises, including your departure.

additionalHouseRules:
NO GUESTS UNDER THE AGE OF 18 ALLOWED. 19 AND ABOVE ONLY.

Thank you for choosing The Beckley Guesthouse for your vacation needs.  We appreciate and respect all of our guests, and hope that you will love and respect our home as much as we do!
In order for us to offer the same level of quality to each of our guests, we ask that you kindly respect the following house rules:


1.  Absolutely No Eating in any areas of the house except the kitchen and the dining room. Please do not carry food to bedrooms.
 PLEASE.....
2.  Always remove and leave shoes at the door.
3.  Please do not allow furbabies to sleep on beds or furniture. We make available extra sheets and blankets to cover beds and furniture.
3.  LEAVE ALL SKI EQUIPMENT on the deck.  You may bring ski boots inside, but please make sure they remain on the linoleum in the entryway.
4.  Do Not place luggage, bags, etc. on the bedding.
5.  Do Not Lounge or Sleep on top of the comforters or on the decorative pillows.   
6.  Do Not wear perfumes or colognes to bed.
7.  Do Not wear any type of jewelry to bed.  It picks and tears the sheets.
8.  Do Not Flush anything in the toilets except toilet tissue.
9.  Do Not Move furniture in the house without the help of the owners. 
10.  Please recycle all hard plastics, paper, cardboard boxes, aluminum and tin.  
11.  Place ALL TRASH in large kitchen trash bags before placing it in the large trash cans under the deck.
12.  Please return any books enjoyed to their proper place.
13.  Please leave the house in the same condition and placement in which you found it.    
                                     


Thank you!
Please enjoy your stay!

name: New River Gorge! Sleeps 6. Dog friendly!

photos/2/caption: Sunny and cozy upstairs queen room with ensuite

primaryHost/about: I'm a single mom living in wild, wonderful West Virginia. I and my daughters, who are in their final university years, have opened our home to travelers looking for a home-away-from-home. We understand the pleasure of comfort, clean beds, and warm hospitality.  We love West Virginia and its never-ending opportunity for year-round recreation. Hiking, biking, skiing, fishing, rock climbing, and whitewater rafting are all to be found among the national parklands within a drive of less than a half hour from our door.  We hope to meet you soon and share our beautiful home! Look for "Almost Heaven Home" on (Hidden by Airbnb) and other social media.
sectionedDescription/access: You will have the home to yourselves. The owner does not live in this home.
sectionedDescription/description:
Welcome to our happy Gathering Place....for friends and family to make their own forever-memories! The guesthouse is a spacious pet-friendly home set up with your comfort in mind. Featuring amazing original hardwood floors throughout, high-ceilings, large fully equipped kitchen with extra workspace, five bedrooms, three full baths and a study that can be used for extra sleeping space. Spacious common rooms to spread out, relax, play games or tackle a puzzle. Very comfy beds w/lots of pillows.

"The Gathering Place for Friends, Family and Fur Babies"

You will have the home to yourselves. The owner does not live in this home.

I love to meet all of my guests, however, I travel a lot for work and family so a friend/host may be there to greet you when I cannot.

The guesthouse is located in a nice, quiet neighborhood within walking distance of our lovely downtown area where you can make the short walk to local night life, restaurants and shops. We manage four of five houses on the street which are used as Airbnb homes and corporate rentals, so know who your neighbors are.

There are three off-street parking spaces behind the house exclusively for guest use and plenty of extra parking across the street in business parking lots that agree to overnight and weekend usage. If a private driver is needed, please let us know, and we can help you make arrangements with a local Uber driver.

We do not provide breakfast items for parties that book the house exclusively.

name: Nature Lovers Paradise,  horses, hikers, bikers
primaryHost/about: Former Navy SEAL turned Air bnb host/wilderness/survival enthusiast!
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautifully remodeled ranch cabin adjoining the Jefferson National Forest is the perfect escape for you, your family and even your horses or mules.  The cabin boasts high end finishes throughout with custom woodwork in the kitchen and dining areas. This large yet cozy home is within walking distance to the Dismal Falls, Appalachian Trail, Flat Top horse trails and all that surrounds, in the Jefferson National Forest.

This is the best of both worlds!  Finally, you don't have to choose between a great place to trail ride, hike, mountain bike, cycle or adventure ride and a nice place to stay!  The Jefferson National Forest in the rear and Dismal Creek (a Virginia fisheries stocked trout stream) runs through the front yard.  We welcome hunters and fisherman seasonally for world class deer, turkey and bear hunting and trout and bass fishing.  Motorcyclists on or on/off road find Bland County a beautiful and exciting place to ride.

The host is also a guide who offers hiking and rafting packages for adventurers and he or his staff is readily available to address any issue or answer any question our guests may have.

This is a somewhat remote location although there is a corner store you should bring in what you need to maximize  enjoying your time with family and friends or the quiet and peace the creek and wilderness offer.

sectionedDescription/access: The property is fenced in however there is a private entrance with deck, for the space. The entrance is located outside of the fenced in area. The area is safe so I will leave the door open and the key on the table. There is no protocol for checking in, so you may access the space when you arrive. Parking is in front of the steps leading up to the space. Please don't park in front of garage doors. Thanks so much.
sectionedDescription/description:
Full bath, Queen bed, flat screen TV (dish), free wi-fi. Private entrance. Very safe area. We are located between Abingdon Va. and St. Paul Va. on highway 58.

This rental is in a separate part of our home and offers total privacy. The bed is a queen size so space will only accommodate two adults comfortably. There is one full bath and a small kitchen. The home sits on an acre of property and joins several vacant acres in behind.

The property is fenced in however there is a private entrance with deck, for the space. The entrance is located outside of the fenced in area. The area is safe so I will leave the door open and the key on the table. There is no protocol for checking in, so you may access the space when you arrive. Parking is in front of the steps leading up to the space. Please don't park in front of garage doors. Thanks so much.

We are always available to our guests to answer questions about the area or to resolve any issues that might occur with the space. You will be provided with our cell and house phone numbers in the event that you need anything, otherwise you will have total privacy.

Quite neighborhood with two miles of walking trails, through the woods, on our property.
In St. Paul, Va. just about 7 miles away is the Sugar Hills ATV and hiking trails, and the newly remodeled "Western Front" with a nice Restaurant. Sugar Hill Brewery is also a great place to eat and experience local beer. 
The Hidden Valley Lake Area offers hiking, boating and fishing, and is just a few miles away. Fifteen- twenty miles away is The Channels, a majestic sandstone formation that is over 400-million years old. Great Hike !  The "Devils Bath Tub" is not to far away and a must see. The Pinnacle Natural Area Reserve is also very close and quite spectacular. The town of Abingdon (18 miles away) is a great little town with some excellent restaurants,  Wolf Hills Brewing Company, The Creeper Trail, The Barter Theater (state theater of Virginia!), biking and walking trails, festivals, and much more.

Please check location of the property before booking. 
Thanks

For guests that will be using the space for extended time periods, we laundry the bed linens, towels and wash cloths once per week.  We do not clean the space or wash the linens with synthetic perfumed products.   We ask that you do not use room deodorizers, incense or scented candles in the space.  We also ask that you use colognes and perfumes sparingly.  We strive to use all natural products for cleaning, laundering and sanitizing to provide for the comfort and safety of our guests and our cleaning crew. Thanks so much for you cooperation.

We strive to use all natural products for cleaning, laundering and sanitizing to provide for the comfort and safety of our guests and our cleaning crew. Thanks so much for you cooperation.

sectionedDescription/access: DOOR ENTRY CODE: The house has a lock on the entry door with a numeric keypad. Your entry code will be active from 4PM on your arrival date through 10AM on your departure date. Your door code will be provided in your reminder notice that will be emailed to you upon your final payment.
sectionedDescription/description:
WELCOME TO MOUNTAIN TRAILS OFF-ROAD LODGING WV

We are a small campground but have 2 additional cabins and several campsites that are ideal for either tent camping or toy hauler/RV camping. Our Deluxe furnished cabin is equipped with AC/heat and full size fridges.
 
We cater to ATV, SXS, and off road riders who come to the Southern West Virginia area to ride the trails here. Situated close to HMT and outlaw trails. You can ride from camp with no need to trailer your machines.

DOOR ENTRY CODE: The house has a lock on the entry door with a numeric keypad. Your entry code will be active from 4PM on your arrival date through 10AM on your departure date. Your door code will be provided in your reminder notice that will be emailed to you upon your final payment.

By renting this house you agree to the following terms and conditions:

REMINDER NOTICE: You are responsible for printing and bringing the reminder notice that we will email to you when your final payment is received. The reminder notice will have the physical address of the community for your GPS, gate access instructions, the door entry code as well as some other important information. If you have not received this reminder notice with your final payment confirmation you must let us know prior to your arrival date.

CHECK-IN is at 10:00 AM or after.

CHECK OUT is at 6:00 PM or earlier.
You must check out by 6:00 PM; otherwise, any delays to the check-out give us a charge by the cleaning company is USD $100 per fraction and/or entire hour delayed on your check-out and this charge will be passed on to you via Resolution Center. We reserve the right to remove any luggage and other personal belongings from the house.

OWNER: Owner shall provide all utilities, furnishings, towels, linens and starter bathroom supplies. Owner is not responsible for any utility or cable/internet interruptions during the guests stay but will make every attempt to have the utility/cable company restore their services as soon as possible.

GUEST: Guest agrees to leave unit in the same condition as found. Furniture must be in the same location as when you arrived. Dishes, pots and pans must be properly cleaned as to not have any baked on food, all trash (water bottles, boxes, bags etc) must be picked up and put out for the trash during your stay and upon departure. Any damage to the unit will be your responsibility. You are responsible for making sure the cabin/home is properly secured at all times. Owner assumes no liability for property loss or damage, nor liability for accidents or injury.

**Service calls deemed non-emergencies where a staff member made it out to the property and a non-emergency service was provided after hours will incur a $75 fee. Note that our ability to respond to unforeseen circumstances may vary on a third party provider.**

The house will be inspected before your arrival and immediately after your departure.

sectionedDescription/description:
This is the home where I live. I travel a lot and decided to share my beautiful home with the Airbnb community!  The central location of my home makes it convenient for large groups to stay together while enjoying their visit to our area!

Although I will be away during your stay, I am always available to be reached by phone.  In addition, I have assembled a team of top notch individuals to be available for us should any need arise.

Walking distance to McDonald’s.  5 minutes drive or 25 min walk to restaurants on Main Street. 6 min drive to the Back of the Dragon

additionalHouseRules:
All reservations are considered confirmed at the time of booking. Please note that the  terms of this Rental Agreement are non-negotiable. This Rental Agreement MUST be agreed upon at time of booking. 
 1. RENTAL. The rental rate for the Rental Property is based on a party of four (4) persons. Guest acknowledges that additional persons are permitted provided the number of persons does not exceed the maximum occupancy for the Rental Property. Guest further understands that for each additional person, a fee of $10.00 shall be added to the nightly rental rate provided each additional guest is registered prior to check-in as set forth herein. 

2. CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT TIMES. Guest may check-in at any time after 3:00 p.m. on Guest's Arrival Date, and the Guest shall check-out no later than 10:00 a.m. on the Guest's Departure Date. A minimum fee of $25.00 per hour may be charged to the renter’s card for checkout after 10:00 AM unless previous arrangements have been made through this office.

3. REFUNDS. Guest hereby agrees and acknowledges that Guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event Guest departs before the end of the Reservation or in the event Guest arrives late or does not arrive for the Reservation. Guest further hereby agrees and acknowledges that there will be no refund nor relocation in the event Guest is disappointed with the Rental Property. Furthermore, there shall be no refund or compensation for the occurrence of any and all events out of the control of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS, including but not limited to, weather conditions, power outages, water outages, mechanical failure of appliances and electronics, and/or central heat and air. Furthermore, Guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event Guest is required to vacate the Rental Property due to a violation of local, state or federal law or the policies of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. Refunds will only be issued at the discretion of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS.

4. DAMAGES. Guest shall be solely responsible for any property damage, accident or injury to any person or loss sustained by any person, including loss of money, jewelry and other items of personal property, arising out of or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided by KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS and/or the owner of the Rental Property. Guest shall inspect and be familiar with proper use and application of such items prior to using them. Guest hereby agrees to indemnify and hold KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS and/or the owner of the Rental Property harmless from any and all claims including those of third parties, arising out of, or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided therein. 

5. AGENCY DISCLOSURE. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS serves as the agent of the owner of the Rental Property. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall represent and act at all times in the best interests of the owner of the Rental Property. Furthermore, KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS reserves the right for random inspections to insure that all policies and procedures are followed. All information provided by KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS regarding the Rental Property has been provided by the owner of the Rental Property and is believed to be accurate, but cannot be guaranteed. Guest acknowledges that the owner of the Rental Property may remove the Rental Property from the rental program with KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. Guest further understands that availability of the Rental Property cannot be guaranteed, and KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS may find it necessary to move Guest to a comparable rental property.

6. VISITORS. A Visitor of the Guest(s) may occupy the property on a temporary basis only. Visitors may not occupy the property beyond 10:00 pm or stay overnight without being registered with KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. Each rental property has a maximum occupancy and at NO time should said property be occupied by more than allowed number of guest stated. No house parties, weddings or other events are allowed. Should evidence of misuse or violation of occupancy be discovered at any time, the Guest(s) of record will be charged accordingly or immediately evicted without refund. 
 
7. USE OF RENTAL PROPERTY. Guest shall occupy and use the Rental Property in a manner that shall not disturb or offend neighbors of the Rental Property. The use of fireworks is strictly prohibited, and any violators of this provision shall be asked to vacate the Rental Property immediately.  Camp fires are permitted only in the designated fire pit and may only be used after 4 pm.  Camp fire must be attended at all times.

8. PETS.  Pets are NOT allowed in the rental property.  If evidence of a pet is found in the rental property, such as, but not limited to, feces/urine or fleas, a minimum of $50, together with the costs and expenses of additional cleaning services necessary to remove odors and/or stains shall be charged to the renter’s card. 

9. TELEVISIONS. A television equipped with Roku has been provided at KNOTTY POPLAR CABINS.  There will be no option of ordering pay- per-view movies and/or events. In the event Guest orders a pay-per-view movie and/or event, Guest shall be assessed for the cost of the movie(s) and/or event(s), together with a service charge of $10.00. Satellite signal and reception and cable reception is not always reliable, especially during extreme weather, and cannot be guaranteed. 

10. INTERNET. Internet service is provided at all rental properties; however, the speed of the service is not guaranteed. The password for said service will be given to you at time of check-in or by calling the office. Please note that all internet services are not secured. Should guest be found illegally using, downloading, copying, and/or distributing copyrighted material over the network then guest shall be subject to any and all actions imposed by service provider for copyright infringement cost. 

11. FURNITURE. Please do not move any of the cabin furniture (including outdoor furniture) as this may scratch the floor causing damages. If the furniture or floors are damaged during your stay you will be held responsible and charged accordingly. 

12. HEATING AND AIR.  Knotty Poplar Cabins contains electric heat which is controlled by a thermostat in the winter months.  Central air and /or window unit air conditioners will be provided in the property during the summer months.

13. LOST AND FOUND. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall not be responsible for any personal belongings that are lost, stolen, or left behind by Guest or any member of Guest's party. Any personal items found in or around the Rental Property shall be held for thirty (30) days. After the thirty (30) days, any unclaimed items will be discarded or donated unless the owner of the item contacts KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS and claims the item. The item will be returned to said individual at his/her expense. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS will not be responsible for any lost items or damage to the items during shipping.

14. REPAIRS. Guest hereby agrees that KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS or its agents may enter the Rental Property for the purpose of making necessary repairs and/or maintenance in and around the Rental Property. Furthermore, KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS does not guarantee against mechanical failures that may occur in the heating, air conditioning, television, satellite receivers, cable box, or any other appliances. In the event an appliance or system is inoperative, Guest shall contact KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS immediately. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall make every effort to have the repairs done quickly and efficiently, or KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall move Guest to a different rental property, if possible. Guest(s) who have an after-hours emergency at the number which will be provided to you. All non-emergency issues should be reported to KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS, at the number which will be provided you, during regular business hours. For any medical related emergency, call 911.

15. AGE REQUIREMENT. Guest is at least eighteen (18) years of age and acknowledges that he/she may be asked to provide proof of age at the time the Reservation is made. Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the Rental Property during the Reservation. If Guest is not eighteen (18) years or older, KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS reserves the right to terminate the Reservation without a refund. 

16. GARBAGE REMOVAL. All garbage must be bagged and removed from inside of the Rental Property. Bagged garbage may be placed in the outside garbage cans and will be picked up daily by an employee of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS.  Guest acknowledges that leaving garbage outside the designated container(s) may attract unwanted animals. 

17. SMOKING/NON-SMOKING. All properties are non-smoking. Smoking outside is allowed unless otherwise stated. Please be neat in disposing of cigarette butts, do not discard them around the property, driveway or yard. In the event smoking occurs inside the cabin, you shall be assessed a minimum charge of $250.00. 

18. CRITTERS & WILDLIFE. Please remember you are in the mountains. Each unit is professionally treated for pest control on a regular basis. Occasionally a few critters could make their way inside. In these rare instances, no refund will be given. In such a case, notify the office and we will make every effort to solve the problem in a timely manner. Please do your part by keeping windows and doors closed and all food and trash inside or in the appropriate outside receptacles.

19. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF RISKS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges that there are certain risks of physical injury, property damage, and inherent potential dangers of the activities conducted within (or upon) the KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges the risks and dangers associated with his/her use of the KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS premises, facilities, and equipment, and that such use has inherent dangers of personal injury and property damage. The undersigned Guest further accepts sole responsibility for risks and dangers which include, without limitation, the potential for serious bodily injury, permanent disability, paralysis and loss of life, disfigurement, loss of or damage to equipment/property, exposure to extreme conditions, harmful physical conflicts with other guests, animal attack, snake bites, insect bites/stings, allergic reactions, lightning strikes, dangers arising from adverse weather conditions, falling, fires and burns, dangerous road or trail conditions, water hazards, land hazards, equipment failure, defective equipment, inadequate safety measures, criminal activity of other guests, poor lighting, and other undefined not readily foreseeable and presently unknown risks and dangers (“Risks”). Guest expressly assumes the Risks of any and all damage and injury of any kind or type which may result from any source whatsoever during his/her time on the premises of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS.

By booking this property, Guest is acknowledging that he/she has read, fully understands, and agrees to all the above.

name: Elk Ridge Cabin ~ Direct Spearhead trail access!
photos/23/caption: Bedroom #4- 2 full
photos/25/caption: Driveway leading to Elk Ridge cabin
photos/26/caption: Private connector trail leading to Spearhead trail # 21
sectionedDescription/access: Guests will have the entire house to themselves.
sectionedDescription/description:
Elk Ridge Cabin is situated in scenic Southwest Virginia. It is ideal for ATV enthusiasts looking for a nightly or weekly cabin rental.  A 5-minute ATV ride on our private trail gives you access to miles of the Spearhead Trail System (Coal Canyon).  Elk Ridge offers plenty of room for your family or group and is the perfect place to return after an adventure filled day of trail-riding.

Elk Ridge offers 4 bedrooms and 1 bath and has all the essentials for your stay. You will enjoy your own space with plenty of room and privacy. WIFI is available and the TV is equipped with ROKU.  The kitchen is fully equipped with a stove, refrigerator, cook ware, eating and cooking utensils, a slow-cooker, and a drip coffee maker.  Bed linens are provided, but please bring your own towels.

Guests will have the entire house to themselves.

Elk Ridge Cabin is located between Grundy, VA and Southern Gap, where the Coal Canyon trail head is located. Various restaurants, a gas station, and Wal-Mart are located in the Grundy town center within 7 miles of the cabin location.  Elk Ridge is also a short drive from Breaks Interstate Park, Haysi, VA, and Elkhorn City, KY.   The Breaks Interstate Park offers various walking/bike trails, a water park, horseback riding, and zip lining.  River tubing trips are available on the Russell Fork River.  Time-Out Pizza/arcade located in Elkhorn City, KY offers tube rentals and a shuttle service for this activity.  Haysi and Elkhorn City offer 16 miles of whitewater rafting ranging from Class II to Class V rapids.

Parking:  The driveway to the cabin is a maintained, gravel road with a turn at the top of the hill.  A 4-wheel drive vehicle is best.  There is plenty of parking on location; however if additional parking is needed for extra large trailers, parking is available just below the property at our residence.

The item will be returned to said individual at his/her expense. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS will not be responsible for any lost items or damage to the items during shipping.

14. REPAIRS. Guest hereby agrees that KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS or its agents may enter the Rental Property for the purpose of making necessary repairs and/or maintenance in and around the Rental Property. Furthermore, KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS does not guarantee against mechanical failures that may occur in the heating, air conditioning, television, satellite receivers, cable box, or any other appliances. In the event an appliance or system is inoperative, Guest shall contact KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS immediately. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall make every effort to have the repairs done quickly and efficiently, or KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall move Guest to a different rental property, if possible. Guest(s) who have an after-hours emergency at the number which will be provided to you. All non-emergency issues should be reported to KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS, at the number which will be provided you, during regular business hours. For any medical related emergency, call 911.

15. AGE REQUIREMENT. Guest is at least eighteen (18) years of age and acknowledges that he/she may be asked to provide proof of age at the time the Reservation is made. Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the Rental Property during the Reservation. If Guest is not eighteen (18) years or older, KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS reserves the right to terminate the Reservation without a refund. 

16. GARBAGE REMOVAL. All garbage must be bagged and removed from inside of the Rental Property. Bagged garbage may be placed in the outside garbage cans and will be picked up daily by an employee of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS.  Guest acknowledges that leaving garbage outside the designated container(s) may attract unwanted animals. 

17. SMOKING/NON-SMOKING. All properties are non-smoking. Smoking outside is allowed unless otherwise stated. Please be neat in disposing of cigarette butts, do not discard them around the property, driveway or yard. In the event smoking occurs inside the cabin, you shall be assessed a minimum charge of $250.00. 

18. CRITTERS & WILDLIFE. Please remember you are in the mountains. Each unit is professionally treated for pest control on a regular basis. Occasionally a few critters could make their way inside. In these rare instances, no refund will be given. In such a case, notify the office and we will make every effort to solve the problem in a timely manner. Please do your part by keeping windows and doors closed and all food and trash inside or in the appropriate outside receptacles.

19. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF RISKS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges that there are certain risks of physical injury, property damage, and inherent potential dangers of the activities conducted within (or upon) the KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges the risks and dangers associated with his/her use of the KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS premises, facilities, and equipment, and that such use has inherent dangers of personal injury and property damage. The undersigned Guest further accepts sole responsibility for risks and dangers which include, without limitation, the potential for serious bodily injury, permanent disability, paralysis and loss of life, disfigurement, loss of or damage to equipment/property, exposure to extreme conditions, harmful physical conflicts with other guests, animal attack, snake bites, insect bites/stings, allergic reactions, lightning strikes, dangers arising from adverse weather conditions, falling, fires and burns, dangerous road or trail conditions, water hazards, land hazards, equipment failure, defective equipment, inadequate safety measures, criminal activity of other guests, poor lighting, and other undefined not readily foreseeable and presently unknown risks and dangers (“Risks”). Guest expressly assumes the Risks of any and all damage and injury of any kind or type which may result from any source whatsoever during his/her time on the premises of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS.

By booking this property, Guest is acknowledging that he/she has read, fully understands, and agrees to all the above.
sectionedDescription/name: Elk Ridge Cabin ~ Direct Spearhead trail access!
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Elk Ridge Cabin is located between Grundy, VA and Southern Gap, where the Coal Canyon trail head is located. Various restaurants, a gas station, and Wal-Mart are located in the Grundy town center within 7 miles of the cabin location.  Elk Ridge is also a short drive from Breaks Interstate Park, Haysi, VA, and Elkhorn City, KY.   The Breaks Interstate Park offers various walking/bike trails, a water park, horseback riding, and zip lining.  River tubing trips are available on the Russell Fork River.  Time-Out Pizza/arcade located in Elkhorn City, KY offers tube rentals and a shuttle service for this activity.  Haysi and Elkhorn City offer 16 miles of whitewater rafting ranging from Class II to Class V rapids.
sectionedDescription/notes: Parking:  The driveway to the cabin is a maintained, gravel road with a turn at the top of the hill.  A 4-wheel drive vehicle is best.  There is plenty of parking on location; however if additional parking is needed for extra large trailers, parking is available just below the property at our residence.
sectionedDescription/space: Elk Ridge offers 4 bedrooms and 1 bath and has all the essentials for your stay. You will enjoy your own space with plenty of room and privacy. WIFI is available and the TV is equipped with ROKU.  The kitchen is fully equipped with a stove, refrigerator, cook ware, eating and cooking utensils, a slow-cooker, and a drip coffee maker.  Bed linens are provided, but please bring your own towels.
sectionedDescription/summary: Elk Ridge Cabin is situated in scenic Southwest Virginia. It is ideal for ATV enthusiasts looking for a nightly or weekly cabin rental.  A 5-minute ATV ride on our private trail gives you access to miles of the Spearhead Trail System (Coal Canyon).  Elk Ridge offers plenty of room for your family or group and is the perfect place to return after an adventure filled day of trail-riding.

primaryHost/about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Rest and relaxation are what you can expect when you stay at this welcoming 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom vacation rental home in Wytheville. The house boasts a large deck where you can soak up the sun, a fully equipped kitchen to cook family meals, a hot tub, patio, firepit, and a cozy fireplace where you can sit and read or share stories. There’s no shortage of recreation in this area - spend all day exploring the New River Trail State Park, Stone Mountain State Park, or the Pilot Mountain State Park.

3/4 Acres | Across from Big Survey Forest | Private Hot Tub

Nature lovers, homebodies, and adventure seekers are welcome at this inviting abode featuring comfortable indoor and outdoor spaces, and a quiet location. 

Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Twin/Full Bunk Bed

INDOOR LIVING: Smart TV, bathtub, gas fireplace, expansive windows, natural lighting
OUTDOOR LIVING: Expansive deck, patio, gas grill, outdoor dining area, fire pit, hammock, private yard 
KITCHEN: Fully equipped, stainless steel appliances, blender, coffee maker, cooking basics, spices
GENERAL: Free WiFi, linens/towels, air conditioning, books, central heating, washer/dryer, laundry detergent, adjustable base bed, smoke detectors, fire hydrant
FAQ: Access only by stairs (single-story home inside, exterior steps only)
PARKING: Driveway (4 vehicles)

Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.

OUTDOOR RECREATION: Crystal Springs Recreation area (3.4 miles), New River Trail State Park (19.4 miles), Hale Lake (21.3 miles), Comers Rock (23.7 miles), Dicky's Knob Trail (29.6 miles), Hungry Mother State Park (30.8 miles), Devils Nature Preserve (37.9 miles), Salt Trail (48.5 miles), Rowland Creek Falls (50.6 miles), Stone Mountain State Park (55.3 miles), Appalachian Trail at Mount Rogers (58.5 miles), Pilot Mountain State Park (69.7 miles)
THINGS TO DO: Fort Chiswell Animal Park (11.8 miles), The Blue Ridge Mountain Center (31.9 miles), Old Cranks Museum (36.6 miles), Jeff Matthews Museum (37.3 miles), High Country Lights (37.5 miles), Andy Griffith Museum (50.5 miles)
EAT + DRINK: 7 Dogs Brew Pub (2.1 miles), Graze on Main (2.3 miles), Chaus Corner Bakery (2.3 miles), Moon Dog Brick Oven (2.3 miles), Seven Sisters Brewery (2.4 miles), Log House 1776 Restaurant (2.5 miles), Peking Chinese Restaurant (3.3 miles), CJ’s Pizza (3.5 miles), Grayson Restaurant (3.9 miles), The Dutch Pantry (13.1 miles), Country Chicken (14.3 miles)
AIRPORT: Charlotte Douglas International Airport (144 miles)

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #10 - The Nicketti Johnston
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #10 - The Nicketti Johnston Room (Shared Bathroom)

Dedicated to the wife of John Warfield Johnston, the Nicketti Johnston room makes you feel like you are part of history. Located just off the upper landing this expansive bedroom features a king bed and fireplace. The room is one of the biggest in the house; decorated in grand style with dark wood tones and elegant bedding. The large cedar closet and 2 full armchairs give guests who prefer longer stays, the space to lounge and live comfortably.

name: Wayne's Outlaw Retreat
sectionedDescription/access: We have plenty of parking on both sides of the house and in the backyard.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our home is located in the ATV friendly town of Mullens, with easy access to the  Pinnacle Creek trail which connects to Indian Ridge and Pocahontas with  plenty of Outlaw trails in between.  We are a family of riders, so we have made our place the perfect retreat for a families and riders alike.

Our place is very open, spacious, comfortable and most importantly clean. We have fast WIFI, a fully equipped kitchen, a stocked laundry room, a charcoal grill with seating outside, a fire ring, two smart TVs, and a jacuzzi tub in the master.

We have plenty of parking on both sides of the house and in the backyard.

Guest can always reach me by email at sebouch23@gmail.com

Quaint, quiet neighborhood.

We have plenty of parking at the home, ATV friendly town can ride to trails, gas, restaurants, groceries, and more.

sectionedDescription/description:
No matter what brings you to town, this homey vacation rental in Beckley is the perfect place to call home. This 1-bathroom studio gives you easy access to WVU’s campus so you can visit the kids or tour the campus before school starts. When you’re not in downtown Beckley, take advantage of the natural beauty of West Virginia at New River Gorge National Park. And of course, your day wouldn’t be complete without a soak in the private hot tub or a movie snuggled up in front of the fire.

In-Unit Laundry | Fireplace  

Whether you’re visiting loved ones at WVU, working at a nearby hospital, or leaf-peeping at Backcock State Park, this cozy studio in Beckley is the perfect home base. 

Studio: Queen Bed, Twin Bed | Additional Sleeping: Pack ‘n Play 

INDOOR LIVING: Smart TVs w/ cable, board games, wood-burning fireplace, living area 
OUTDOOR LIVING: Covered patio, private hot tub, rocking chairs 
KITCHEN: Well-equipped w/ cooking basics, dishware & flatware, microwave, high chair, dining area 
GENERAL: Free WiFi, keyless entry, complimentary toiletries, linens & towels, in-unit washer & dryer, central heating & air conditioning, laundry detergent, hair dryer, trash bags & paper towels, iron & ironing board
FAQ: Homeowner on-site, stairs required for access, 2 exterior security cameras   
PARKING: Driveway (2 vehicles)

Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.

OPT OUTSIDE: Word Park (3.0 miles), New River Gorge National Park and Preserve (10.4 miles), Little Beaver State Park (16.9 miles), Main Overlook (20.6 miles), Babcock State Park (39.3 miles), Bluestone National Scenic River (41.4 miles) 
HIKES: Ship Rock (7.5 miles), Little Laurel Trailhead (13.6 miles), Upper Glade Creek Trailhead (17.4 miles), Polls Plateau Trailhead (21.5 miles), Big Branch Trail (40.2 miles)

AIRPORTS: Raleigh County Memorial Airport (10 miles), Yeager Airport (59.3 miles)

Camera 1 is located on the deck facing out, and camera 2 is located on the the front of the home facing the steps. These cameras actively record video and audio when motion is detected and will be turned on during your stay
sectionedDescription/interaction: Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.
sectionedDescription/name: Beckley Studio w/ Hot Tub, 4 Mi to WVU Tech!
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie:
OPT OUTSIDE: Word Park (3.0 miles), New River Gorge National Park and Preserve (10.4 miles), Little Beaver State Park (16.9 miles), Main Overlook (20.6 miles), Babcock State Park (39.3 miles), Bluestone National Scenic River (41.4 miles) 
HIKES: Ship Rock (7.5 miles), Little Laurel Trailhead (13.6 miles), Upper Glade Creek Trailhead (17.4 miles), Polls Plateau Trailhead (21.5 miles), Big Branch Trail (40.2 miles) 
THINGS TO SEE & DO: Downtown Beckley (3.2 miles), Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine (3.2 miles), Youth Museum of Southern WV (3.2 miles), Wildwood House Museum (4.5 miles), Alfred Beckley Mill (6.7 miles) 
AIRPORTS: Raleigh County Memorial Airport (10 miles), Yeager Airport (59.3 miles)
sectionedDescription/space:
In-Unit Laundry | Fireplace  

Whether you’re visiting loved ones at WVU, working at a nearby hospital, or leaf-peeping at Backcock State Park, this cozy studio in Beckley is the perfect home base. 

Studio: Queen Bed, Twin Bed | Additional Sleeping: Pack ‘n Play 

INDOOR LIVING: Smart TVs w/ cable, board games, wood-burning fireplace, living area 
OUTDOOR LIVING: Covered patio, private hot tub, rocking chairs 
KITCHEN: Well-equipped w/ cooking basics, dishware & flatware, microwave, high chair, dining area 
GENERAL: Free WiFi, keyless entry, complimentary toiletries, linens & towels, in-unit washer & dryer, central heating & air conditioning, laundry detergent, hair dryer, trash bags & paper towels, iron & ironing board
FAQ: Homeowner on-site, stairs required for access, 2 exterior security cameras   
PARKING: Driveway (2 vehicles)
sectionedDescription/summary: No matter what brings you to town, this homey vacation rental in Beckley is the perfect place to call home. This 1-bathroom studio gives you easy access to WVU’s campus so you can visit the kids or tour the campus before school starts. When you’re not in downtown Beckley, take advantage of the natural beauty of West Virginia at New River Gorge National Park. And of course, your day wouldn’t be complete without a soak in the private hot tub or a movie snuggled up in front of the fire.

primaryHost/about: I spend as much time as I can outdoors, have hiked most of the trails in the area and am always on the lookout for a great kayak launch spot. When indoors I enjoy playing guitar/songwriting and released my debut album "Tale of Love and Loss" in 2020.

sectionedDescription/access:
Access is via keyless lock with a code that will work on both the front and back doors. You will receive this code the day before check in.
The upstairs and basement are dedicated to host storage, but you'll have the place to yourselves.  The house sits about 25 yards up a gravel road which is suitable for all vehicles and there is plenty of parking space behind the house.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy a quiet country setting just 10 minutes from downtown Abingdon and the Virginia Creeper Trail, 20 minutes to the Appalachian Trail, 30 minutes to downtown Bristol.  Enjoy pastoral views while you relax on the back deck, which runs the length of the house.  The unit includes the entire main floor of the home with bedroom, bath, living room, full kitchen and laundry room.  If you love the outdoors this is a great base for exploring this beautiful corner of the world.

The house location offers the best of a country setting with easy access to town, shopping, theater and restaurants.  If you want to do some cooking, you'll find a fully outfitted kitchen or consult our dining guide for a selection of local restaurants.

Access is via keyless lock with a code that will work on both the front and back doors. You will receive this code the day before check in.
The upstairs and basement are dedicated to host storage, but you'll have the place to yourselves.  The house sits about 25 yards up a gravel road which is suitable for all vehicles and there is plenty of parking space behind the house.

I am not at the home but am reachable and nearby in case of any issues.

The house is located a very short distance up a gravel road.  Visitors may park where they wish behind the house or under the on-site carport.

This is the same home that can be reserved under listing 53669707.  The listing you are on sleeps up to four (1 bedroom, 1 sofa bed, 1 full bath) while the other listing sleeps up to eight (2 bedrooms, 2 sofa beds, 2 full baths).  Either way, the property is only rented to one set of guests at a time.

primaryHost/about: I’m a lifelong learner, artist/photographer/network marketer and energetic Gramie to 11 exceptional grandlittles. Retired from teaching high school art & biology, I now divide my time between travel, affiliate marketing, teaching private lessons (both in person and online) and hosting short term guests in my studio.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access:
You’ll have access to the whole space, with the exception of the following:
 - two locked closet areas.
 - photography props and art materials stored along the tops of all built in structures.

Check in 3pm. Keypad access code will be sent the week of your stay, prior to arrival. 

Check out 10 am.
sectionedDescription/description:
Peggie’s Studio Retreat is nestled in a secluded hollow just minutes from the Bearwallow Trailhead of the Hatfields & McCoys’ Trail System. 

The space is a large art/photography studio that has been transformed into an inviting living space. You’ll love the peace and quiet after a day on the trails. 

Buy your official Hatfield - McCoyTrail Permit on site. Trail maps provided with permit purchase. 

(Let Peggie know you want to purchase Trail Passes when you book the studio.)

Get away from everything when you stay at Peggie’s Studio Retreat. The studio is away from dusty, noisy, congested campgrounds and outside city limits.

A clean stream runs beside the studio; nestled between mountains on all sides. Be disturbed by nothing but the sights and sounds of nature. 

 You’ll experience the peace and tranquility of rural Southern West Virginia, while still being minutes away from the main attractions you are here to enjoy.

Not a Trail Rider, just looking for a peaceful getaway? We’ve got you covered.

You’ll have access to the whole space, with the exception of the following:
 - two locked closet areas.
 - photography props and art materials stored along the tops of all built in structures.

Check in 3pm. Keypad access code will be sent the week of your stay, prior to arrival. 

Check out 10 am.

Need to contact Peggie? Use the airBnB app for fastest response.

Welcome to “Head of the Holler” living, where peaceful coexistence between nature and neighbors is paramount. We live by the Live and Let Live Principle… aka The Golden Rule. You might not see another person during your stay, but deer and other wildlife are plentiful.

Park on a gravel parking lot, large enough for your truck and trailer. Leave the trailer behind and ride your UTV to the trails.

name: McCoy Lodge @ Busted ATV Resort
primaryHost/about: Adventure seeking and nature lover!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported smoke or carbon monoxide detectors on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.
sectionedDescription/description:
#1 Hatfield McCoy Trails Lodging

       The Busted ATV Resort in beautiful Bramwell, West Virginia, is the place to stay! Less than a mile ride from Hatfield McCoy trail head leading into over three hundred miles of trails. We are about 5 miles from Virginia Spearhead trails. Pinnacle Rock State park look out deck is just one mile from out front door.

Welcome to the McCoy Lodge.  The fully furnished lodge gives you space and privacy. Located at the top of Busted ATV Resort drive makes you king of the hill. Surrounded by the woods and located just six hundred feet from the peak of Mt. Me. There is a coin operated ATV pressure wash and washer and dryer.


This season has been filled with some awesome good times with new and old friends attending. For those of you that Ride Dirty, Sleep Clean  - thank you!  With your continued support My great friend Rob and I will continue to build Busted A in way that's perfect for all our needs. God bless!
Pat

How to find us?
 We are Located in Bramwell on Hwy 52 just one mile north of Pinnacle Rock state park . Don't always trust your GPS using addresses in WV. Tell your maps app. to take 
  you to Busted ATV Resort.



If you see any problems within the home upon entry we must be notified with in two hours of your arrival.

You are NOT responsible for washing linens or making the beds.

Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.

Call or text anytime. 
386-2991121
386-5278881

About a half mile from the Pocahontas trail head located in beautiful Bramwell . From here you have access to over four hundred miles of Hatfield McCoy trails that include Pocahontas, Indian ridge, Pinnacle and Warrior trail systems. Want more? Just a short six mile ride will get you into the Virginia spearhead trails. Need even more trails? Hitch up the trailer and take a day trip further into coal county to find even more Hatfield McCoy trail systems.


Here at Busted ATV Resort, one of the ways we offer you large beautifully remolded homes for a great price in-season months (April - October) is by winterizing our homes during the cold months. This greatly reduces our cost and yours. If your planing a winter trip and would like to stay at Busted ATV Resort contact us first. We make several trips throughout the winter season and can discount your 3 night minim stay if it aligns with our schedule. 

The Busted ATV Resort, in beautiful Bramwell, West Virginia, is the place to stay! The remodeled historic 1880 Bramwell House and adjacent accommodations. , at the base of Mt. Me, offer spacious accommodations with plenty of easy access parking. About a half mile  ride from Hatfield McCoy trail head and 5 miles from Virginia Spearhead trails. Pinnacle Rock State park look out deck is just one mile from out front door.
