name: The Whitetail at Pipestem Place
primaryHost/about:
A "should have been" West Virginian...my parents were both born and raised in the Hills of WV and with grandparents, aunts, uncles and cousins mostly residing there for all of their lives, I spent most of my summers and any vacation time visiting and growing to love my “once removed” roots. Though I grew up in South Florida, I loved my summers there away from the Florida heat. I hiked in the woods, swam in cold streams, explored waterfalls and fell in love. Being adventurous, I rapelled in the New River Gorge, skiied for the first time at Snowshoe and learned a love of rafting that continues today as I pursue trips on many Western Rivers in New Mexico, Colorado, Utah and Arizona.Life took me out west to Santa Fe, New Mexico where I pursued an art career and eventually a Real Estate career. I feel blessed to have helped my mother find her dream cabins, and to now again get to spend family time in this wonderful place. Many friends and family are still nearby and it is like coming “home” to stay at the cabins on Anam Cara Way.

We hope you will find joy, and peace, and feel that our home is your home when you stay at our sweet cabins.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Whitetail is a conventional-style log cabin, cozy and appealing, with two bedrooms, two baths, living room, dining and kitchen; stone wood-burning fireplace, central A/C-heat. The Whitetail is reminiscent of the simple, tranquil country life as you swing or rock on the front porch, listen and watch for beautiful songbirds, deer and other wildlife that often wander across the meadow.   'Tis the peaceful life at Pipestem Place on Anam Cara Way!

The village of Pipestem and **Pipestem Resort State Park, one of WV's most outstanding parks, sit high on a plateau with deep canyons, converging rivers and streams, high rolling hills ~ a unique, diverse vacation land, a mecca for exploration, photography and recreation! Our two vacation log cabins, The Robin and The Whitetail are located in a natural, serene setting on Anam Cara Way in Pipestem, WV, only one-half mile from Pipestem Resort State Park.

We are available by phone, text or email at any time. Though we don't live nearby, we have a property manager available on short notice for any emergency.

Nearby Adventures :
Pipestem State Park has both an 18 hole and a 9 hole par 3 course, heated indoor and Olympic-size outdoor swimming pools, over 20 hiking trails, horseback riding, kyaking/boating/fishing, archery, camping, aerial tram, zip-line ((upcoming 2019), and many other recreational, educational and entertainment events and activities throughout the year.

White water rafting
There are several commercial wild water rafting companies, offering various levels of rafting. Most of our West Virginia whitewater rafting trips are a full-day adventure of approximately 6-8 hours - and include a specially-prepared riverside lunch and river equipment. No experience is necessary for any New River whitewater rafting trip. professional guides are in each raft.

Hiking
Hiking is great in the area, many trails to scenic waterfalls are nearby including Brush Creek Falls, Sandstone Falls and Pipestem State Park.

Winterplace in Beckley, WV has snow skiing in Winter and is also less than an hour away.
Bluestone Lake Recreational Area is about 9 miles down Hwy 20, and has swimming and boat rentals available in warmer seasons.

sectionedDescription/summary: The Whitetail is a conventional-style log cabin, cozy and appealing, with two bedrooms, two baths, living room, dining and kitchen; stone wood-burning fireplace, central A/C-heat. The Whitetail is reminiscent of the simple, tranquil country life as you swing or rock on the front porch, listen and watch for beautiful songbirds, deer and other wildlife that often wander across the meadow.   'Tis the peaceful life at Pipestem Place on Anam Cara Way!

additionalHouseRules:
PLEASE HONOR 10AM CHECK-OUT
The cleaning attendant will arrive based on scheduled check-out time.

No smoking inside the cabin.  Cigarette butts must be disposed of in the bucket provided on the front porch.

Please be attentive to your pets and dispose of any waste from them in the immediate, non-wooded area of the yard to avoid forfeit of the deposit.

Please do not allow pets on the furniture to avoid a forfeit of the deposit.

Please do not leave pet unattended while you are away from the cabin.

Please clean up excess dog hair or accident they may have in the house to avoid forfeit of the deposit.

Please DO NOT park on the grass to avoid forfeit of deposit.

No parties or events; Guests should leave premises in neat and undamaged condition.

Please RETURN ANY MOVED INDOOR OR OUTDOOR FURNITURE to its original location to avoid forfeit of deposit.
 
Please strip the beds before your departure.

No unregistered guests allowed, please adhere to property’s stated capacity.
 
Please respect the local noise ordinance of quiet time after 10p.m.

Please do not use grill up next to or on the front porch of the cabins.

Please wash and put away dishes before checkout.

Please remove all food from the refrigerator and cabinets before checkout.

Please dispose of all trash and place in the outdoor bins beside garage. 

Please report any damages and/or breakages in a reasonably timely manner.

rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Cottage on Little Creek is a romantic creekside retreat nestled on a quiet country road. This 53-acre property borders the Jefferson National Forest with private trails in a park like setting with small waterfalls throughout the property. An unparalleled place to relax from the daily grind but only a short, 15-minute drive to Wytheville, VA.

We are pet friendly with lots of room for you four-legged love ones to explore.
We charge a pet fee of $25 for the first pet per stay and $10 for each additional pet per stay. 
The pet fee is collected separately through AirBNB after the cabin is booked.

***Please read below***
Water:  We are in a beautiful, rural location with well water; it has a sulphur smell to it.  Although, completely safe to drink and bathe in it has a strong smell many people are not accustomed to this so I like to let guests know upfront.  I leave a gallon of water in the cabin along with the breakfast basket but I always suggest guests bring plenty of water to cook with.

Wi-Fi: As mentioned above, this is a rural location which is great to decompress and find peace and quiet but high speed internet isn’t available in this area. We provide satellite internet, so guests can use Wi-Fi texting and calling (dependent on your cell provider- cell phone service is very limited), check emails and surf the web but streaming Netflix and downloading music unfortunately don’t work.  We have the highest amount of gigabytes available with HughesNet Satellite but once the data caps are reached(which is easy to do if streaming is tried and continues to buffer) the internet eventually stops.  We ask you to please be conscientious with the internet usage so all our guests are able to use it throughout their stay with us.

This place is so special and we want our guests to love it as much as we do so if there is anything we can do throughout your stay we are happy to help.

We are in a rural location; cell phone service is limited but we do have Hughesnet Satellite wi-fi, it doesn't stream video but allows for surfing the web, answering emails, wi-fi texting and calling(depending on you cell phone carrier plan).

As like many people in rural America we are on a well water system so the water has Sulphur, which is completely safe to drink and bath in but does have a Sulphur smell and is an acquired taste.  We supply a gallon of water but suggest our guests bring extra water for drinking due to the taste.

name: Remote Mountain Cabin in the Woods
primaryHost/about:
My name is Pan. This Air B&B was formerly run by my husband James (Jim). Unfortunately, he passed away and we all miss him very much!
Now, I will continue to operate the Air B&B.  We will continue to welcome visitors to come and stay with us.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: River access for fishing, kayaking, hiking and biking along the New River Trail and State Park
sectionedDescription/description:
Quiet private location in the woods with private path to the river

Like a time machine to the 1930's. 
All wood house and furniture. 
Old style plumbing. New electric. 
Gas stove for cooking 
Wood stove for heat (Electric and gas backup )
The cabin was built in 1920. Almost a century old. It was renovated in 1995 after Purchased by current owner. 
Please : No smoking inside the cabin. 
The driveway is very passable but some with low vehicle clearance have expressed I should give a heads up. If you’re not sure, you can walk down the driveway first. 
The river trail is over 50 miles long and no motorized traffic is allowed
 Very private. Located  on 75 acres of private property adjoining the New River Trail
Dogs allowed

River access for fishing, kayaking, hiking and biking along the New River Trail and State Park

No interaction with guests unless desired. Can give tour of the area as needed.

No neighbors to bother you. 
Every Thursday night there is a free bluegrass performance at the local recreation center in Fries. Local talent. 
7 to 9 pm

Bring your car, bike, horse or kayak. Or just walk here

Water source is from a spring and has delicious water. Please be conservative with water use although it fills automatically and has a 600 gallon reservoir. Babbling brook runs beside the yard all year. Clean clear water.
10 minute wooded Path to river alongside creek
Lots of flora and fauna so if you don't like bugs this may not be the place for you. Owner is a gardener who grows flowers and other unusual tree and bush specimens.
The cabin is 3 miles north of Fries and about 7 miles from Galax. 
570 Swinney Hollow Road , Fries, Va
The zip code is 24330 and not 24333 as shown in the listing. For some or another reason I can’t change it 
WiFi is good. It cellular service may not work unless you have US Cellular. 
Since some GPS signals may not be receptive here please print route before you leave home. 
I’m available if necessary for any further directions or inquiries

name: Hatfield @ Busted ATV Resort
primaryHost/about: Adventure seeking and nature lover!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
For those of you that Ride Dirty , Sleep Clean  - thank you!  Your Busted experience on Mt Me. is created by You for You. It has been with your help that the oldest house in Bramwell is rejuvenated to it's original 1880 beauty. With your continued support My great friend Rob and I will continue to build Busted A in way that's perfect for all our needs. God bless!
Pat

The Hatfield offers you the comforts of home. Three bedrooms , two baths a kitchen and living space that is ready for your group.  Remember to ride dirty but sleep clean in the Hatfield@ Busted ATV Resort We're just a mile from the Bramwell trail head that enters Hatfield McCoy's - Pocahontas , Indian Ridge , Pinnacle Creek and Warrior trails. Want more trails? Virginia Spearhead Trail system is just a five mile ride away.   If the historic Main Lodge and McCoy lodge are already booked than the Hatfield offers you the next best choice in the Hatfield McCoy territory. Hatfield now offers you a Turbo Master 4000 boot drier.
Months that have cooler below freezing temperatures we do shut down the ATV pressure washer, guest laundry and outdoor showers.

For driving directions just enter (Busted ATV Resort) into your favorite mapping app.

Riding dirty on your ATV of course

Winter Rates and special accommodations opening up for next winter 2019 . 

Here at Busted ATV Resort, one of the ways we offer you large beautifully remolded homes for a great price in-season months (April - October) is by winterizing our homes during the cold months. This greatly reduces our cost and yours. If your planing a winter trip and would like to stay at Busted ATV Resort contact us first. We require a 30 day notice on Bookings from mid November to Mid March. Don't forget to follow us on Facebook for the latest info on Busted.

name: Sunrise at Pinnacle Ridge
photos/3/caption:
Bedroom 1 
Spacious with queen bed and private balcony
photos/15/caption: Day bed is located in common area outside the three bedrooms and in passageway to other parts of the house.  Other guests will be in this area.
photos/38/caption: There is a day bed in the common area on the landing outside the three private bedrooms.
primaryHost/about: My husband is a retired German Language professor and I am still loving my work as a school psychologist.   We travel, read, and grow wonderful flowers in our little piece of the world.    When not on Tallery Mountain, we keep returning to Saint Malo, France.  We love the food, the sea and the history there almost as much as the food, the mountains and the history here.   We are West Virginians, born and raised.  Company is always welcome.
sectionedDescription/access: The entire cabin, yard and the surrounding woods are accessible.  Since we are located right between Bluestone and Pipestem state parks, wildlife abounds  !
sectionedDescription/description:
If you're looking for that out of the way place to just relax, it's here.  In twenty minutes you can be fishing Bluestone Lake or the Greenbrier River, taking in lunch or the neat shops in Hinton, or just enjoying Pipestem or Bluestone State Parks. Three bedrooms and two baths, the perfect getaway.  Watch the sun come up over the mountains or the meteor showers while stargazing.

At the end of the road in the woods, it has a big yard with fire pit. Yet, it’s only fifteen minutes to good restaurants and attractions 
It’s the perfect place to get away and still be close to so many good restaurants, outdoor activities and beautiful surroundings. If interested in stargazing, golfing, water sports, zip lining or fishing...you’re there! Also, let’s not forget that it is right in the middle of some of the best motorcycle roads anywhere.  Three bedrooms that sleep six with a day bed and couch for the extras, it’s spacious and furnished with everything you need except your food and clothing.  It has 2 baths.  Set in the woods on Pinnacle Ridge in True, WV (on the mountain above Bluestone Lake and Hinton, it’s right between Bluestone and Pipestem state parks in Summers County.  It sleeps 8 for $125 per night with a two night minimum stay.  Come join us on the mountain ...its worth it!
PS: Bring marshmallows for the campfire

The entire cabin, yard and the surrounding woods are accessible.  Since we are located right between Bluestone and Pipestem state parks, wildlife abounds  !

I'll be available to help in any way I can.

The business Wi-Fi available average is about 75 Mbps download and 10 upload.

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #6 - The Doctor Johnston Sui
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #6 - The Doctor Johnston Suite

Dr. George Ben Johnston was the son of the original owner and builder of the home, John Johnston. Dr. Johnston was highly respected in the medical community for his surgical expertise and this room is named in his honor. The tucked away upstairs bedroom features two double beds and a private bathroom. Located across the hall from The Mary May Room, this suite is ideal for multiple guests. Full of light, bright and cheery, this room gives guests a pop of color with vintage red bed frames and a soft aqua rug. Also, the room has easy access to the rear staircase leading to the kitchen and most importantly the coffee maker.

name: Pinecone Yurt at Kairos Resort
sectionedDescription/access: Guests will have the entire yurt to themselves. They will also have access to the entire 1,500+ acre property. 1 trail pass is included in yurt rental if guests bring their own equipment. Additional trail passes are available for $15 (reduced rate) each. In season (April-October) we also have UTV rentals available (1 included, additional reduced).
sectionedDescription/description:
The Yurt is luxuriously rustically decorated. The yurt sits in the midst of the 1500 acre Kairos Wilderness Resort. There are approximately 40 miles of trails that you can either hike, ride bikes, horse back ride or use ATV's or side-by-sides to experience the beauty of nature. The yurt can comfortably sleep six. It is an easy ride to the campus of Virginia Tech. The Kairos property sits adjacent to the beautiful New River, where we can make arrangements for you to experience the river.

Enjoy the beauty and wilderness in one of our two luxury yurts. Each yurt is pet-friendly (for a nominal fee).

Guests will have the entire yurt to themselves. They will also have access to the entire 1,500+ acre property. 1 trail pass is included in yurt rental if guests bring their own equipment. Additional trail passes are available for $15 (reduced rate) each. In season (April-October) we also have UTV rentals available (1 included, additional reduced).

Kairos is located in two beautiful counties of Virginia and West Virginia. Come for the outdoor recreation, friendly towns, and unforgettable experiences. We are “Virginia’s Mountain Playground™”. Giles County is home to 37 miles of the New River and New River Water Trail™, over 50 miles of the Appalachian Trail and the Great Eastern Trail. Mercer County, WV, is nestled deep in the heart of scenic Appalachia. From our rich coal history to our challenging off-road trails, we have a unique heritage to share. ATV expeditions, baseball rivalries and outdoor adventures— jump in and explore West Virginia’s playground.

There is no nearby public transportation. We are located 4 miles off of Route 460.

The yurt fee includes 1 motorized trail access fee at Kairos Wilderness Resort.

sectionedDescription/description:
Hi.  We offer COZY rooms with a BEAUTIFUL view of GREAT Smoky mountains surrounding our property.  KIND and FRIENDLY hosts ready to WELCOME all your needs.

THANK YOU

We are providing a room with two beds or one bed as guests need, in a hotel setting, close to the interstate, providing an easy stopover for our guests traveling along the I-81 and I-77 corridors.  A mexican restaurant, a local barbeque place, and an American diner are nearby for dining options.  A vineyard, an animal park, and New River Trails nearby and a short drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway and Big Walker Lookout for nature lovers.

Guests will need their car.

our pet fee is $15 per night
Smoking rooms available for $20 more (based on availability).
Smoking in a non smoking room will incur a $150 incidental fee.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #3 - The Jack May Room
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #3 - The Jack May Room (Shared Bathroom)

Named after the most prominent owner of the Litz Mansion, Andrew Jackson (“Jack”) May. This room is located downstairs and across the hall from The Etta V. Room. The bedroom includes a king-sized bed and fireplace. Just outside the room door is everyone’s favorite, the front porch. Grab a rocking chair and your favorite drink and enjoy the sounds of nature. Also, being downstairs, you have easy access to the living room, game room, dining room and kitchen.

Loving 2 story home built in 1910! Sitting above the street has steps to access the home but it allows for a great view overlooking Hinton and the New River.Perfect for adventure seekers, fisherman, hunters or just relaxing.Minutes from kayaking, rafting, and hiking! Newly remodeled, washer and dryer, WIFI, and has two fireplaces.We love our home in this old town.WinterPlace ski resort 19 miles.5 miles distance from Bluestone damn, New River, and Pipestem State Park.9 miles Sandstone waterfalls.

sectionedDescription/access: Guests have full access to the entire Townhouse property during their stay.  There is a backyard that is shared along with a courtyard in the neighboring property.  There is an outdoor grill shared among all the properties.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Townhouse, managed by the Guest House Inn on Courthouse Square, is located in the newest National Park, the New River Gorge National Park in the beautiful Hinton Historic District.  
This charming property offers 2 bedrooms, one and a half bath, and a spacious downstairs for the whole family.

The Townhouse is one of many properties operated by the Guest House Inn on Courthouse Square and has all the amenities of home.  We can easily accommodate families and business travelers alike.  All of our properties are within walking distance of shopping, museums, and dining.  
The Townouse is a warm and cozy 2 bedroom property.  Both bedrooms and the full bath are located upstairs.  A half bath is located downstairs.  The fully stocked kitchen and dining room are ample space to stretch out during your stay and enjoy time with family.  
Our cleaning staff follows all covid protocols and takes extra steps to ensure the safety of all our guests.

Guests have full access to the entire Townhouse property during their stay.  There is a backyard that is shared along with a courtyard in the neighboring property.  There is an outdoor grill shared among all the properties.

During Covid, we are offering a contactless entry to all properties. 
 The hospitality specialist will text the lockbox code to guests on the day of their arrival.  We can be available when needed for our guests and are always a phone call away.  Should you call after business hours, you will most likely be greeted by our answering service.  If you have a need, simply let them know and they can direct it to the appropriate person on call.

The Guest House Inn is conveniently located in the heart of the downtown Hinton historic district in Summers County WV.  A one time bustling railroad community is now a charming downtown with brick lined streets, eclectic shops, and old architecture all nestled along the banks of the New and Greenbrier rivers.  
The confluence of the Bluestone, New, and Greenbrier rivers form the southern West Virginia gateway of the mighty New River in  Summers County.  Outdoor recreational adventure abounds in and around Hinton.  Summers County is one of only a few counties in West Virginia that offers kayakers, floaters, and fisherman 16 public access sites along the banks of the Greenbrier and the New.  
With the combination of natural beauty and historic charm, Hinton is the hidden jewel of Summers County.

Hinton is 11 miles from Interstate 64 and approximately 45 minutes away from two airports in neighboring counties.  The traffic pattern in town is made up of one way and two way city blocks which is very easy to navigate.  
Amtrak has a designated stop at the Hinton Train Depot that is 4 blocks away from the Guest House Inn on Courthouse Square.  Amtrak does not provide ticketing or baggage services at this station, which is served by the tri-weekly Cardinal (Westbound: Sunday, Wednesday, Friday; Eastbound: Wednesday, Friday, Sunday).

The bedrooms are located up a flight of 18 steps.

Smoking inside the Inn, common areas or your room, will result in a $250 charge for cleaning.
A no-show will be charged for the entire reserved stay.  Well-behaved, small pets are allowed in the Townhouse property only for an additional fee.

 The hospitality specialist will text the lockbox code to guests on the day of their arrival.  We can be available when needed for our guests and are always a phone call away.  Should you call after business hours, you will most likely be greeted by our answering service.  If you have a need, simply let them know and they can direct it to the appropriate person on call.

name: Winterplace Condo E201
primaryHost/about: My husband and I grew up here in WV and love the area.  There is so much to do outdoors, and the scenery is wonderful. Our family loves spending time by the water (lakes and rivers) in the summer and playing in the snow in the winter.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Slow down and enjoy mountain views and breezes from your private deck. Try this condo in our off season (spring and fall) and enjoy a quiet place when your not out exploring WV. In winter, ski in and out from this condo onto the slopes of Winterplace Ski Resort. This condo is located on the second floor and the deck overlooks the 'Last Chance' and 'Last Run' trails. It is also close to Beckley and Princeton, Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve and southern WV whitewater country. During the ski season, we offer discounted equipment rentals from Ski Celebrations for all of our guests.
The condo sleeps up to 10, great for a large family or a couple of small families with separate bathrooms or for those that just want some space and privacy that you can't get in a hotel. Extra-large deck to enjoy the views from.
~ DETAILS ~
~ Sleeps: up to 10  (for stays under 10 days) 
~ Master Bedroom: 1 Queen Size Bed with attached bath 
~ Bedroom 2: 1 Queen Size Bed
~ Bunkroom: 2 Twin Size Beds (Bunk)
~ Living Room: 1 Double Size Futon and a couch with recliners on opposite ends
~ Cable TV in Living Room and all three bed rooms
~ Fully Equipped Kitchen
~ Ski Rack
~ Small Dryer in the condo
~ Pets welcome with paid pet fee  (for stays under 10 days)  Contact us for more details. 
~ Good views of Winterplace Ski Resort
The kitchen is totally equipped with all the essentials, including crock pot, coffee maker, pots and pans, a built-in microwave, dishwasher and everything that you need for your vacation.
The living room consist of an electric fireplace and a view out the sliding glass doors onto the slopes. The master bedroom has a queen bed with a bath and views onto the mountains.
Everything you need to create great family memories!
The condo has electric baseboard heaters in each room, so you can adjust the heat to the temperature that you prefer when it's cold outside. When it's hot, there is an AC unit installed in the living room above the sliding glass door. This is for AC only. We are not allowed to do duct work in the 2nd or 3rd floor condos, so this is the only practical way to get AC in the unit, leaving room doors open as often as possible helps to keep the whole condo cool.
Please be aware there will be a $200 security deposit that will be pre-authorized on your credit card the day before you arrive and is released 7 days after you depart unless there is damage. This is a standard practice for vacation home rentals as there is no staff at the facility and this allows you to check in with an electronic door code and check out by just texting us and leaving the morning of your last day.
Also, the road to the condos is a gravel, hilly, road that Winterplace Ski Resort is paid to take care of it. Sometimes through the year, we will have heavy rains that create ruts in the road and Winterplace Ski Resort, being closed, is slow in making the repairs. Low clearance vehicles will need to be very careful coming up the hill from Winterplace Ski Resort's main parking area. In the winter, they grade the road and keep it plowed and put cinders on the road but please be prepared and understand you may need a four wheel drive, all wheel drive or chains to help get up the hill.
We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to www.InsureMyTrip.com for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsuraneMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.

~Long Term Stays ~
For those looking to stay for more than a week, the following changes apply:
- We only allow 3 people to stay per condo
- No pets allowed
- We do not provide daily maid service but will provide clean linens weekly. 
Please contact us for further information.
WINTERPLACE SKI-IN SKI-OUT CONDOS
Enjoy skiing or snowboarding right outside your door while staying on the slopes at Winterplace Resort. Easy access to all the runs. Our condos are located on the top (3rd) floor with great views. Winterplace also offers snow-tubing runs and a snowboard terrain park. Winterplace Resort is conveniently located only 5 minutes from I-77 at the Ghent exit.
NEAR BECKLEY AND WHITEWATER COUNTRY
During the spring, summer and fall don’t think there is nothing to do. We are close to all the fun that southern West Virginia has to offer. Whitewater rafting, kayaking, river tubing, rock climbing, hiking, horseback riding etc. All different kinds of outdoor fun are waiting for you to take advantage of. There are several state and national parks near by, like Little Beaver State Park and Grandview National Park. We are also near Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve. The temperature in the mountains of West Virginia remains cooler than a lot of the surrounding states, so this is great place to come cool off. Enjoy something different from the beach, take your family out into nature.
And for anytime of the year fun, Beckley has something for everyone. Of course, there are all your favorite fast food and sit down restaurants, as well as some home-grown restaurants that might become your new favorites. There is a wide variety of different shops. The Tamarackhas everything you might want to see from our unique West Virginia craftsman. There are a lot of different antique shops and Crossroads Mall for those that might want something a little familiar. There is the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, where you can tour an actual coal mine and let the kids explore the coal mining town and the Youth Museum. During good weather, there are also trails, playground, basketball and tennis courts and a pool with a waterslide. There is also, Mountain State Miniature Golfwhich doesn’t have just mini-golf but offers a small coffee shop and an indoor climbing wall. Beckley is a great place to spend a few days exploring all it has to offer and it’s only a quick drive up Interstate 77.

sectionedDescription/access: The entire island is there for you to explore!
sectionedDescription/description:
A private island or a sandy beach? The cabin on Coney Island, a Guest House property, offers you both!!

The Cabin on Coney Island is one of the properties of The Guest House Inn on Courthouse Square. The cabin offers all amenities on the seclusion of an island.  When you really want to get away from it all, visit the cabin on Coney Island. The island is located at the confluence of the New and Greenbrier Rivers and accessible by watercraft only.

The entire island is there for you to explore!

We are available to help throughout the stay but will not be in person on the island.

A one time bustling railroad community is now a charming downtown with brick lined streets, eclectic shops, and old architecture all nestled along the banks of the New and Greenbrier rivers.  
The confluence of the Bluestone, New, and Greenbrier rivers form the southern West Virginia gateway of the mighty New River in  Summers County.  Outdoor recreational adventure abounds in and around Hinton.  Summers County is one of only a few counties in West Virginia that offers kayakers, floaters, and fisherman 16 public access sites along the banks of the Greenbrier and the New.  
With the combination of natural beauty and historic charm, Hinton is the hidden jewel of Summers County.

This is a true island!  The Cabin on Coney Island is located at the confluence of the Greenbrier and New Rivers. A watercraft is the only way to access the island. Don't have a boat? A local outfitter company, Cantrell's Ultimate Rafting can provide a quick trip to Coney Island.
There are logistics involved with getting to and from the island.  The logistics will differ depending upon if you have your own kayaks or if you are using Cantrell's.  
If you are interested in staying at the island and leaving daily, it can be challenging.  Cantrell's charges a fee each way for shuttle service and may not be available at the times needed.  If customers want to explore the area and do not have their own watercraft and shuttles necessary, we encourage you to consider our other properties in the Hinton Historic District.

The island is a true island at the confluence of the New River and Greenbrier River.  We only have a well-system for water at the cabin.  While the water is safe to drink and shower in, it does have a sulfur smell.  We do provide drinking water for guests.  
A stay on the island is a rustic adventure.  
We clean, sanitize, landscape, clean the beach, weed-eat the path, knock down cobwebs, cut firewood, etc between every guest.  There are things outside of our control such as mosquitos and occasional debris that comes from raising and lowering water levels.  
We do our best to make sure you have an amazing stay !!

sectionedDescription/space: The Cabin on Coney Island is one of the properties of The Guest House Inn on Courthouse Square. The cabin offers all amenities on the seclusion of an island.  When you really want to get away from it all, visit the cabin on Coney Island. The island is located at the confluence of the New and Greenbrier Rivers and accessible by watercraft only.
sectionedDescription/summary: A private island or a sandy beach? The cabin on Coney Island, a Guest House property, offers you both!!
sectionedDescription/transit:
This is a true island!  The Cabin on Coney Island is located at the confluence of the Greenbrier and New Rivers. A watercraft is the only way to access the island. Don't have a boat? A local outfitter company, Cantrell's Ultimate Rafting can provide a quick trip to Coney Island.
There are logistics involved with getting to and from the island.  The logistics will differ depending upon if you have your own kayaks or if you are using Cantrell's.  
If you are interested in staying at the island and leaving daily, it can be challenging.  Cantrell's charges a fee each way for shuttle service and may not be available at the times needed.  If customers want to explore the area and do not have their own watercraft and shuttles necessary, we encourage you to consider our other properties in the Hinton Historic District.

sectionedDescription/access:
Convenient keypad entry to front door. 

Gated driveway parking for 3 or more vehicles or multiple SxS or UTVs.  Free street parking for 1-2 vehicles + trailers.  Other parking options available depending on needs. Let us know your vehicle situation and preferences and we’ll make arrangements for convenient parking.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy your stay at the Olivia House - a charming 3 bedroom, 1 bath 3-story split-level house in the county seat of Mingo County, WV. Enjoy stargazing by the firepit in the evening and morning coffee in the foggy mountains on the patio. Remodeled eat-in kitchen features a new dishwasher and backyard access.

Keyless entry, security cameras and motion sensor lights for convenience and security.

Less than 1 mile to Buffalo Mountain trail on Hatfield McCoy Trails; 5 access points on SXS from home.

The Olivia House was designed by our grandma to be nestled into the hills on the very edge of West Virginia.  The home features a private patio and firepit area and views of the Kentucky hillside just across the Tug River.  You're located within 6 minutes of  fast-food and sit-down restaurants, convenience stores, Wal-mart, grocery stores, and gas stations but also within a mile to a Buffalo Mountain trail entrance on the Hatfield McCoy Trails—five access points on SXS from home.

Convenient keypad entry to front door.

name: The Green Cabin at Wood Mountain Campground
p3SummaryAddress: Glen Jean, West Virginia, United States
primaryHost/about: I love being outside, and I love being in cabins or spaces with a view of the sky, the grass, the trees. I try to make sure all of my rentals are places I would stay or live in too.
sectionedDescription/access: The entire cabin is yours exclusively, with 2 bedrooms, 1 bath (a bathhouse on site is also available for use), a furnished kitchen with stove, oven, frig, microwave, dishes, cutlery, bakeware, etc. There is a large front porch with rocking chairs and adirondack chairs and small tables, as well as drying racks for any wet clothes if you visit the river.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Green Cabin. In the heart of the New River Gorge recreation area of West Virginia, we are minutes from I-64/I-77, Beckley and the small town of Fayetteville that is easy to fall in love with. Our cozy 2 BR cabins are brand new, very clean, big front porches, great decor, fully furnished including a kitchen, fire pits, and 5 acres of campground space. Convenient to whitewater rafting, hiking, historical sites, national and state parks, great local restaurants and more!

On 5 acres on a hill overlooking the valley, this is Wood Mountain Campground. We are a small campground with 3 cabins, 4 RV spots, and tent camping, spread out across rolling grass. In addition to fire pits and scenic views, West Virginia Adventures rafting has a small outpost on site, if you are in the mood for a gentle float trip, a classic whitewater trip, or something even more adventurous.

The entire cabin is yours exclusively, with 2 bedrooms, 1 bath (a bathhouse on site is also available for use), a furnished kitchen with stove, oven, frig, microwave, dishes, cutlery, bakeware, etc. There is a large front porch with rocking chairs and adirondack chairs and small tables, as well as drying racks for any wet clothes if you visit the river.

We live close, are on and off property as needed, or as requested!

We are up on a hill, overlooking this recreational mecca, with easy access to Fayetteville, Beckley, New River Gorge National Park, Winterplace Ski Resort, Summersville Lake, Gauley River, and more!

Cars, trucks, RVs, motorcycles, bicycles, boats - it's all good!

name: Fall Evenings By The Fire Pit Are Calling (NRG)
p3SummaryAddress: Glen Jean, West Virginia, United States
photos/2/caption: The Manor at Glen Jean Meadows. This stately, 100-year old home is ready to welcome your and your friends and family to the New River Gorge National Park and Preserve. We're not stingy with our sunsets! Everyone can enjoy them!
photos/3/caption: The Manor At Glen Jean Meadows.  Blue skies and sunny days await you and your crew when you stay with us! We're steps from the New River Gorge National Park Preserve and The Summit Bechtel Reserve.
photos/4/caption: The main entry room.  Plenty of space to leave your gear or just stash your stuff. The antique baker's table by the door is original to the home and was painstakingly refurbished and refinished. This is great remote work space. #Wifi
photos/5/caption: Share some happy memories!  Leave us a message! We want  to hear what you loved about your stay at Glen Jean Meadows (and when you plan to come back)!
photos/6/caption: The dining nook. Perfect for breakfast, lunch or dinner! Sit down, grab a bite and plan your day! Also, a great remote work space!
photos/7/caption: Our dining nook. Montani Semper Liberi. That is Latin for Mountaineers Are Always Free and is the official motto of The Mountain State. We think it also means you're free to have a great time at Glen Jean Meadows.
photos/8/caption: Our kitchen is fully stocked.  We have pots and pans, a coffee maker, microwave, utensils, dinner ware and pretty much everything you'll need to whip up some memorable snacks and meals while you enjoy your stay. The fridge and the oven are both new!
photos/10/caption: One place to eat wasn't enough! The formal dining room is a stunner.  Plenty of seating for you and your crew.  Enjoy your morning coffee while you gaze over the back yard.  A deer or two are known to roam the property.
photos/11/caption: This stunning glassware adds a unique touch of color and style to the formal dining room.  Glassmaking has a long tradition in the Mountain State and we're proud to display these pieces at Glen Jean Meadows.
photos/12/caption: The formal living room.  Formal but fun, this is the perfect place to gather with friends and family.
photos/13/caption: The fireplace in the formal living room. It's just for looks, though. But look at that mantle! And those built ins! Stunning! Plenty of great books in the built ins. Take one with you or leave one behind!
photos/14/caption: The formal living room. And a close look at those built ins! Sturdy yet beautiful, they truly don't make em'  like this anymore.
photos/15/caption: The formal living room also serves as the gateway to the side porch. Plenty of seating and a great space to relax with friends or kick your feet up and read a book.
photos/16/caption: The den. A great sleeping space, too.
photos/19/caption: The den. The TV is equipped with a Roku so you can enjoy your favorite shows. There is also a half bath attached to this room.
photos/20/caption: An elephant crafted from WV coal.
photos/21/caption: The half bath in the den.
photos/22/caption: Ping pong! This is a guest favorite! No matter the weather, you can enjoy a friendly game of table tennis.
photos/23/caption: The front door.
photos/24/caption: The lovely view looking onto the front lawn.
photos/27/caption: The largest bedroom. It now features a brand new king-sized bed.
photos/28/caption: The fire place in the large bedroom. It's just for looks, though.
photos/29/caption: The clawfoot tub with the shower.
photos/31/caption: A look at the largest bedroom.
photos/32/caption: A smaller bedroom, but large enough for a full-sized bed.
photos/33/caption: The small bedroom.
photos/34/caption: The small bedroom.
photos/36/caption: A large bedroom with a queen-size bed.
photos/37/caption: The queen size bed.
photos/38/caption: Another bedroom with a queen size bed.
photos/41/caption: The side porch. Time to dine al fresco! This is a popular spot!
photos/42/caption: The side porch. A great place to gather with friends and family.
photos/47/caption: The side porch. Plenty of space to enjoy time with friends and family.
photos/52/caption: Don’t worry about firewood! It’s on us!
photos/53/caption: The driveway leading to the house.
photos/54/caption: The driveway leading to the house.
photos/56/caption: A main shot of the house.
photos/57/caption: The back yard and fire pit.
photos/59/caption: I don't know the secret to happiness but I'll tell you I've never been sad sitting around a fire pit.
photos/60/caption: Early evening by the fire pit - cook up some smores, share some stories and make memories to last a lifetime.
photos/61/caption: Our four-legged friends know it's always a good time at The Manor at Glen Jean Meadows.
photos/62/caption: We have room for all your toys at Glen Jean Meadows!
photos/63/caption: Looking for your pot of gold? Here it is! (Disclaimer, there is no gold at Glen Jean Meadows, but you will make plenty of treasured memories with friends and family.)
photos/68/caption: Paddling on the New River - Photo Courtesy of the West Virginia Department of Tourism.
photos/69/caption: Rocking climbing near the  New River Gorge Bridge - Photo Courtesy of the West Virginia Department of Tourism.
photos/70/caption: Summersville Lake - Photo Courtesy of the West Virginia Department of Tourism.
photos/71/caption: Exciting white water on the New River - Photo Courtesy of the West Virginia Department of Tourism.
photos/72/caption: Camp Creek - Photo Courtesy of the West Virginia Department of Tourism.
photos/73/caption: The Grist Mill at Babcock State Park - Photo Courtesy of the West Virginia Department of Tourism.
photos/74/caption: ATV Trails - Photo Courtesy of the West Virginia Department of Tourism.
photos/75/caption: The New River Gorge - Photo Courtesy of the West Virginia Department of Tourism.
photos/76/caption: We're only 25 minutes from Winterplace - home to some of the best skiing in Southern West Virginia. Photo Courtesy of the West Virginia Department of Tourism.
primaryHost/about: My wife and I have two strapping sons and a spoiled dog. We love The Gorge and love exploring all it has to offer - from rushing whitewater to scenic mountain vistas. We have painstakingly restored my family’s home and we hope you love it as much as we do.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests can access the entire home with the exception of the basement.
sectionedDescription/description:
Transport yourself immediately into the heart of traditional southern West Virginia with this spacious, historic home on a hilltop surrounded by four quiet acres of grass and trees. This is a former coal company superintendent's house built in the  1920s when Glen Jean  was a coal boom town. The property is ideally located in the New River Gorge - minutes from whitewater rafting, National Park activities, The Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve and rails-to-trails paths.

You're also a short drive to Fayetteville (voted one of America's coolest small towns), Beckley (a local commercial hub), and Oak Hill. At the house, you'll find most of your time spent on the very large covered side porch, by the designated fire pit area, or in the backyard playing badminton, cornhole and croquet. Inside you'll find all original wood flooring, a wide, wood staircase, three sets of French Doors connecting all of the main areas, and large rooms perfect for entertaining. With the home's pre-war construction, you'll have a classic mix of old West Virginia's historic charm but with spacious rooms, high ceilings and large windows -- especially good for letting in the cool night air (as Glen Jean is on the Fayette Plateau, evenings consistently drop to the mid 60s each night, even when afternoon temps are in the traditional summer ranges of the 70s to 80s.) After driving up the approximately 200 yard long private, tree-lined paved drive to the hilltop, you'll treat yourself to large accommodations including a spacious living room, dining room, TV room and you'll have access to a full size garage to keep your gear out of the elements. And there's no need to keep your music low as the neighbors are out of earshot.

Our home was recently featured in an issue of Teen Vogue.

Guests can access the entire home with the exception of the basement.

I will be available by phone.

This property is fairly out of the way (but not too far off of U.S. Route 19) and you will have plenty of open space. We are about 10 miles from the New River, about a mile or so from The Summit Bechtel Reserve and a literal stone's throw from Camp Royal and about 14 miles from Fayetteville and most of the White Water Rafting Outfitters. We are 25 minutes away from Winterplace.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Quiet hours after midnight, but we won't be super picky. 

No use of ATVS or UTVS on property. 

No large campers or trailers.

sectionedDescription/access: You will have access to the entire Cabin in addition to the property the surrounds it. (The small sheds/garages on property are not part of the rental they are for house keeping and maintenance use only)
sectionedDescription/description:
Elk Creek Trail House #400 is an ideal location for HatField Mcoy trail riders and/or Motorcyclist exploring the southern West Virginia Hills. Located only 5 miles from the Hatfield Mcoy Buffalo mountain trail head #14. It is legal to ride the road to the trail head on UTV/ATV . There is a quick mart on the way where you can get gas, trail permits and snacks. ONLY 10 miles from route 119 on the famous Devils den Motorcycle routes which offers over 1000 miles of incredible Motorcycle riding.

Perfect for Trail riders, Motorcyclists or families just wanting to get away for a bit!
This spacious Cabin sits on 25 acres and offers plenty of parking on a stone drive way and features a flat concrete carport that is great for in between ride maintenance. This Cabin features a very large patio with a large BBQ grille. ( you will need to bring your own propane tank)There is a stream that runs through the front yard an a couple very nice overlooks on the property. The views are gorgeous. Located towards the end of a dead end road  with very little traffic.  Property has a large firepit and chairs to surround it. We have an additional 2 bedroom/1 bath private cabin  as a additional rental possibility at $150 per night just a short walk next door for larger groups that would require both. This is a separate rental not included.

You will have access to the entire Cabin in addition to the property the surrounds it. (The small sheds/garages on property are not part of the rental they are for house keeping and maintenance use only)

Available by text from 7am till 9pm
We have access to local support should anything need to be done quickly.

Nice quiet neighborhood surround by incredibly nice people

ATV, UTV and dirt bikes are all allowed to drive on the secondary roads (not highways or interstates) but you can go pretty much everywhere. helmets are required . obey normal traffic laws speeds and safety

Shopping center with Walmart, Lowes , and tractor supply just 30 min away.
Phone calls will have to be done over WIFI at the house

We have an additional 2 bedroom/1 bath private cabin  as a additional rental possibility at $150 per night just a short walk next door for larger groups that would require both. This is a separate rental not included.
sectionedDescription/summary: Elk Creek Trail House #400 is an ideal location for HatField Mcoy trail riders and/or Motorcyclist exploring the southern West Virginia Hills. Located only 5 miles from the Hatfield Mcoy Buffalo mountain trail head #14. It is legal to ride the road to the trail head on UTV/ATV . There is a quick mart on the way where you can get gas, trail permits and snacks. ONLY 10 miles from route 119 on the famous Devils den Motorcycle routes which offers over 1000 miles of incredible Motorcycle riding.
sectionedDescription/transit: ATV, UTV and dirt bikes are all allowed to drive on the secondary roads (not highways or interstates) but you can go pretty much everywhere. helmets are required . obey normal traffic laws speeds and safety

additionalHouseRules: No smoking allowed.  Guests will be charged a $200 cleaning fee for smoking in the house or on property.

name: Winterplace Condo E202
primaryHost/about: My husband and I grew up here in WV and love the area.  There is so much to do outdoors, and the scenery is wonderful. Our family loves spending time by the water (lakes and rivers) in the summer and playing in the snow in the winter.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Slow down and enjoy mountain views and breezes from your private deck. Try this condo in our off season (spring - fall) and enjoy a quiet place when your not out exploring WV. In winter, ski in and  out from this condo onto the slopes of Winterplace Ski Resort. This condo is located on the second floor and the deck overlooks the 'Last Chance' and 'Last Run' trails. It is also close to Beckley and Princeton, Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve and southern WV whitewater country. During the ski season, we offer discounted equipment rentals from Ski Celebrations for all of our guests.
The condo sleeps up to 10, great for a large family or a couple of small families with separate bathrooms or for those that just want some space and privacy that you can't get in a hotel. Private deck to enjoy the views from.
~ DETAILS ~
~ Sleeps: up to 10  (for stays under 10 days) 
~ Master Bedroom: 1 Queen Size Bed with attached bath 
~ Bedroom 2: 1 Queen Size Bed
~ Bunkroom: 2 Twin Size Beds (Bunk)
~ Living Room: 1 Double Size Futon and a pull out couch
~ Cable TV in Living Room and all three bed rooms
~ Fully Equipped Kitchen
~ Ski Rack
~ Small Dryer in the condo
~ Pets welcome with paid pet fee  (for stays under 10 days)  Contact us for more details. 
~ Views of Winterplace Ski Resort
The kitchen is totally equipped with all the essentials, including crock pot, coffee maker, pots and pans, a built-in microwave, dishwasher and everything that you need for your vacation. 
The living room consist of an electric fireplace and a view out the sliding glass doors onto the slopes. The master bedroom has a queen bed with a bath and views onto the mountains.
Everything you need to create great family memories!
The condo has electric baseboard heaters in each room, so you can adjust the heat to the temperature that you prefer when it's cold outside. When it's hot, there is an AC unit installed in the living room above the sliding glass door. This is for AC only. We are not allowed to do duct work in the 2nd or 3rd floor condos, so this is the only practical way to get AC in the unit, leaving room doors open as often as possible helps to keep the whole condo cool.
Please be aware there will be a $200 security deposit that will be pre-authorized on your credit card the day before you arrive and is released 7 days after you depart unless there is damage. This is a standard practice for vacation home rentals as there is no staff at the facility and this allows you to check in with an electronic door code and check out by just texting us and leaving the morning of your last day.
Also, the road to the condos is a gravel, hilly, road that Winterplace Ski Resort is paid to take care of it. Sometimes through the year, we will have heavy rains that create ruts in the road and Winterplace Ski Resort, being closed, is slow in making the repairs. Low clearance vehicles will need to be very careful coming up the hill from Winterplace Ski Resort's main parking area. In the winter, they grade the road and keep it plowed and put cinders on the road but please be prepared and understand you may need a four wheel drive, all wheel drive or chains to help get up the hill.
We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to www.InsureMyTrip.com for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsuraneMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.
~Long Term Stays ~
For those looking to stay for more than a week, the following changes apply:
- We only allow 3 people to stay per condo
- No pets allowed
- We do not provide daily maid service but will provide clean linens weekly. 
Please contact us for further information.
WINTERPLACE SKI-IN SKI-OUT CONDOS
Enjoy skiing or snowboarding right outside your door while staying on the slopes at Winterplace Resort. Easy access to all the runs. Our condos are located on the top (3rd) floor with great views. Winterplace also offers snow-tubing runs and a snowboard terrain park. Winterplace Resort is conveniently located only 5 minutes from I-77 at the Ghent exit.
NEAR BECKLEY AND WHITEWATER COUNTRY
During the spring, summer and fall don’t think there is nothing to do. We are close to all the fun that southern West Virginia has to offer. Whitewater rafting, kayaking, river tubing, rock climbing, hiking, horseback riding etc. All different kinds of outdoor fun are waiting for you to take advantage of.There are several state and national parks near by, like Little Beaver State Parkand Grandview National Park. We are also near Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve. The temperature in the mountains of West Virginia remains cooler than a lot of the surrounding states, so this is great place to come cool off. Enjoy something different from the beach, take your family out into nature.
And for anytime of the year fun, Beckley has something for everyone. Of course, there are all your favorite fast food and sit down restaurants, as well as some home-grown restaurants that might become your new favorites. There is a wide variety of different shops. The Tamarackhas everything you might want to see from our unique West Virginia craftsman. There are a lot of different antique shops and Crossroads Mall for those that might want something a little familiar. There is the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, where you can tour an actual coal mine and let the kids explore the coal mining town and the Youth Museum. During good weather, there are also trails, playground, basketball and tennis courts and a pool with a waterslide. There is also, Mountain State Miniature Golfwhich doesn’t have just mini-golf but offers a small coffee shop and an indoor climbing wall. Beckley is a great place to spend a few days exploring all it has to offer and it’s only a quick drive up Interstate 77.

name: Private Island Home
photos/0/caption: Large cozy home with deck and screened in porch
photos/10/caption: Half bath w/ shower and laundry room.
photos/16/caption: Outdoor grill
sectionedDescription/access:
Guests have the entire island and home. We provide the initial and final boat rides for guests and gear. Additional shuttles off the island are $30.

You CANNOT DRIVE to the island. If you would like to come off the island for the day it is a $30 boat shuttle fee.
sectionedDescription/description:
Watch the New River flow in the distance from the screened-in porch of the spacious home on your own 11-acre private Island. 

Stroll to the shore and enjoy relaxing, bass fishing, and admiring the sights and sounds of the water. Bald Eagles sometimes fly between the mountains. Hike through the woods to spot deer, flying squirrels, owls, and other West Virginia wildlife. 

Cook a meal on the outdoor grill. Sit back by the fire - or enjoy tv and air conditioning inside. Wi-Fi works great.

The home has two private bedrooms featuring double beds, a loft with a twin bed and a double bed. Large living room and dining area open to a full kitchen. Two bathrooms - one with a tub and one with a shower/laundry room - large outdoor charcoal grill. Spacious screened in deck with lots of seating and a porch swing. 11 acres of land all yours to explore. The home sleeps 8 and there is plenty of room for tent camping in the yard and around the island. Minimum age is 5 years old.

Guests have the entire island and home. We provide the initial and final boat rides for guests and gear. Additional shuttles off the island are $30.

You CANNOT DRIVE to the island. If you would like to come off the island for the day it is a $30 boat shuttle fee.

Once on the island you will be left at peace.

Your safety is our priority. With over 50 years combined River Guide experience and annual CPR/First Aid for the Professional Responder certifications - you can be confident in our quick reply to any emergency.

The island in the confluence of the New and Greenbrier Rivers between Coney Island and Bushes Island.

To get to the island you will need to ride our boat.

Our shop offers Guided raft tours and there are rafts and inflatable kayak (duckie) rentals available.

name: House on private 400 acre mountaintop farm!
p3SummaryAddress: Summers County, West Virginia, United States
primaryHost/about: Julia and I are year round Folly Beach residents, and in addition to managing our vacation properties, we also own and operate Bert's Market, the only grocery store on the island. We also have five children and would like you to know that U2 is the greatest band on the planet.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is not your average AirBnB - this is a farm! We offer a private 400 acre farm located 25 miles from Pipestem Resort State Park and 11 miles to New River Gorge National Park. Our farm house has 2 bedrooms, 1 loft bed, 2.5 baths, sleeps 8, and offers beautiful sunsets, hiking trails, fresh pond water to kayak in, and the comforts of home.  Explore nature by day and sleep under the stars at night.

There's something for everyone here with an open floor plan, 2 bedrooms, a loft area with a full bed, 2.5 baths. The master suite offers breathtaking views and the sitting room has a wood-burning stove and board games for you and your family to enjoy.

rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Relax with the whole family at this Brand new Cabin.  A very peaceful place to stay. Sits on the Guyandotte River that's great for kayaking.   Very close to the Hatfield McCoy Bear Wallow trailhead.   Unload your ATV and hit the trail.  Restaurant on site and also very close to a car wash.  If you need a place to stay for the holidays while visiting family, this is the place for you!

We have 3 separate bedrooms.  In 2 of the bedrooms there are queen size bed.   In the other bedroom we have 2 full size beds.  We have 1 bathroom with a shower and a laundry area  a washer and dryer

I live just a few minutes from the cabin.  I’m easy to get in touch with should any problem occur

There's a Tudor's Biscuit World Restaurant on site.  Other restaurants nearby.  Also Chief Logan state park is just a couple of miles down the road.  There is a Carwash close by

Bearwallow is a fun trail. Small but worth a good ride. There is a hill climb on 35, a
Coal mine on 36, a Collapsed coal mine on 86.  83 is a fun,  but more technical trail that has a deep mud pit on it. 
27 has two decent mud holes right in the middle of a wide open area. 
28 is nothing but mud.

Nice fire pit with benches.  Please bring your own firewood.  Also have a corn  hole game on-site.

We do not permit any type of partying or loud music.


*We are also just a couple of of miles from chief Logan State Park.  In the month of December they have “Christmas in the Park” light display.  Best in the state! 

No smoking is permitted inside of cabin

sectionedDescription/access: Ample free parking.  We are right across the street from Pipestem State Park, and there are lots of recreational and outdoor activities available, including hiking, swimming, ziplining, dining, golf and horseback riding. Reservations are suggested.
sectionedDescription/description:
Property includes Four Luxury Chalets, nestled together, on the property of Pipestem Spa and Event Center. Pipestem Resort State Park is directly across the street.  Luxury spa services and many chalet amenities are available (please book those online).  

Well behaved small pets allowed with prior approval. Pet fee is $35 fee Per Pet, Per Day, to be paid to host upon arrival. If host is not notified of animals being present, the guest may be asked to leave immediately.

Comfortable cabin that is ideal for families with children. Sleeps up to 12 people. Main floor: Full, spacious kitchen, open to the living room and dining room with full bath. Family room has 50” flat screen TV with DirecTV. Upper level: Three bedrooms – Master has queen-size bed, private bath with Jacuzzi tub, and plenty of room for playpen or portable crib. Second bedroom has two queen-size beds. Third bedroom has two bunk beds with twins on top and queens on bottom. All three bedrooms have remote controlled, individual heating and cooling units. Washer/Dryer/Dishwasher. Front porch: Sassafras king chairs and one double king chair. Charcoal grill and fire pit available.

Ample free parking.  We are right across the street from Pipestem State Park, and there are lots of recreational and outdoor activities available, including hiking, swimming, ziplining, dining, golf and horseback riding. Reservations are suggested.

Four Mountain Chalets, located on the property of Pipestem Spa and Event Center, across the street from Pipestem Resort State Park. With Brandon's BBQ right around the corner.

Contactless check-in. Guest will be sent an email with personal door code and Wi-Fi access one day before arrival.  Guest may arrive at any time after 4 PM, and check out is 10 AM. 

Massage, facial, hair and nail appointments for spa services must be booked in advance!


Guests may order Fruit and Cheese Trays, Champagne in Chalet, Romantic Couple's Massage with Foaming Milk Bubble Bath, King and Queen Packages, or Surprise Birthday Package (cake and balloons) in advance by contacting the host directly.

photos/3/caption: Main bedroom, with Queen bed and attached bath

primaryHost/about: We love outdoor/water activities, hiking, biking and reading, but one of our favorite activities is sitting on the deck with a nice bottle of wine with friends and enjoying the view. We enjoy travel--anywhere around water is fine with us and we have fallen in love with Central America.The Lord has blessed us with many opportunities to travel and we hope to continue--we would like to explore South Africa next!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access:
The home is set on 5 wooded acres with over 300 feet of waterfront. Due to so many trees, we are unable to offer satellite TV; however we do have  a television and a movie library. There are many books, magazines and family games for your relaxation. Note: cell service is limited to Verizon and US Cellular.
Also due to the number of trees, campfires are not permitted.
sectionedDescription/description:
Your journey begins on a private gravel road that leads through the woods to a log home in the mountains of Virginia. Immerse yourself in the many outdoor activities just steps from the front door - fishing kayaking, splashing in the river or doing some fine "river-sitting". Nearby you can bike or walk the New River Trail, visit historical sites or visit the Blue Ridge Parkway. Wineries and antiques stores are within an easy drive! Or just relax on the deck and watch the sun set over the river~

The log cabin features a spacious great room with cathedral ceilings, hickory hardwood  and tile floors, custom pine cabinetry and a Jacuzzi tub in the master bath. Watch the sun set over the river from  the large deck with 2 covered porches while you listen to the melodic sounds of the river and use our large gas grill to prepare your fresh catch from the river!

The home is set on 5 wooded acres with over 300 feet of waterfront. Due to so many trees, we are unable to offer satellite TV; however we do have  a television and a movie library. There are many books, magazines and family games for your relaxation. Note: cell service is limited to Verizon and US Cellular.
Also due to the number of trees, campfires are not permitted.

Owners are available by phone, text and email. Please contact us with any questions about the property.
Guest access is provided by a coded gate and entrance to the home.

Our cabin is located in a family "compound" of about 40 acres. In summer, the other homes are not visible from the cabin, but you may see others enjoying the river upstream.

Nearby: Galax, Wytheville, Hillsville and Pulaski
Radford University and Virginia Tech are within 1 hour.
New River Trail 
Golf courses, live theater, wineries, Safari Park, Mount Rodgers and White Top Mountain
Foster Falls State Park offers horseback rides, canoe and tube rental
Crooked Road Music Trail-Blue Ridge Music Center and Rex Theatre
A car is necessary

Low Allergen Environment
Minimum age for renters
Children Welcome
Non-smoking only
Pets not allowed
Suitable for elderly or infirm (only 3 steps at the back entrance), single floor plan
***Bedroom Configuration:
Master-Queen

Bedroom #3 Full and Twin

name: The Yellow Cabin at Wood Mountain Campground
p3SummaryAddress: Glen Jean, West Virginia, United States
primaryHost/about: I love being outside, and I love being in cabins or spaces with a view of the sky, the grass, the trees. I try to make sure all of my rentals are places I would stay or live in too.
sectionedDescription/access: The entire cabin is yours exclusively, with 2 bedrooms, 1 bath (a bathhouse on site is also available for use), a furnished kitchen with stove, oven, frig, microwave, dishes, cutlery, bakeware, etc. There is a large front porch with rocking chairs and adirondack chairs and small tables, as well as drying racks for any wet clothes if you visit the river.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Yellow Cabin. In the heart of the New River Gorge recreation area of West Virginia, we are minutes from I-64/I-77, Beckley and the small town of Fayetteville that is easy to fall in love with. Our cozy 2 BR cabins are brand new, very clean, big front porches, great decor, fully furnished including a kitchen, fire pits, and 5 acres of campground space. Convenient to whitewater rafting, hiking, historical sites, national and state parks, great local restaurants and more!

On 5 acres on a hill overlooking the valley, this is Wood Mountain Campground. We are a small campground with 3 cabins, 4 RV spots, and tent camping, spread out across rolling grass. In addition to fire pits and scenic views, West Virginia Adventures rafting has a small outpost on site, if you are in the mood for a gentle float trip, a classic whitewater trip, or something even more adventurous.

The entire cabin is yours exclusively, with 2 bedrooms, 1 bath (a bathhouse on site is also available for use), a furnished kitchen with stove, oven, frig, microwave, dishes, cutlery, bakeware, etc. There is a large front porch with rocking chairs and adirondack chairs and small tables, as well as drying racks for any wet clothes if you visit the river.

We live close, are on and off property as needed, or as requested!

We are up on a hill, overlooking this recreational mecca, with easy access to Fayetteville, Beckley, New River Gorge National Park, Winterplace Ski Resort, Summersville Lake, Gauley River, and more!

Cars, trucks, RVs, motorcycles, bicycles, boats - it's all good!

additionalHouseRules:
•	No smoking allowed in rooms, hallways, or patios. There will be an additional $100 smoke cleaning charge added to your bill, in the event smoking has taken place on the property.
•	Additional cleaning charges apply for excessive cleaning due to mud or garbage left by guest upon departure. 
•	NO excessive noise allowed at any time. 
•	DO NOT litter on premise.
•	Please reset thermostat upon departure; 72 degrees in the summer and 68 degrees in the winter.
•	Linens, towels, and toiletries will not be changed during your stay. There is a laundry mat located at The Heritage Apartments-3690 Coal Heritage Rd.
•	Destruction, theft, or damage of property will result in legal action and payment will be due immediately.
•	If Wi-Fi goes out- please attempt to reset modem by holding power button for 30 seconds and allowing reboot; prior to contacting Comcast at 1-800-934-6489.
•	Guests are responsible for personal property.
•	Only permitted guests allowed on property.
•	Check out is at 11:00 A.M. Please request for late checkout availability *additional charges will apply*.
•	Permitted pets only with $100 nonrefundable pet fee per pet. We wll send you a request for additional pet fees. If your pet causes destruction to property, this will incur additional fees and/or legal action.
•	Trash dumpster is located outside, remove all trash upon departure and place in dumpster on property.
•	Wash all used dishes, dry, and put away prior to departure.
•	Strip all used bed linens, towels, etc. and place in tub for cleaners. 
•	Be mindful of neighbors as some do live here year-round.
•	Management office is open Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. for any major questions or concerns. 
-$100 cleaning fee per stay.
-Weekly & Monthly stays available. 
-2 night minimum required.

name: Spurrier Apt 4 (2 Bed 1 Bath Pets Allowed)
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautifully updated 2 Bedroom 1 Bathroom Apartment features a complete kitchen with all the necessities. Free Wifi and just a short ride to all the trail systems. 2 TV's with DVD players & Netflix access. Walking distance to shopping & restaurants. Includes two queen bed, towels & washcloths for 4 guests, and a charcoal grill on the covered balcony. Central air & heat. Pets allowed with additional fee.

This rental has queen beds in both bedrooms. Towels and washcloths are included for four guests. It was just remodeled with brand new paint throughout, a new central heating and air HVAC unit, new bedding, & new flooring. This rental includes a complete kitchen with all of the necessities, from pots and pans down to silverware, and a full-size stove & refrigerator! We have supplied everything down to the hangers to hang your clothes on inside of a full-size closets with dressers in both bedrooms.  There is a TV in the living room and one of the bedrooms, with a DVD player at each TV to watch your favorite Red Box movies on. The living room even has a leather duel reclining sofa. Additional perks for this property include the charcoal grill for your use on your private, covered, back patio!

It is within walking distance to shopping and restaurants such as, Dollar General, Gino’s Pizza, to a local favorite ‘Lynn’s Drive-In Restaurant’, a gas station, Advanced Auto, and even a laundromat. Razor and ATV riding is legal on all streets in this town. You can park your truck and trailer in the parking lot and ride straight to the trails. Great cell service, FREE Wi-Fi, and it is only a short ride to all of the trail systems.

Side Note: You will have to go up steps to get to this two-bedroom apartment style nightly rental.

Contactless check in and check out is a must. You are emailed your door code the day of check in and once inside you have an extra security door lock.

	3PM check-in & 11AM check-out. Early check-in and late check-out may
        be available for an additional fee.
	2-night minimum stay required which will include all of the luxuries you have in your own home.
	PETS WELCOMED! $100 non-refundable pet fee will be required though due to the extensive deep cleaning conducted after a pet has visited.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
•	No smoking allowed in rooms, hallways, or patios. There will be an additional $100 smoke cleaning charge added to your bill, in the event smoking has taken place on the property.
•	Additional cleaning charges apply for excessive cleaning due to mud or garbage left by guest upon departure. 
•	NO excessive noise allowed at any time. 
•	DO NOT litter on premise.
•	Please reset thermostat upon departure; 72 degrees in the summer and 68 degrees in the winter.
•	Linens, towels, and toiletries will not be changed during your stay. There is a laundry mat located at The Heritage Apartments-3690 Coal Heritage Rd.
•	Destruction, theft, or damage of property will result in legal action and payment will be due immediately.
•	If Wi-Fi goes out- please attempt to reset modem by holding power button for 30 seconds and allowing reboot; prior to contacting Comcast at 1-800-934-6489.
•	Guests are responsible for personal property.
•	Only permitted guests allowed on property.
•	Check out is at 11:00 A.M. Please request for late checkout availability *additional charges will apply*.
•	Permitted pets only with $100 nonrefundable pet fee per pet. We wll send you a request for additional pet fees. If your pet causes destruction to property, this will incur additional fees and/or legal action.
•	Trash dumpster is located outside, remove all trash upon departure and place in dumpster on property.
•	Wash all used dishes, dry, and put away prior to departure.
•	Strip all used bed linens, towels, etc. and place in tub for cleaners. 
•	Be mindful of neighbors as some do live here year-round.
•	Management office is open Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. for any major questions or concerns. 
-$100 cleaning fee per stay.
-Weekly & Monthly stays available. 
-2 night minimum required.
