name: Holston River House - a Sojourn in Serenity...
photos/0/caption: South Fork of the Holston River is your playground for trout fishing or just enjoying the majesty of nature.
photos/1/caption: Our home is designed and appointed for comfort and enjoyment.  Hot tub, open deck, covered porch, perched above the river yet close to town ensure your pleasure.
photos/2/caption: The mighty Holston River is a renowned hatchery supported trout fishing mecca.  We enjoy just sitting above and reflecting on our day.
photos/3/caption: The patio furniture on the deck is to die for...
photos/4/caption: The River House is so close to Abingdon, the Barter Theater, Virginia Creeper Trail, national forest, Marion, Bristol Motor Speedway, Mt. Rogers and more!
photos/5/caption: Peace and quiet abounds on the Holston River in Adwolfe section of Marion, VA.
photos/6/caption: In season you will love the flowers from knock-out roses and azaleas to burning bushes, rhododendron, mountain laurel and more.
photos/7/caption: A mountain river getaway perched on a high bank that slopes to an easy river entry.  You can fish, sit on the bank in our Adirondack chairs, soak in the hot tub and let time roll by...
photos/8/caption: The abundant grounds of the river house are lovely for croquet, peace and quiet and privacy.
photos/9/caption: The River House combines the tranquility peace of nature with extraordinary proximity to Marion, Abingdon and all the amenities of Southwest Virginia.
photos/10/caption: Floating in the warm, wet wonder of the hot tub overlooking this world-class trout stream is an experience that will transport you from the stress of your workaday world to the sublime serenity of nature and contenment.
photos/11/caption: At night the colors and bubbles of the hot tub jets add texture to your experience as you sit above the river's rapids and underneath the mesmerizing, brilliant firmament of dazzling stars and moonlight.
photos/12/caption: Imagine a million ways of engaging this wonder of the world - the South Fork of the Holston River.  Fed by the cold pure mountain spring waters of Mt. Rogers, it is the quintessential habitat for trout.  But it's exquisite merely to meander along.
photos/13/caption: Sometimes our relation with family and friend merely needs time and space to rejuvenate and thrive.  Come, eat, talk and re-connect!
photos/14/caption: Our exquisitely set hot tub is easy to reach with robes and towel in the armoire at the patio door.  But you may linger on the patio furniture and absorb the grandeur of the river.
photos/15/caption: Our home makes it easy to enjoy this magnificent river.  With almost thirty places to sit along and around the river, we've simply ensconced it with comfort.
photos/16/caption: Everything is easy at The River House.  Everything you need for a quiet getaway is right at your fingertips.
photos/17/caption: You'll find the flow and floor plan are easy to navigate and connect you to the covered porch and open deck while giving everyone as much privacy as they desire.
photos/18/caption: You will love the tufted leather furniture in the family room and how natural golden sunshine floods in the floor to ceiling windows.
photos/19/caption: Exquisite Persian Carpets dignify every room with a supple elegance.
photos/20/caption: Play board games at our many tables in almost any indoor or outdoor space you desire.
photos/21/caption: Our lovely day bed with trundle adds two sleeping berths besides our two bedrooms.  And then there are the luxurious sofas...
photos/22/caption: The hall bath is light and airy with attractive ceramic tile.
photos/23/caption: The master bedroom is an excursion into the realm of decadent luxury with a king bed, oriental rug, love seat all on pretty hardwood floors.
photos/24/caption: Our king-sized bed fitted with Macy's "Hotel Collection" finest thread-count cotton linens will leave you in the lap of luxury.
photos/25/caption: The queen bedroom is beautifully appointed with a stout brass rail and piquant artistic lamps.
photos/26/caption: The great room is our pride and joy with a panoply of fine pieces by Hooker, Ferguson-Copeland, Bob Timberlake and more.  The bohkara carpet elevates the entire room.
photos/27/caption: Our great room is your launching point to the open deck and hot tub.  Return to a blazing fireplace in cold weather or let the breeze blow through all summer.
photos/28/caption: Choose between nature or interior.  When you tire of exertion in natural majesty of the river, return inside or outside the River House to rejuvenate.
photos/29/caption: All the baths are clean, light, airy and convenient.
photos/30/caption: Did we say 8' billiard table in the lower level?  Ensconced with a widescreen TV and additional seating it's yet another place to repair privately for nice time with those we love.
photos/31/caption: River breezes are our favorite!  Simply sitting outside around sunrise or sunset are events of breathtaking beauty.
photos/32/caption: Some of the best conversations ensue at this table over grilled steaks, seafood and wine by the Holston River.
photos/33/caption: What we love about our patio is the heavy, supple, comfortable patio furniture.  Of course you'll also love the view and sound of the river and pastoral meadow setting.
photos/34/caption: The covered porch is a godsend on rainy days.  And don't forget about the large outbuilding with ping pong and plenty of sofas for a gallery of judges.
photos/35/caption: One of the problems is wherever you sit, you're looking at somewhere else beautiful.  You'll find yourselves walking everywhere just to absorb some more magic!
photos/36/caption: The sounds of the river totally permeate the covered porch.
photos/37/caption: We always find ourselves solving problems sitting around this heavy glass table surrounded by the sounds of the river.
photos/38/caption: This 8-person Jacuzzi hot tub is one of their flagship models with controls that allow increasing or decreasing jets, colors and currents.  The concrete walk keeps your feet free from debris and the bench make it easy in and out. Float over the river
photos/39/caption: Our storage building is the ultimate man cave.  On rainy days you can solve all the worlds problems right here.
photos/40/caption: Ping pong is fun especially on a quality table.  Open the overhead doors and party the night away.
photos/41/caption: You may own all the tea in China but you'll never know a higher grandeur than lolling above the banks of the South Fork of the Holston River.
photos/42/caption: Our job is to make being by the river easy to enjoy.  So we've got seats galore and unobtrusive safety lights on the river path so you can safely see the edge in the evening.  If you haven't accomplished a thing your whole visit, we've done our job.
photos/43/caption: Stay long enough and you'll begin to notice fine and subtle shades of difference in the time of day by color, sound, scent and sky.  You'll get back in rhythm with nature at the River House.
photos/44/caption: A Cornucopia of natural majesty awaits you at the River House.  Slow down, sit around and just watch people grow.   Get a whole new perspective on life and those you love in a long interlude at the River House.
photos/45/caption: Of the thirty some seats outdoors at the River House, we're sure you'll find your favorite spot.  But we think you'll like em all!
photos/46/caption: Another wonderful sunrise beside the Holston River.  Any direction you look holds sublime wonder and beauty.  From the river to the mountains to the farms, pastures and forests.  Come enjoy all of Southwest VA at the River House, then come back again
sectionedDescription/access:
Guests have private access to the entire 1.5 acre property - the cottage, outdoor spaces including open deck for grilling, 6 person aqua jet Jacuzzi, Adirondack chairs on 500+ ft of river frontage,  easy access to the river for fishing or wading, copper firepit (split wood provided), picnic table, hammock, level side yard for croquet, bocce ball, three Nel Lusso cruise bikes (helmets not provided).  Guests also have access to a pole style barn building with ping pong table and comfortable seating. 

Upon request host will provide trail maps for guests interested in hiking/walking neighboring 240 acres which boast spectacular mountain views and woodland trails. Picnic, take nature photos.  Surrounded by acres of freshly mowed hay and endless views of ancient mountains and hollows and verdant valleys, even the most jaded cynic will succumb to the beauty and majesty of nature.  Be prepared to experience lower blood pressure, slower heart rate, crystal clear thoughts.  Oh, I think I got carried away:)  You will, too!
sectionedDescription/description:
Natural splendor awaits you at The River House!  Perched on South Fork Holston River, a trout fly fishing mecca, it resonates tranquility.  The home is appointed by the finest in interior furniture and bedding.  Hike, bike, fly fish, tour nearby Mt Rogers, Grayson Highlands, Jefferson National Forest, VA Creeper Trail, or dine in historic Abingdon.  Take in small town vibe at First Friday in Marion.  Enjoy hot tub, ping pong, billiards, croquet, or lolling by the river.  Welcome!  Come enjoy!

The River House is a gorgeous, quiet getaway perched sublimely on the banks of the South Fork of the mighty Holston River in the Adwolfe area of pastoral Smyth County, Virginia.  Nestled peacefully on five hundred feet of this state-hatchery supported trout stream, you’ll find your cares slipping into oblivion regardless of which riverside Adirondack chair or seat in the hot tub you pick.  Here time disappears as your rhythm changes with days dissolving into dusk, sunsets become sunrises and back again.  The sound of the river will resonate in your soul.  Perfectly placed on a private triangle of land, it commands hundreds of feet on the river.  And if you need anything you’re equidistant to Marion or Chilhowie, and even closer to Jefferson National Forest, Mount Rogers, and Grayson Highlands State Park.  

Once you’re acclimated to the serene sounds and sights of this constantly coursing stream, you’ll grow to love the subtle and supple quality of The River House.  Pulling into the driveway you’ll come first to the covered porch with several seating spaces for those times when the rain washes the valley.  Off to the right, along the riverbank is a raised deck, jutting out over the stream.  Further down the bank, are a row of inviting Adirondack chairs.  As I am in this narrative, you’ll find yourself irresistibly drawn to the outside because of its unique, natural power and beauty.  But come inside for a minute.  Let’s cross the threshold.  Here’s a modest but updated kitchen, replete with a coffee bar beside the front door to accommodate company in the kitchen. From the kitchen window you’ll see a wonderful view of the river wending its way north.  Looking left, you’ll see a generous, sunny family room with a café table and six chairs, an exquisite, tufted, Cordovan leather sofa, matching chair, and daybed with trundle for an extra two sleeping berths.  Sink your bare feet into the burgundy wool and silk Persian carpet.  Walk through this sunny space and you’ll enter the hallway to the sleeping quarters.  On the right is the master bedroom appointed with a stout, king-sized furniture suite, another exquisite Persian carpet and carved floral love seat.  Across the hall is the guest bedroom with another compelling queen set.  Our choice of bedding is the Frontgate Resort line.  Linens are from Macy’s Hotel Collection.  Bedding is dried “en plein air,” so you’ll slumber in fragrant mountain sunshine.   We don’t want to anesthetize you, but you’ll love your slumber as much as your waking hours!  

Let’s step down to the lower level and see what’s going on there.  Taking the staircase from the kitchen, we alight on the lower level.  We think you’ll be delighted with the 8’ Brunswick billiards table appointed nicely with a green and buff Tiffany-style billiards light overhead.  Adjacent is an intimate two-chair café table, and wide-screen opposite.  Especially in inclement weather this is another nice and separate gathering space.  We make it easy for folks to converge and diverge. 

Back through the kitchen we come to the large gathering room with full bath.  Quietly dominating this space is a scarlet Bokhara Persian carpet – truly art underfoot.  The generous leather furnishings, glow of the fireplace and overall ambiance may invite you to linger longer than you intended.  In cold weather you’ll love the fireplace radiating warmth and light.  With the spa towels and robes in the nearby armoire, it’s tempting to take a turn in the hot tub.  

Open the patio doors and step out onto the open deck.  Out here you’re going to find your senses beset by a panoply of natural amenities competing for your attention.  You’ll see and hear the unique sounds of the river, the trees waving across green meadows in the wafting wind.  Depending upon how your day has gone, you may just decide to plop down here on the patio to relax and decide what to do next.  That may constitute nothing more than enjoying the experience of the The River House. This open deck is a natural gathering place for sitting, talking, eating and engaging with friends and family surrounded by nature’s bounty and beauty.

Or, grab your towels and robes and head for the spa.  Follow the sidewalk to the Jacuzzi six-person spa with lighting, aqua massage jets for a moment of pure relaxation on the banks of the Holston River letting the water work its wonder.  Others may prefer relaxing on the river-bank in one of the Adirondack chairs.  Recline in these comfy seats and contemplate nothing more than the moving waters.  Or light a campfire in the copper pit or carry a basket of goodies down to the picnic table.  For group lawn games, you can choose between ping-pong, croquet or bocce ball.  You can also access the adjacent storage building with ping pong table and comfortable sofas. 
Here you’ll find three easy-mount bicycles for pure holiday fun.  And if you’d rather hike, we’re happy to provide a trail map to some of the prettier vantage points on our adjacent 240 acres.  You can easily hike 1-5 miles and picnic out in the open with some of Smyth County’s most spectacular views.  Check out our trail maps.  Did we mention trout fishing!  And you can also content yourselves streaming video inside or roaming around outside with our wi-fi music speaker.  Just come have fun!

As you can see, The River House is an experience waiting to unfold beautifully and uniquely for all of our guests.  Hungry Mother State Park, Virginia Highlands Festival, Mount Rogers Naturalist Rally, Virginia Creeper Trail, Virginia Highlands Horse Trail, Appalachian Trail - endless opportunities for adventure are just minutes away.  Experience an outdoor adventure or quiet serenity.  Embrace togetherness or seek your own solitude.  However, you choose to personalize your own River House revels, we hope you leave with memories for a lifetime and long to return to do it all over again!  When you return to reacquaint yourselves with its magic, we’ll have everything ready and waiting for you.

Consider renting the river house for a romantic weekend, or a girlfriends only getaway, or a fly fishermen's holiday, or make up your own reason to spend time at the river house.  Maybe the river is calling you!

Guests have private access to the entire 1.5 acre property - the cottage, outdoor spaces including open deck for grilling, 6 person aqua jet Jacuzzi, Adirondack chairs on 500+ ft of river frontage,  easy access to the river for fishing or wading, copper firepit (split wood provided), picnic table, hammock, level side yard for croquet, bocce ball, three Nel Lusso cruise bikes (helmets not provided).  Guests also have access to a pole style barn building with ping pong table and comfortable seating. 

Upon request host will provide trail maps for guests interested in hiking/walking neighboring 240 acres which boast spectacular mountain views and woodland trails. Picnic, take nature photos.  Surrounded by acres of freshly mowed hay and endless views of ancient mountains and hollows and verdant valleys, even the most jaded cynic will succumb to the beauty and majesty of nature.  Be prepared to experience lower blood pressure, slower heart rate, crystal clear thoughts.  Oh, I think I got carried away:)  You will, too!

Host lives 5 minutes from The River House.  Personal cell number will be shared with confirmed guests upon request.

Adwolfe is a picturesque pastoral valley in the lea of Flat Ridge section of Iron Mountain adjacent historic Mount Rogers.  The valley is dominated by the South Fork of the mighty Holston River, a state hatchery supported trout fishing destination.  The peace and quite may be overwhelming to city dwellers.  The sounds of rippling water over age-old rounded stones, the brilliance of starlight above an open meadow,  the smell of newly mowed hay, the tickle of dew-wet grass between your toes,  the taste of  grilled trout paired with your favorite Sauvignon Blanc...

Where ever your senses carry you, we hope your river house experience will culminate in life-long memories of fun and affection shared with family and friends.

sectionedDescription/space:
The River House is a gorgeous, quiet getaway perched sublimely on the banks of the South Fork of the mighty Holston River in the Adwolfe area of pastoral Smyth County, Virginia.  Nestled peacefully on five hundred feet of this state-hatchery supported trout stream, you’ll find your cares slipping into oblivion regardless of which riverside Adirondack chair or seat in the hot tub you pick.  Here time disappears as your rhythm changes with days dissolving into dusk, sunsets become sunrises and back again.  The sound of the river will resonate in your soul.  Perfectly placed on a private triangle of land, it commands hundreds of feet on the river.  And if you need anything you’re equidistant to Marion or Chilhowie, and even closer to Jefferson National Forest, Mount Rogers, and Grayson Highlands State Park.  

Once you’re acclimated to the serene sounds and sights of this constantly coursing stream, you’ll grow to love the subtle and supple quality of The River House.  Pulling into the driveway you’ll come first to the covered porch with several seating spaces for those times when the rain washes the valley.  Off to the right, along the riverbank is a raised deck, jutting out over the stream.  Further down the bank, are a row of inviting Adirondack chairs.  As I am in this narrative, you’ll find yourself irresistibly drawn to the outside because of its unique, natural power and beauty.  But come inside for a minute.  Let’s cross the threshold. sectionedDescription/summary: Natural splendor awaits you at The River House!  Perched on South Fork Holston River, a trout fly fishing mecca, it resonates tranquility.  The home is appointed by the finest in interior furniture and bedding.  Hike, bike, fly fish, tour nearby Mt Rogers, Grayson Highlands, Jefferson National Forest, VA Creeper Trail, or dine in historic Abingdon.  Take in small town vibe at First Friday in Marion.  Enjoy hot tub, ping pong, billiards, croquet, or lolling by the river.  Welcome!  Come enjoy!

additionalHouseRules: - The minimum age to rent is 21 years old. This home sits in a residential neighborhood. No loud noises or amplified music after 10pm. Please do not wear Muddy shoes in the house. Shoes can be left in the Mud Room or the porch. No Parties are allowed at this home. Maximum overnight occupancy is limited to 6 persons. Guests may have up additional visitors (not overnight). Please use caution with outdoor Firepit - do NOT leave embers burning. All fire pit embers must be extinguished and not left unattended.  Indoor fireplace is gas logs only.  Please park in the designated parking only.  Do not drive or park in the yard.  Absolutely no smoking inside of the house.  You are welcome to smoke outside but please dispose of butts properly - not in the yard.

primaryHost/about:
I have been in professional vacation rental management for 20 years - and before that the hotel industry.  I am formerly from Bluefield WV and this home sits on my family farm.  Materials for the home was farmed from the surrounding property, milled on my fathers sawmill and loving crafted.  The hard wood floors were reclaimed from an old local store from the early 1900's.  

I love to travel and when I do I look for the places where I can live like a local.  I want to step back, meet the people, eat the food and see what it really means to live "there".  

This home is nothing fancy.  If you are looking for upscale accommodations - this is not it.  This is my country retreat - a place I go to sit on the porch, listen to the frogs, build a fire outside or take a walk in the woods.
sectionedDescription/description:
Take a step back to the Heart of Appalachia on a farm that has been in my family for the last 75 years.  Sitting on 40 acres, convenient to the Hatfield and McCoy Trail System (8 miles away ) - this property allows you to enjoy the mountains without roughing it!

Enjoy horse shoes, corn hole, volleyball and hiking during your visit.  A propane grill is available for your use on the large back deck.  This property has been home to three generations of farmers who have loved the land and all it provided.  In the 1940's moonshine was still rampantly produced in Appalachia and this property was the site of several family still operations.  This home sits just 250 ft off the main roadway.

I will be available by phone for emergencies.  There is a caretaker that lives next door to the property and can assist in an emergency.

This location is very rural residential.  Although you have access to roam the recommended trails - please use caution as this is Appalachian woodlands.   Please do not cut any trees on property.  Firewood is provided for use in the outdoor fire pit.

No ATV riding is allowed on the property.  Trails are available to hikers and mountain bikers only.

You can drive an ATV along the shoulder of a highway or road for up to 10 miles at a speed of 25 miles per hour or less.  There is trail access within 8 miles of the property so you may park your trailers and ride the ATV to the trail head from this property.

You will have access to a fully equipped kitchen.  A regular coffee maker as well as a Keurig is available for your use.  There are TV's in the living room and Master bedroom.  These TV's are not cable enabled.  Wi-Fi is available.  Please note that the property does not have municipal water service - water is furnished by a well.  Air conditioning is available in all bedrooms.

Indoor fireplace is gas logs only.  Please park in the designated parking only.  Do not drive or park in the yard.  Absolutely no smoking inside of the house.  You are welcome to smoke outside but please dispose of butts properly - not in the yard.

primaryHost/about: I taught school for 13 years. I assist my husband with our rental property. I enjoy painting and fixing up property.
sectionedDescription/access:
Quail Rd is the first green state rd. sign to the left past Buffalo Trail Resort.
Go over the bridge and stay to the left. Stay straight.
Go to the very end of Quail Rd and the house has a red roof.
Trucks and trailers HAVE TO ENTER the upper left gravel driveway and turn left. This driveway loops downward. You drive to the lower end and backup your trailer into the graveled area in the corner. Two trucks and trailers can park in this corner. This will allow more room for trucks and trailers to park on the lower gravel. Large trailers over 30ft need to exit out the upper gravel road where you entered.
sectionedDescription/description:
Large spacious house for families and friends! Ride your ATV anywhere! No trailering to HM trails (Pocahontas 2 miles)  Indian Ridge, Pinnacle, Warrior, Spearhead & the Outlaw Trails! Lots of parking for many trailers! With all the ATVs going by on 71, there's peace and quiet on this nestled 4 acres up the hill at the end of Quail Rd.  Grill on the patio, stay warm in the family room with a gas fireplace, or sit by the fire pit. Restaurants, gas, grocery, car wash, and laundromat nearby.

Main Bedroom One has 1 king bed
Bedroom Two has 1 queen bed and 3 twin beds
Bedroom Three has 2 queen beds 
Bedroom Four has 1 queen bed and 1 twin bed
Bedroom Five has 1 queen 
The large family room is 20 x 30 and has a Lazyboy pullout sofa and there’s an Airbed available

Quail Rd is the first green state rd. sign to the left past Buffalo Trail Resort.
Go over the bridge and stay to the left. Stay straight.
Go to the very end of Quail Rd and the house has a red roof.
Trucks and trailers HAVE TO ENTER the upper left gravel driveway and turn left. This driveway loops downward. You drive to the lower end and backup your trailer into the graveled area in the corner. Two trucks and trailers can park in this corner. This will allow more room for trucks and trailers to park on the lower gravel. Large trailers over 30ft need to exit out the upper gravel road where you entered.

Guests can contact me through email, text or call my phone.

Children play in the road so drive slowly on Quail Rd. Sometimes the neighbor's little dog will come up the driveway. He is a friendly dog.

Trailers enter at the upper, left gravel driveway and exit at the lower driveway.  Stay on the gravel especially with wet weather because the ground is slippery on the hillside. Don't park in front of the house.  You can drive your ATV on the gravel behind the house and unload at the patio.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Please drive very slow on our road because of children in the neighborhood.
Stay off the grass as much as possible. It will become slippery in rainy/snowy conditions.
Bag all trash and take out to the wooden box. 
If you park your SxS behind the house, be careful not to run into the propane tank. 
Quiet hours are between 12pm and 6am.

sectionedDescription/summary: Large spacious house for families and friends! Ride your ATV anywhere! No trailering to HM trails (Pocahontas 2 miles)  Indian Ridge, Pinnacle, Warrior, Spearhead & the Outlaw Trails! Lots of parking for many trailers! With all the ATVs going by on 71, there's peace and quiet on this nestled 4 acres up the hill at the end of Quail Rd.  Grill on the patio, stay warm in the family room with a gas fireplace, or sit by the fire pit. Restaurants, gas, grocery, car wash, and laundromat nearby.

sectionedDescription/description:
Newly opened in downtown Pinevile, WV. Each room has different scene. Cool gel beds with all white comforters,
patagonon rosewood floors, granite counter tops, and top of the line accessories.  Drinks, snacks and desserts included in price of rooms. Lots of free parking. Easy access. Close to the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.  Quiet and friendly town. Nice view of the historical Wyoming County Courthouse and walking distance to Pinnacle Rock.

FREE WiFi, phones., parking. Easy Access. Handicap accessible
Free softdrinks, snacks and desserts. Feel right at home, if you get hungry, go to kitchen area and get a snack or pop some popcorn with softdrinks. Situated downtown Pineville, very quiet and friendly town. View of historical Wyoming County Courthouse and walking distance to Castle Rock. With 2 miles of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System. Plenty of parking for four wheelers and trailers.

On site employee til 9:00 p.m. and after hours emergency phone numbers provided. Maid service every day.

The Town of Pineville is very quiet and friendly town.  We have a
beautiful historical CourtHouse and a rock formation known as
Castle Rock. Pineville has access to the Hatfield McCoy Trail Head with 2 miles of town and four wheelers are allowed on the streets.  We have several restuarants to choose from. We are located downtown Pineville on Main Street.

Pineville has a park within walking distance, can hike Castle Rock and four wheelers and dirt bikes are allowed on the streets to get to the Hatfield McCoy Trails. No public transit is available. Host will be glad to take you where you need to go.

sectionedDescription/description:
Experience the beauty and culture of Southwest Virginia and enjoy the serenity of mountain life in beautiful Burkes Garden. This picturesque farming community sits in the highest valley in Virginia designated a Rural Historic District. Nestled beside the Parsonage Guest House, our cottage called "the Little House" is a vintage 50's cottage but with all the modern conveniences. With one queen and one  double bed it is perfect for 3 to 4 people or a couple's retreat.

The entire house is rented to one party at a time.

primaryHost/about:
I live for adventure and the great outdoors.  I want to share it with people and promote fun and adventure for others.  I will work with whoever to try and maximize each individual experience.  
I myself can't live without music. Hence you'll find a Bluetooth radio and speakers in the kitchen.   I attend many rock concerts each year, but I love all forms of music.  I love to cook, so you'll see my kitchen is set up for a cook.  
My style of travel is one were you would like to forget you have a cell phone!
My life motto since I was in high school is "Body, Mind, and soul"  Stay healthy, be smart, and be a good person!
sectionedDescription/access: You have access to the whole cabin and the trails on the property as well as the trail that goes to my brothers property that can be hiked or used by ATV's.  You also have access to the private community waterfall.
sectionedDescription/description:
18 acre Mountaintop cabin located in Bluefield, VA.  Beautiful views of the Jefferson National Forest.   Located in a gated community called Cove Creek which consists of many  large acre properties and very little development.  Several trails located directly on the property for atv riding and hiking.  The community is atv friendly and also boasts a beautiful creek containing brook trout and picturesque waterfall.  Winterplace , Hatfield Mccoy Trails, and Appalachian trail all only minutes away.

There are many things that make this cabin unique.  First, it's  a  1,200 sq foot 3 bedroom fully equipped cozy cabin property on 18 acres and has breathtaking mountaintop views and private access to our own trails for hiking and ATV'ing.  It's also centrally located to several well known mountain adventure places for White water rafting, Skiiing, ATV'ing, Hiking, and much more.  We moderately priced this so that families, couples, and friend groups alike can take advantage of it.  We have wood logs on the property for the fireplace that can be chopped and usually there is some already there.  While you feel like your in complete solitude at the top of the south side it's nice to know you have easy access to many amenities (grocery stores, restaurants, movie theater, etc) in the city of Bluefield, VA: located just minutes from the bottom of the northside of the mountain.

You have access to the whole cabin and the trails on the property as well as the trail that goes to my brothers property that can be hiked or used by ATV's.  You also have access to the private community waterfall.

We are in florida but have a property manager that is there for housing needs and/or emergencies.  I pride myself of communication and maximizing your experience.  Email or text me for any details anytime.

The cabin is located inside of a gated, sparsely populated community called cove creek.  Guests have access to the Creek which has trout and a beautiful waterfall.  The city of bluefield and Tazewell are mintues away and have many restaurants, grociery stores, and your basic amenities (there's a walmart...lol).  Also within driving distance are great adventure places like the Hatfield Mccoy ATV Trails, Appalachian Trail for hiking, Winter Place ski resort,  AceRaft for white water and many  parks with waterfalls like pipestem and the cascades.  The property itself is 18 acres and has several trails on it for hiking and atv'ing.

If it’s not snowing any car can be used to get up and down the mountain.  However if more then 2-4 inches snow is in the forecast we highly recommend 4 wheel drive.  Also, the driveway can be tough to get up and down if you aren’t use to driving in the mountains.  I can do it in a Prius as long as it’s not snowing but I have experience. Biggest hint is stick to the left side when going up. There is additional parking at the coldesac on top of the driveway if you want to play it safe

*It takes about 15-20 minutes to go up or down the mountain depending on your vehicle, what your towing, and comfortableness in mountain driving.  
*Hatfielld Mccoy trails are about 15-45 minutes from the bottom depending on which trailhead you access.  as of right now you can not access directly by ATV.
*WinterPlace is 39 miles from the bottom of the mountain and takes about 30 minutes.
*5 miles from Appalachian Trail and can actually view the mountain ridge it passes through from the cabin. 
*"The Back og the Dragon" Trail for motorcycles is close but might have to trailer bikes down the mountain depending if you can ride on the gravel roads.

*WinterPlace is 39 miles from the bottom of the mountain and takes about 30 minutes.
*5 miles from Appalachian Trail and can actually view the mountain ridge it passes through from the cabin. 
*"The Back og the Dragon" Trail for motorcycles is close but might have to trailer bikes down the mountain depending if you can ride on the gravel roads.
sectionedDescription/space: There are many things that make this cabin unique.  First, it's  a  1,200 sq foot 3 bedroom fully equipped cozy cabin property on 18 acres and has breathtaking mountaintop views and private access to our own trails for hiking and ATV'ing.  It's also centrally located to several well known mountain adventure places for White water rafting, Skiiing, ATV'ing, Hiking, and much more.  We moderately priced this so that families, couples, and friend groups alike can take advantage of it.  We have wood logs on the property for the fireplace that can be chopped and usually there is some already there.  While you feel like your in complete solitude at the top of the south side it's nice to know you have easy access to many amenities (grocery stores, restaurants, movie theater, etc) in the city of Bluefield, VA: located just minutes from the bottom of the northside of the mountain.
sectionedDescription/summary: 18 acre Mountaintop cabin located in Bluefield, VA.  Beautiful views of the Jefferson National Forest.   Located in a gated community called Cove Creek which consists of many  large acre properties and very little development.  Several trails located directly on the property for atv riding and hiking.  The community is atv friendly and also boasts a beautiful creek containing brook trout and picturesque waterfall.  Winterplace , Hatfield Mccoy Trails, and Appalachian trail all only minutes away.
sectionedDescription/transit: If it’s not snowing any car can be used to get up and down the mountain.  However if more then 2-4 inches snow is in the forecast we highly recommend 4 wheel drive.  Also, the driveway can be tough to get up and down if you aren’t use to driving in the mountains.  I can do it in a Prius as long as it’s not snowing but I have experience. Biggest hint is stick to the left side when going up. There is additional parking at the coldesac on top of the driveway if you want to play it safe

primaryHost/about: Jodina and I live in central Indiana. We enjoy traveling to new places and sharing those experiences with our kids.
sectionedDescription/access: Full access to the entire home and it’s property with exception of cleaners closet.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is "Not Just Another Trail House”.   This fully remodeled home is designed for riders that want more than a bunkhouse and prefer a more intimate setting like being in your own home.  This home is less than a half mile to the Devil Anse trail head and 1 mile from downtown Matewan. Fix your meals in the stocked kitchen or on the Blackstone Griddle, or eat at one of Matewan's restaurants! This home is designed for a maximum  6 guests. Please request host approval for anything different.

3 bedrooms - 4 beds
2 bathrooms
Kitchen, living, dining, and laundry rooms
Large parking area for 3 vehicles with trailers.

Full access to the entire home and it’s property with exception of cleaners closet.

We make every effort to be available for questions via the app and by text message.

This area of Matewan is known as “Hatfield Bottom”

No need to trailer, ride your SXS everywhere!

Parking notes;  Updated to reflect the new gravel parking area. If you have 3 trailers we recommend 2 of them being under 20' depending on tow vehicle length. If you have multiple longer Rigs or just want more space, there is also public parking for trucks/trailers in town. This would allow for parking longer rigs and just driving your SXS / ORV to the house.

name: Foxtail Orchards - "The Fox Den"
photos/15/caption: Beautiful Mountains!!
photos/16/caption: A sunset you will never forget! Romantic Getaway!
primaryHost/about: Rental Cabins in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, located along the historic Rt.16 Back of the Dragon, Tazewell County,VA. Paved road access!
sectionedDescription/access: Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, mini bar and charcoal grill, microwave, mini fridge, and hot plate.

There is also a second and a third rental just above this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "Hangar 22" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.

We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.

Enjoy the sounds and setting of living in the country.

Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi.

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or and owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

The Fox Den is named and themed (decor) after Virginia State Trooper Andrew D. Fox.  Andrew was a native to Tazewell County and a graduate from Tazewell High School.  The cabin was built and decorated in conjunction with his family.  This is only meant to remind visitors to not forget the sacrifice our first responders make keeping us safe, and also teaches you history of Tazewell County, VA.

name: Red Dirt ATV Resort
sectionedDescription/access: You and your guests will have full access to the entire property including the pool, the kids play area and the additional lot for parking.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 3 bed 2 bath home sits right in the heart of atv country. You will have access to the Spearhead trails of Va and the Hatfield and Mccoy trails in Wv. After a long day of riding you can come back and relax by the pool or hang out inside with cable tv and WiFi. This home can easily house 10 people with room to spare. We also have a children’s play area and lots of parking 2 1/2 acres attached so you will have plenty of room for your trailers.  $500 Refundable Damage deposit required.

Along with having three trails systems to choose from, you will have full access to our pool area that includes outside seating and a grill.

You and your guests will have full access to the entire property including the pool, the kids play area and the additional lot for parking.

We want to thank you for staying with us.  Message us and we will answer you as quickly as possible.

Spearhead Trails, Hatfield McCoy Trails and the Pocahontas Trail Head

Parking available at the house and additional parking above the house. There is a sharp turn on Dunn rd. Largest truck and trailer up hill is 24’ enclosed behind a long bed dually.

photos/9/caption: Full kitchen.  Stove, microwave, dishwasher, pots/pans, crockpot, toaster, blender...
photos/15/caption: Enjoy the sunrise on the porch.
photos/17/caption: Camping chairs can be taken out to use at the fire pit.

primaryHost/about: Will and Amy. Faith, Family, Farming.
sectionedDescription/access: You will have the entire cabin to yourself. You can go for a walk, enjoy the hot tub, grill out, roast marshmallows over the fire pit, or just rock on the front porch and take it easy.
sectionedDescription/description:
You will relax and reconnect in this beautiful valley nestled in the Southwest Virginia mountains. Sit on the porch and soak up those mountain views. Relax in the hot tub and count the stars. Reconnect with your spouse as you unplug from the hustle and bustle. Rest, laugh, enjoy! 

The cabin is located on a working family farm. You can purchase beef, pork, and chicken to cook while you’re here or bring a cooler and take some home.

Take a break from life. Get away. Come relax in solitude or with your spouse. Reconnect with nature. Breathe in that fresh air. Observe wildlife and get a taste of life on the farm.

The cabin completely private, but if you’d like to visit with family or friends there is another cabin located on the farm too. Check out our other listing for Valley View Cabin. You cannot see the other cabin, but it is located a couple hundred yards away.

You will have the entire cabin to yourself. You can go for a walk, enjoy the hot tub, grill out, roast marshmallows over the fire pit, or just rock on the front porch and take it easy.

We are available by phone (call or text) if you need anything.  We can offer suggestions of things to do while here (folder of information in the cabin). If we’re around we’d be happy to show you around the farm.

We are about a mile off of Hwy 16 (Back of the Dragon). About 10 miles from Hungry Mother State Park (hiking, fishing, beach swimming area...). We’re 25 minutes from Marion where there is an adorable Main Street with shops and eateries.  We are about 45 minutes from Abingdon (Barter Theatre, antique shopping, dining, winery...).

We are not near any public transportation.

We are about 25 minutes away from town. So, you may want to plan to stop at the grocery store on your way in. There are plenty of great restaurants in Marion. (We have a list of restaurants and activities to do while here.) FYI: Many of the Marion shops/restaurants are CLOSED on Mondays!

On our farm we raise and sell pastured beef, chicken, and pork. If you plan to cook while you are here let us know and you can order some homegrown meat ahead of time and we will have it waiting in your fridge. (Sausage or bacon for breakfast, steaks, hamburger, chicken breast, pork chops...) Bring a cooler so you can take some beef, chicken, and pork back home with you. You can see what's available and order directly through our website www.oldrichvalleyfarm dot com.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Hot tubs are very expensive.  We ask that you read and follow all rules of the hot tub (listed in the cabin) to make sure it doesn’t get damaged.  

This is a working farm. We ask that you are very careful around the animals and stay off of all farm equipment.

We are  less than 10 min. away from beautiful Lake Stevens where you can enjoy your boat, kayaking, hiking , or the beach.  During the winter months we welcome guest who enjoy skiing and  tubing at Winter Place .

name: Stay @Tin Roof! Clean 3Bed 2Bath near trailheads
photos/15/caption: Master King
photos/16/caption: Master King
photos/23/caption: 2nd Full Bathroom
primaryHost/about: I am a realtor from coastal NC. I love traveling and do so often!
sectionedDescription/access: Entire home , entire paved driveway,  plus additional rock driveway with  fire pit and grill
sectionedDescription/description:
The whole group will enjoy easy access to everything from this centrally located place. The Tin Roof is located near the Hatfield McCoy trails where you have multiple trailheads to choose from. No need to load your trailer, ride your ATV directly from this location. Tin Roof is 37 miles from Winterplace for the ski bunnies!  Multiple lakes for a day in the kayak , hiking trails to get in your steps , and several restaurants to enjoy;  all located close by! Two living rooms and plenty of space!

Three trucks and Three trailers ( depending on length) will fit in driveway. All three bedrooms have large beds and room for all your gear! Two living rooms  2 Tv’s and plenty of eating space at the kitchen island or dining table. A full laundry room, front  deck with outdoor eating area, and a fire pit in the backyard for evening relaxing!  For your convenience there is a permanent charcoal grill. The Keurig and crockpot are a few of the extra additions to the kitchen that will make your stay easy!  Basic cable in the living room and smart TV in the den . Brand new mattresses , furniture installed September 2021.  Towels , Hand Towels , washcloths, and all bed linens included.  Fully stocked kitchen with dishes , cups , and cooking utensils.

Entire home , entire paved driveway,  plus additional rock driveway with  fire pit and grill

Fee free to message with any questions or suggestions!

Tin Roof is located in an ATV friendly town where you can drive your ATV to restaurants , gas stations and trailheads.  Located minutes from Various trail heads as well as restaurants. We are also near Bluefield University and a short trip to the VA line . As well as a short drive to a nearby airport.

While public transportation may be sparse, vehicles, ATV’s and hiking are no issues to get around.

This property is adjacent to  a main road HWY 52, and less than a mile from Lorton Lick rd, we also live off a small quiet road. We ask that you respect our neighbors and refrain from parties or disruptive behavior. You can access HWY 52 from our front yard with an atv , please stay to the left of the rock/boulders which mark our property line. Toilet paper , paper towels , shampoo and soap are provided. Coffee , sugar and honey for your first morning will also be available . Laundry detergent, dish detergent, and sponges. Ready for your arrival !

sectionedDescription/description:
We invite you to kick back and enjoy a taste of the country life while visiting beautiful Appalacia.  One hundred year old farm house that is newly renovated on 16 acres of Appalachian hardwood forest and pasture land and situated just 2.5 miles from the Hatfield and McCoy Trail System and 30 minutes to Winterplace.  Located centrally between the cities Bluefield and Princeton, while being conveniently located two miles from Bluewell and just six miles from historic Bramwell, WV.

Beautiful 16 acres for wooded landscape cover with chicory plants which Bluefield was named after.

photos/10/caption: Spacious back porch is perfect for relaxing or dining

primaryHost/about: I moved to West Virginia about 15 years ago. I love the beauty of this state with its mountains and rivers. I also love the old houses in Bluefield that were built a century ago to accommodate all those who prospered by working for the railroad, which was essential to the transport of coal. I undertook a major renovation of the home that contains the apartment we call the Railroad Express Guest Suite. The house has good bones and beautiful hardwood floors and was worth the effort!
sectionedDescription/access: Parking area, backyard, back porch (patio) and the entire suite is accessible to guests. The laundry room is down a shared staircase but is exclusive to the suite.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy the king bed in this newly renovated private guest suite with hardwood floors, ceiling fans, armoire, dresser and nightstands. Eat-in kitchen has microwave, fridge & induction cooktop. Porch is perfect for dining or relaxing. Convenient to Hatfield-McCoy Trails & historic Bramwell. RR enthusiasts will love Bluefield, a town that flourished when Norfolk & Western came to town in the 1880s. List of railroad museums, landmarks and depots can be made available upon request at check in.

High-speed wifi is provided.  Two windows, with screens, can be opened. The king mattress and pillows have allergy protective covers. An air mattress is available for children accompanying adults. Contact host if more than two guests are involved. Off street parking is available. Keypad entry.

Parking area, backyard, back porch (patio) and the entire suite is accessible to guests. The laundry room is down a shared staircase but is exclusive to the suite.

Host is nearby. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to ask! On longer stays, we will be in to clean the suite at least once every two weeks.

Are you a railroad enthusiast? Bluefield prospered as a center for the railroad transport of coal.  Norfolk Southern still maintains an office at 800 Princeton Avenue in downtown Bluefield. The city offers many vantage points for photography, with spots where you can pull off the road and take spectacular photos as the trains rumble by. Of interest to children: The Ridgerunner train leaves on a milelong loop, from noon to 6 p.m. on weekends, from Bluefield City Park from April through September, but be careful: That train whistle is loud! For researchers and scholars, a wealth of information is tucked away in the Eastern Regional Coal Archives, which are attached to the Craft Memorial Library in Bluefield, including railroad memorabilia, maps, company records and historic photographs and documents.

Both Bluefield, West Virginia, and Bluefield, Virginia, have extensive bus service. The driveway is large enough to accommodate a trailer. 
ATV parking may be arranged off-site.

Contact host for parking instructions and keypad code.

additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

name: Coaldale Condo
photos/4/caption: Large patio firepit, grill, tables chairs.
photos/15/caption: FWH front veiw
primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 2br 1ba unit is located directly across from the Hatfield McCoys Pocahontas Trailhead/Visitor Center at Coaldale WV and offers Direct Trail side access. Ground floor entrance, plenty of parking, great for couples, small groups and Families.

This main floor unit features 2 bedroom, 1 full bath with a  kitchen. It sleeps 4, with 4 twin XL beds and up to 5 with a pull out sofa bed and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot, hotplate, full size fridge, microwave, basically everything you need. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. Rent the lock-out unit Miners Den, for larger groups to add 6 more beds and 1 more bath.

Fire pit, grill, picnic table, security cameras and Trailside accommodations right on the Pocahontas trailhead. Ride all four Hatfield McCoy southern trails and Virginia Spearhead trails too all from FWH ! Over 500 Miles of OFF Road Heaven! We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.

Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.

When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.

Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.

Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

name: A Bit Of Heaven Rental:Calvary House Warrior Trail
photos/1/caption: Perfect for families or small groups. Cozy, clean, comfortable relaxing area for after you have played on the trails all day.
photos/2/caption: Spacious living room with 65" TV.  Streaming firestick. High speed internet and wifi.
photos/3/caption:
Well stocked eat in kitchen with pots pans, dishes, utensils. Also has a crockpot,  mixer, and a toaster.
Perfect for preparing a meal when you return home.
photos/5/caption:
Bedroom #1 features 2 comfy Queen size beds with clean linens and extra blankets. Attached Jack and Jill Bathroom. 
Clothes hanging rod with hangers.
photos/6/caption:
Bedroom #2 features 2 comfy Queen size beds with clean linens and extra blankets. Attached Jack and Jill Bathroom.
Clothes hanging rod with hangers.
photos/7/caption: The main bathroom is a Jack and Jill bathroom located between the two bedrooms. Fully stocked with towels and anything you may need during your stay.
photos/8/caption: 5' deep tub with ceramic tile shower. Clean towels are also proviided.
photos/10/caption: Laundry area with washer and dryer.
photos/13/caption: Relax under the stars at night and enjoy time with your friends and family around the fire pit.
photos/15/caption:
This house is a duplex. This unit sleeps 8, you can also book the Calvary Suite with it for larger groups. With both units will sleep a total of 14.
Fenced in private yard.
photos/16/caption: Plenty of parking for trucks and trailers. Pull through driveway off of back alley.
photos/18/caption: Electronic lock for fast and efficient check in
photos/20/caption: Road in the picture is Warriormine Rd. Located one street over Calvary. House is circled in blue.
photos/23/caption: Rick and I own A Scoop of Heaven. The best icecream in town. Stop by and say hey and we will give you 10% off.
photos/24/caption: The Owl serves inexpensive but tasty breakfast, lunch and dinner 6 days a week. Open 8am-8pm and 12 noon-5:30 on Sundays
photos/25/caption: Located directly around the corner of the Warrior trailhead office. Sells HMT passes as well as souvenirs.  Open from 9am-2 daily.
photos/26/caption: Berwind Lake boating, and trout fishing
primaryHost/about:
My husband and I relocated to West Virginia in 2014 from Ohio. We run a ministry (A New Beginning) located downtown. 
We opened A Bit of Heaven Rental in Sept. 2018 when the trails opened in our area. We currently have 5 units we rent. We also opened A Scoop of Heaven Icecream in 2021.
We live local across the street from The Calvary House and are available if you need us. We love the small town atmosphere that our town has to offer and the friendly folks that live here.
I love to cook and spend time with our family and grandbabies. 
We enjoy meeting new people, having cookouts in the summer, and going to the lake.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guest has full access to the entire house with a large back yard. Over flow Parking lot across the street for parking trucks with large trailers.
sectionedDescription/description:
Take a step back in time. Rural America. Before fast food chains, and even before Walmart...
Surrounded by mountains and located just a stones throw away (1/4 mile) from Hatfield McCoy's trail head Warrior and many outlaw trails. Enjoy High Rocks and Wilmore Dam, or perhaps a day at Berwind Lake trout fishing, or hiking.
Easy access to restaurants, gas, and grocery store. We are an ATV friendly town and house is located in a friendly Quiet neighborhood with plenty of parking.

The house features 2 bedroom, 2 bath full house that sleeps 8 comfortable. Living room, eat in kitchen and laundry area. The kitchen is fully equipped with dishes, utensils, coffee maker, toaster anything you need. 
Fully equipped with towels, and clean linens are on all the beds. Also a wonderful porch with table, chairs and a propane grill to enjoy the outdoors.
The main bathroom is a Jack and Jill bath between the two bedrooms. 
Living room has a flat screen TV with a fire stick and WIFI.
Like us on Facebook to stay up to date on what's going on in the area.
This house has a suite ( duplex) that can be rented for larger groups.

Guest has full access to the entire house with a large back yard. Over flow Parking lot across the street for parking trucks with large trailers.

Our mission is to make your stay at The Calvary House as enjoyable as possible. 
 We are locally owned and located directly accross the street up on the hill if you need anything. 

 We respect your privacy . We'll give you the space that you want or the help you may need.

We are located around the corner from Warrior Trailhead office. Warrior Trail has direct connections to Pinnacle Creek, Indian Ridge and Pocahontas Trail. 
Located off RT 16 part of the 91 mile Head of the Dragon Motorcycle Ride in McDowell County. Surrounded by beautiful scenery.
 
Quiet Neighborhood in a welcoming small town with all the conveniences.  Restaurants, Grocery Store and gas station and car wash.

War is an ATV friendly town as well as the surrounding communities. 
You can ride in town and directly to the Trailhead.

Day Trips in the area:
86 Miles to New River Gorge
64 Miles to Beckley Exibition Coal Miner Youth Museum

** Check out our other Listings**
Calvary Suite
The Cove House
Cove Suite

name: Storybook Cottage with a View
photos/0/caption: View of the garden at the end of July- gourds and zinnias are growing!
photos/1/caption: An aerial view of the Storybook Cottage--- above the porch, a gnome sits in his rocking chair by candlelight watching over the cottage garden.
photos/2/caption: Above the porch, a gnome sits in his rocking chair by candlelight watching over the cottage garden.
photos/3/caption: Another view of the cottage- there is a seating area in front the cottage (in addition to the private back deck.)
photos/4/caption: View of the cottage garden - mid-July. Cucumbers are ready and tomatoes are green. Radishes have been canned, wind-fallen apple jelly has been made, and zucchini bread is being baked! Yum!
photos/5/caption: This is a view of the fire pit and the barn.  In the far left of the picture, you can see our largest grape arbor (muscadine grapes.)  We also have concord grapes here.
photos/6/caption: Looking through the front entrance to the cottage, into the cottage garden.  This is taken at the end of July- the gourds are growing well,  in addition to the morning glories and moon flowers!
photos/7/caption: Aerial view of the cottage. The pond is visible in the rear and there is a seating area in front of the cottage as well.
photos/8/caption: This is the "mudroom" - a place to unpack and take off your shoes.
photos/9/caption: This is the bedroom-- the view immediately as walking in from the mudroom.

photos/31/caption: These are the chickens. (They're smiling - honest.)

photos/37/caption: Another view of the cottage.

photos/39/caption: The Storybook Cottage does not have a key box or a code for entrance.  Instead, skeleton keys are used for every door.
photos/40/caption: Geraniums are growing in pots on the table.  Basil is growing in the planter on the porch.
photos/41/caption: Sunflowers are in bloom, alongside tomatoes and a baby grape vine, in the front yard at the Holliday Castle!

photos/61/caption: Our pet turkey, Pumpkin. He's a sweetie!
