name: Sleeps 20 Ski In/Out at Highlander 1
photos/1/caption: Highlander 1 on the right and Highlander 2 on the left. View of drop off area between the houses.
photos/3/caption: Huge table for family meals, meetings and games.
photos/10/caption: Ground floor kitchen and dining area
photos/13/caption: 1st & second floor bathrooms with same layout
photos/17/caption: Rent twin cabins for large groups. H2 in fore ground H1 in background
photos/18/caption: Raft adventures (for all levels) on the New River and the Gauley River.
photos/20/caption: Nearby New River Gorge Eastern US Climbing Mecca!!
sectionedDescription/access:
Guests have access to the whole house with keyless entry thorough doors on both the first and second level. 
Code provided prior to arrival. You will receive arrival information approximately one week before your stay and it will be available in the app.
sectionedDescription/description:
Highlander 1 - Sleeps up to 22 people! 6 Bedrooms, 3 bathrooms 2 Kitchens & living rooms with plenty of room to spreadout.
Located off of I-77 at Winterplace Ski Resort. 
Slopeside, ski-in/out in the winter. Close to rafting, climbing, hiking and biking in the New River National Park and several WV State Parks.
35-40 minutes to the New River Gorge area and super cool town of Fayetteville, WV. 20 minutes to Pipestem State Park,  Beckley or Princeton.

Enjoy starlit nights by the fire pit, grilling on the back deck, and comfortable space for you and all of your friends and family. 
This cabin can sleep up to 22 people.

Slopeside in the winter (ski in and ski out) and easy access to the best of West Virginia's recreation areas in the Spring, Summer, and Fall.

Feels like a secluded cabin in the woods, but has the convenience of a 2 minute drive to the highway. 

Highlander 1 sleeps up to 22 in beds (with 2 people in fulls & queens). We no longer have the pull out couches and limit the group to 24 people maximum.
Level 1: 
One bedroom with a queen bed 
One bedroom with a queen and full bed
Kitchen, living room, bathroom, washer/dryer

Level 2: 
One queen bedroom 
One bedroom with one queen and one twin
Kitchen, living room, bathroom, washer/dryer

Level 3: One bedroom with two full beds
One bedroom with two queen and two twin beds (has opening to cathedral ceiling above living room)

Guests have access to the whole house with keyless entry thorough doors on both the first and second level. 
Code provided prior to arrival. You will receive arrival information approximately one week before your stay and it will be available in the app.

Our Hospitality manager Linnea, is available during business hours 8am-6 pm if you need any assistance during your stay. You may reach her at 

If it is outside business hours you may contact me through the app.

This cabin is located at Winterplace Ski Resort - bustling in the winter, secluded and peaceful in the spring, summer and fall. Easy access to hiking, biking, and world class climbing and rafting in the New River Gorge. Pipestem State Park and Little Beaver State Park within 15 minutes. Beckley and Princeton within 30 minutes.

There are two cabins, side by side, identical to each other. Each sleeps up to 22 people.
PLEASE NOTE:
1. In the winter (high busy season), bed linens are provided, but TOWELS are not.  Please bring any bath towels you may need. Bath towels are provided off season but ONLY indoor bath towels. Please bring towels for any outdoor activities or use. Missing or damaged towels will be charged to the guest from the deposit. 

2. Starter supplies such as TP, paper towels, shampoo and trash bags are provided. Please bring your own supply of toilet paper, paper towels, trash bags, dish soap, toiletries, laundry detergent, etc. to have enough supplies for your stay.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Minimum age to rent is 25 years old.  Maximum guests are 22

No Smoking on property. Refundable deposit will not be returned if there is any sign of smoking or cigarette butts are left on the property. 

No events, parties, kegs or excessive drinking allowed. This is not the house for you if you intend to have a party. You may be asked to leave and no refund will be provided if there is an event, party or excessive drinking occurs. There are cameras monitoring the home. 

No pets allowed in the homes or on the property during your stay. 

Any issues with the house must be reported upon arrival. 
All checkout procedures must be completed before leaving.
Any damage or issues that occurred during your stay must be reported before checking out.

Any disregard for house rules may result in termination of the rental agreement and guests will be asked to leave before the end of the scheduled stay and will not be provided any refund.
sectionedDescription/interaction:
Our Hospitality manager Linnea, is available during business hours 8am-6 pm if you need any assistance during your stay. You may reach her at 

If it is outside business hours you may contact me through the app.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: This cabin is located at Winterplace Ski Resort - bustling in the winter, secluded and peaceful in the spring, summer and fall. Easy access to hiking, biking, and world class climbing and rafting in the New River Gorge. Pipestem State Park and Little Beaver State Park within 15 minutes. Beckley and Princeton within 30 minutes.
sectionedDescription/notes:
There are two cabins, side by side, identical to each other. Each sleeps up to 22 people.
PLEASE NOTE:
1. In the winter (high busy season), bed linens are provided, but TOWELS are not.  Please bring any bath towels you may need. Bath towels are provided off season but ONLY indoor bath towels. Please bring towels for any outdoor activities or use. Missing or damaged towels will be charged to the guest from the deposit. 

2. Starter supplies such as TP, paper towels, shampoo and trash bags are provided. Please bring your own supply of toilet paper, paper towels, trash bags, dish soap, toiletries, laundry detergent, etc. to have enough supplies for your stay.
sectionedDescription/space:
Enjoy starlit nights by the fire pit, grilling on the back deck, and comfortable space for you and all of your friends and family. 
This cabin can sleep up to 22 people.

Slopeside in the winter (ski in and ski out) and easy access to the best of West Virginia's recreation areas in the Spring, Summer, and Fall.

Feels like a secluded cabin in the woods, but has the convenience of a 2 minute drive to the highway. 

Highlander 1 sleeps up to 22 in beds (with 2 people in fulls & queens). We no longer have the pull out couches and limit the group to 24 people maximum.
Level 1: 
One bedroom with a queen bed 
One bedroom with a queen and full bed
Kitchen, living room, bathroom, washer/dryer

Level 2: 
One queen bedroom 
One bedroom with one queen and one twin
Kitchen, living room, bathroom, washer/dryer

Level 3: One bedroom with two full beds
One bedroom with two queen and two twin beds (has opening to cathedral ceiling above living room)
sectionedDescription/summary:
Highlander 1 - Sleeps up to 22 people! 6 Bedrooms, 3 bathrooms 2 Kitchens & living rooms with plenty of room to spreadout.
Located off of I-77 at Winterplace Ski Resort. 
Slopeside, ski-in/out in the winter. Close to rafting, climbing, hiking and biking in the New River National Park and several WV State Parks.
35-40 minutes to the New River Gorge area and super cool town of Fayetteville, WV. 20 minutes to Pipestem State Park,  Beckley or Princeton.

We prefer no shoes in the apartment.

name: Spacious One Bedroom Located in Welch
priceDetails/0/value: $10 per night after the first guest
primaryHost/about: My wife Elise and I have lived in McDowell County since November 2015. We moved from New England to help the community through outreach and ministry and we've fallen in love with the area and the people here. We love to go for walks, listen to music, travel anywhere & everywhere, and meet new friends.
sectionedDescription/access: Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. The apartment is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy our newly remodeled apartment in the heart of historic Welch. This unit was designed with the traveling professional in mind; quiet, easily accessible and comfortable.

Our spacious one bedroom is the perfect getaway for travelers to the area. Whether you are a nurse, teacher, other working professional or are just looking to stay in Welch, this is the place for you. 

We offer optimal Wi-Fi and have a television with a Roku for your viewing pleasure. 

A fully equipped kitchen and pleasant dining room will cater to any culinary needs.

Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. The apartment is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.

There is truly no other place like Welch, WV. Once a booming coal town, Welch now has a much smaller population. Welch and McDowell County have garnered much attention over the past decade. The New York Times and CNN have published and produced different pieces highlighting the county and its unique way of life that still exists here in the mountains. Even the late chef, author, and documentarian, Anthony Bourdain spent time filming in McDowell and was quoted saying it was one of the most unique places he had traveled to.
 https://www.wvpress.org/breaking-news/anthony-bourdain-mcdowell-best-place-earth/

You can see McDowell County's episode on season 11 of Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown.

This home is within walking distance to a gas station, a library, town hall and the movie theatre. The Jack Caffrey Arts and Culture Center is a short distance away. Small shops, grocery stores and restaurants are all one to five miles away. There is a Bluefield Area Transit Bus route that runs through town on weekdays.

There are stairs leading up to the house and upon entry, there are stairs leading to the unit.

Please leave beds unmade.
We prefer no shoes in the apartment.

name: Parker House
sectionedDescription/description:
The Parker House is a Beautifully decorated 1950's era home with amazing detail.  
It is 3 bedrooms and 2 full baths with 1 half bath, a living room kitchen dining room, and a back deck that leads to a shared courtyard. 
It is located in the Heart of Hintons Historic district, a gateway to The New River Gorge Nation Park.
You can enjoy the quiet getaway or can venture out to many close-by attractions such as Sandstone Falls, Winterplace Ski resort, water rafting, hiking trails and so much more.

There is an outside deck that leads to the shared courtyard, it has beautiful landscaping and is perfect for sipping that morning cup of coffee on. 
In the shared courtyard you will also find a gas grill that is ready to be fired up at all times and enjoyed by your family.

We are a non-hosted Bed and Breakfast that utilizes self-check-in. The day before arrival a hospitality specialist will call you and go over your check-in instructions and then will send you check-in codes.  We are available at all times if you need something so don't hesitate to call.
You will get a complimentary breakfast that is self-serve, cereal, oatmeal, milk, juice, water, and coffee.

The neighborhood is very quiet and surrounded by beautiful historical architecture, Perfect for an evening stroll. 
There are several small shops and a few restaurants within walking distance of the Parker house. 
If you want to venture out further there are many close-by attractions as well as 2 state parks and you are minutes away from public water access points. Hinton is surrounded by 3 rivers, The Greenbrier River, The New River, and Bluestone lake.

Hinton is very rural there are no buses or uber in our town at this time.

additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.
sectionedDescription/description:
For the ultimate in space and privacy, "The Whole House" accommodates groups of up to 24 people with all the features of home. Enjoy private access to our outdoor swimming pool & direct access over 500 mi. Hatfield-McCoy Trails and Spearhead Trails!

The Whole House is all three of our units - the larger Blizzards Roost, and two smaller units the Coaldale Condo and Miners Den(ADA) - available to rent as a group and offered at a discounted rate. The top two floors (The Blizzards Roost) features 3 bedrooms and 2 full baths with a full kitchen, dining room, sun room, living room and a washer/dryer, range and dish washer. It has two HD TV's and a stereo connected to HD service with Wi-Fi coverage through-out the house. The lower floor units (Coaldale Condo and Miners Den) are connected by a lock-out door and feature a combined 4 bedrooms and 2 full baths 1ADA,, a full kitchen and a half kitchen, a stacked washer/dryer unit and three TVs, one is a smart TV. All three units are fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker's and crock pot's, stove/oven or hotplate, full size fridge's, microwave's - basically everything you need to feel right at home. Beds include 3 queens, 12 twin XL, 1 full, 2 twin, and 3 couch beds. Corn-hole and freezbie-golf, (one station) on site. Plenty of parking for the big rigs too! Great WiFi!

Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.

When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.

Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.

Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

sectionedDescription/access:
Every group has a private entrance, living room, kitchen, and bathroom area, as well as a back deck or porch.
The house has a keyless entry. Code provided prior to arrival. Site manager will be in contact via text with arrival information approximately the week before your stay.
sectionedDescription/description:
Complete anti-viral scrub down before every group.

Highlander 2 - 6 bedrooms! Sleeps 20 people.
Located off of Rt. 77 at Winterplace Ski Resort. Slopeside, ski-in, ski-out in the winter. 
Feels like a secluded cabin in the middle of the woods, but has the convenience of a 2 minute drive to the highway. 
30-45 minute drive to the New River Gorge Recreation area and Fayetteville. Less than 30 min. to Pipestem State Park, Beckley or Princeton.

This cabin is awesome for large groups. There are 6 bedrooms and sleeping space for more than 20 people.
Slopeside (ski-in, ski-out) in the winter, and easy access to the best of West Virginia's outdoor recreation in the Spring, Summer, and Fall.

Highlander 2 sleeps up to 20 in beds. (with 2 people in fulls & queens). We no longer have the pull out couches and limit the group to 24 Max
Level 1: 
One bedroom with a queen bed 
One bedroom with a queen and full bed
Kitchen, living room, bathroom, washer/dryer

Level 2:
One queen bedroom 
One bedroom with one queen and one twin
Kitchen, living room, bathroom, washer/dryer

Level 3: 
One bedroom with two full beds
One bedroom with one queen, one full and one twin bed

Every group has a private entrance, living room, kitchen, and bathroom area, as well as a back deck or porch.
The house has a keyless entry. Code provided prior to arrival. Site manager will be in contact via text with arrival information approximately the week before your stay.

This cabin feels like it's a million miles from anywhere, but it's an easy 2 minute drive to the highway. 15 minutes to Pipestem or Little Beaver State Park, 20 minutes to Beckley or Princeton, and approximately 35 minutes to Fayetteville and the New River Gorge area.

There are two cabins side by side, private, but able to be rented together to accommodate really big groups. The cabins identical to each other. Each sleeps 20- 22 people in beds.
PLEASE NOTE:
1. In the winter, linens are provided, but TOWELS and other paper products/toiletries ARE NOT. Please bring your own towels, toilet paper, paper towels, dish soap, toiletries, laundry detergent, etc. if you stay December through March.
2. In the spring, summer, and fall this cabin is approximately 45 minutes from the New River Gorge Recreation Area.

primaryHost/about: Professional who loves to travel!
sectionedDescription/description:
The lodge at Winterhaven is perfect for church groups, scout groups, or other large groups of people that are looking for slope side accommodations at Winterplace Ski Resort.

The lodge has enough room to sleep up to 32 people in bunk beds, couches, mattresses, and other cushions.  

There is also a large kitchen where meals can be prepared.

Please bring air mattresses... Or whatever else you want to sleep on. 

It does not have the amenities or feel of a condo.

There are no sheets or towels.

We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to various insurance sites for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsureMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.

name: Buffalo Mountain Mountain Retreat in Williamson
photos/15/caption: Dining/Kitchen
photos/23/caption: Master Bath
sectionedDescription/description:
Entire large 4 bedroom home completely covered in wood. Perfect for a large group of riders and even multiple families.  Has large pool area with covered deck, rear deck and front porch.   Very large bar and game room area on far side of home away from all but master bedroom. 

Bedroom 1 - 1 King 1 twin daybed with pullout twin trindle. Sleeps 4
Bedroom 2 - 2 twin daybeds with twin trindles. Sleeps 4
Bedroom 3 - 1 King bed. Sleeps 2
Bedroom 4 - 1 King bed with 2 Twin beds. Sleeps 4

Plenty of street parking in front and behind home for trailers.  With a 3 car covered carport.   Plenty of street lighting and very safe area.  

whole city is ATV friendly so you can unload and ride around and right to the trailhead  1/4 mile away.

additionalHouseRules:
Pets require prior approval and $200 pet fee
No pets on carpeting or furniture
No smoking in the house
No excessive alcohol or drug use on the property.  The State Police K9 unit lives next door.
Strip all USED linens and put them in basement before checkout.
Empty trash before checkout - bins are out in the shed.
No shooting on the premises without prior written permission and a qualified range safety officer present.
Personal ATVs are allowed and encouraged to explore the property.
No hunting on the property.
No candles or fires inside the house except for in the fireplace
dogs must be kenneled at night and may not be left alone in the house.
any damage or maintenance issues should be immediately reported to the caretaker
No tampering with or covering outdoor security cameras
Please do not park on the front lawn or in the back yard.

name: Maple Fork Lodge

photos/16/caption: Basement Bedroom 2

sectionedDescription/description:
Kids love it!  This secluded mountain lodge lets your group enjoy fishing, hiking, swimming in the pond, kayaks, and relaxation - all without leaving the property!  You'll be close to white water rafting, rock climbing and skiing in winter, but once you settle into this 80-acre estate, you won't want to leave.
Maple Fork Lodge is a wonderfully secluded property - well off the road.  With eighty acres to explore and mountaintop views that will take your breath away - it's the perfect place for relaxing with family and friends.  The decor isn't stuffy and formal - but designed to make large groups seem cozy and intimate.
*Please note that this lodge, as any true lodge, has a number of large taxidermy animals.


Within a short drive of dozens of restaurants, movie theaters and shopping, as well as activities like mini-golf, hiking the New River Gorge, and an indoor climbing wall.
The lodge comes fully stocked with sheets, towels, kitchen utensils, coffee makers, crock pot and instat pot, toilet paper, etcetera.  Just bring yourselves!

This finely-appointed, 5600-square-foot log cabin is perfect for your family reunion, rafting trip, church or corporate retreat.

Guests will be provided with contact numbers of the house manager and property manager. They are also welcome at any time to contact the owners through Airbnb.

It's a quiet, peaceful neighborhood, but you can't see much of it from the lodge, because it's set back 500 yards off the road.

Great hiking, fishing and swimming in the ponds, and exploring the mountains are all yours without leaving the property!

Maple Fork Lodge Kitchen Inventory

We have a fully stocked kitchen with silverware, dishware, glassware, pots, pans, bakeware and serving dishes as well as the following:
Electric griddle 
Large crock pot
Hand mixer
Electric knife
StirCrazy popcorn popper
12c coffee pots x2
Coffee Grinder
Keurig
Blender
Food processor
Toaster and toaster oven
Juicer
Large roasting oven
Microwave
Instant pot
Double Oven
Dishwasher
Extra Refrigerator
An outdoor gas grill
Various spices and baking supplies (selection may vary)

sectionedDescription/access: With rental you have access to the entire house with the exception of the garage.
sectionedDescription/description:
Families, Couples, Reunions, Guys Trip, Girls Trip and many other groups head to West Virginia to enjoys time on top of Browning Lambert Mountain. Whether you desire the ultimate experience in off road riding on local or Hatfield-McCoy Trails, rafting, hiking, snow skiing or sight seeing; Southern West Virginia has a little something for everyone. Enjoy your privacy beside our fire pit,  during corn hole competition, or while grilling a favorite meal after a long day on top of the mountain.

The Lodge is located on top of Browning Lambert Mountain.  The Lodge is located on the Hatfield McCoy Trail System and adjacent to local trails.  Pocahontas is the closest Trail System to the Lodge with direct access to Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek and Warrior Trail Systems.  The Lodge has 3 bedrooms and 3 baths, a fully appointed kitchen and Living Room.  There is a covered front porch which allows access to the Lodge and Loft (Bedroom 3), a covered deck accessed from the living room and an uncovered outdoor deck.  The property has 2 fire pits, 2 charcoal grills, a gas grill and has a fenced in back yard which can be used to secure vehicles and  other items you would like to keep under lock and key.

With rental you have access to the entire house with the exception of the garage.

I am available for questions about the Lodge as well as in emergency situations.

The Lodge is located in a rural West Virginia community at the top of a mountain.

The lodge boasts ample parking of large truck/trailer combinations and a circle drive for easy turn around.  Guests can access local towns such as Bramwell and Bluewell on their ATV or in their vehicles.

Wifi is available through StarLink
